original: de dag 'dogs par byed pas khas blangs pa la gnod pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag 'dogs par byed pas khas blangs pa la gnod pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the assertions of the opponent are not undermined, the text says:🔽Therefore, when a single person arises, it is for the benefit of many beings and for the happiness of many beings.

original: des na gang zag gcig kho na 'byung ba na skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba'i phyir 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen nga la brten nas sems can rnams skye ba'i chos can rnams skye ba'i sdug bsngal las rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: des na gang zag gcig kho na 'byung ba na skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba'i phyir 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen nga la brten nas sems can rnams skye ba'i chos can rnams skye ba'i sdug bsngal las rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: In the same way, it is said that “by relying on me as a spiritual friend, sentient beings who are subject to birth are liberated from the suffering of birth.”

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way, it is said:

original: yongs su shes bya yongs shes shing //
analyzed: yongs su shes bya yongs shes shing //
translated: The object of complete knowledge is completely known,

original: spang bar bya ba spangs par gyur //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba spangs par gyur //
translated: The object of abandonment is abandoned,

original: bsgom par bya ba bsgoms zin pas //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba bsgoms zin pas //
translated: The object of meditation is meditated,

original: bzod ldan de phyir nga sangs rgyas //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung khas blangs pa la yang gnod pa med do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bzod ldan de phyir nga sangs rgyas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung khas blangs pa la yang gnod pa med do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, I, the patient one, am a buddha.🔽Thus, the opponent’s assertions are not undermined.

original: gal te don dam par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te don dam par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that the Buddha’s words are not undermined by the ultimate,

original: ji skad smras pa'i skyon ldog pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pas phung po lnga la brten nas tha snyad dang @190a * //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i skyon ldog pa med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pas phung po lnga la brten nas tha snyad dang @190a * //
translated: They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the Great Vehicle, because they accept the five bases of knowable objects.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the Great Perfection, because they accept the three natures.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the hearers, because they accept the three jewels.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the Great Vehicle, because they accept the ten grounds.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the Great Perfection, because they accept the four yogas.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the hearers, because they accept the four truths.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the Great Vehicle, because they accept the four noble truths.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the Great Perfection, because they accept the four yogas.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the hearers, because they accept the four reliances.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the Great Vehicle, because they accept the four reliances.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the Great Perfection, because they accept the four yogas.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the hearers, because they accept the four noble lineages.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the Great Vehicle, because they accept the four noble lineages.

original: rjes su mthun par thams cad mkhyen pa btags pa dang / lung khas blangs pa de dag don dam par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon ji skad smras pa ldog pa med de /
analyzed: rjes su mthun par thams cad mkhyen pa btags pa dang / lung khas blangs pa de dag don dam par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon ji skad smras pa ldog pa med de /
translated: They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the Great Perfection, because they accept the four yogas.

original: son gnas so zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //🔽de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: son gnas so zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the hearers, because they accept the four abodes of Brahmā.🔽They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the Great Vehicle, because they accept the four abodes of Brahmā.

original: don dam par de yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / de ltar khas ma blangs pa kho nar 'gog par byed pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don dam par de yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / de ltar khas ma blangs pa kho nar 'gog par byed pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: They say that the Followers of the Middle Way accept the scriptures of the Great Perfection,

original: khyed la don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa dang lung de dag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / kho bos don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa dang / lung de dag yod pa de ltar khas ma blangs pa kho nar 'gog par byed pa'i phyir kho bo la khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: khyed la don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa dang lung de dag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / kho bos don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa dang / lung de dag yod pa de ltar khas ma blangs pa kho nar 'gog par byed pa'i phyir kho bo la khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Because you have no inference that ultimately the Tathāgata and those scriptures exist, and because we refute only the assertion that the Tathāgata and those scriptures exist ultimately, we do not commit the error of contradicting our own tenets.

original: mu stegs can ngan pa mig nad na bas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od zer mi bzod pa bzhin du stobs bcu dri ma med pa'i dkyil 'khor sa thams cad snang bar mdzad pa'i gsung ma nor ba'i 'od zer mi bzod pa dag gis smras pa zhes bya
analyzed: mu stegs can ngan pa mig nad na bas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od zer mi bzod pa bzhin du stobs bcu dri ma med pa'i dkyil 'khor sa thams cad snang bar mdzad pa'i gsung ma nor ba'i 'od zer mi bzod pa dag gis smras pa zhes bya
translated: Like bad tīrthikas who, due to an eye disease, cannot bear the light of the sun’s orb, they cannot bear the unmistaken light rays of the speech that illuminates all grounds, the stainless orb of the ten powers.

original: ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The phrase “they said” and so on indicates that

original: mu stegs byed glang po'i rigs can ngan pa dper na mig nad na bas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od zer la brtag par mi bzod pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa stobs bcu dri ma med pa'i dkyil 'khor srid pa gsum gyis cha dang bcas pa thams
analyzed: mu stegs byed glang po'i rigs can ngan pa dper na mig nad na bas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od zer la brtag par mi bzod pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa stobs bcu dri ma med pa'i dkyil 'khor srid pa gsum gyis cha dang bcas pa thams
translated: Just as someone with an eye disease cannot bear to look at the orb of the sun, the tīrthikas, who are evil and of the bovine type, cannot bear to look at the orb of the stainless ten powers of the Tathāgata.🔽

original: cad snang bar mdzad pa'i gsung ma nor ba'i 'od zer nyan par mi bzod pa /
analyzed: cad snang bar mdzad pa'i gsung ma nor ba'i 'od zer nyan par mi bzod pa /
translated: Just as someone with an eye disease cannot bear to look at the light rays of the orb of the sun, the tīrthikas, who are like evil elephants, cannot bear to listen to the unmistaken light rays of the speech of the Tathāgata, which illuminates the entire three realms with the stainless orb of the ten powers.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par smra ba dag /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par smra ba dag /
translated: The tīrthikas say that the Tathāgata is not omniscient.

original: theg pa chen po dbu ma pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung las skyes pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po dbu ma pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung las skyes pa /
translated: The Madhyamaka followers of the Mahāyāna were born from the speech of the Tathāgata.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gsal bar byed pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gsal bar byed pa /
translated: They illuminate the way of the perfection of wisdom.

original: seng ge cang shes lta bus de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i rigs pa ni lcags kyu lta bus sna nas gzung zhing tshar gcad pa ston to ;
analyzed: seng ge cang shes lta bus de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i rigs pa ni lcags kyu lta bus sna nas gzung zhing tshar gcad pa ston to ;
translated: The lion-like one seizes them by the nose with a hook-like reasoning and refutes them.

original: / de'i phyir de dag na re de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / de'i phyir de dag na re de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they say that the Tathāgata is not omniscient,

original: mi yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: mi yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because he is a human being, like other humans.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma yin te /
translated: Or, the wisdom of the Tathāgata is not the wisdom of omniscience,

original: shes pa yin pa'i phyir dper na so so'i skye bo'i @190b shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i phyir dper na so so'i skye bo'i @190b shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is a consciousness, like the consciousness of an ordinary person.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gzhi ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gzhi ma yin te /
translated: Or, the body of the Tathāgata is not the basis of the wisdom of omniscience,

original: lus yin pa'i phyir dper na so so'i skye bo'i lus bzhin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: lus yin pa'i phyir dper na so so'i skye bo'i lus bzhin no zhes zer te /
translated: because it is a body, like the body of an ordinary person.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa phyogs su byas pa dang / ye shes phyogs su byas pa dang / sku phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa phyogs su byas pa dang / ye shes phyogs su byas pa dang / sku phyogs su byas te /
translated: They make the Tathāgata a party, they make wisdom a party, and they make the body a party.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gsum yin te /
translated: These are the three inferences that prove that the Tathāgata is not omniscient.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, they are to be applied in order as the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary here says:

original: de la 'dir don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes ston na ni mi yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la 'dir don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes ston na ni mi yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: If it is taught that the ultimate tathāgata is not omniscient, then the meaning of the logical reason, because he is a human, is not established.

original: chos kyi sku ni mi la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i chos kyi tshogs kyang khams gsum par ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni mi la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i chos kyi tshogs kyang khams gsum par ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the dharmakāya is free from the elaborations of humans and so on and because the collection of supramundane, uncontaminated dharmas is not included in the three realms.

original: 'dis ni pha rol po dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni pha rol po dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
translated: This is saying that the opponents say, “The tathāgata is not omniscient.

original: mi yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes de bzhin gshegs pa phyogs su byas te ;
analyzed: mi yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes de bzhin gshegs pa phyogs su byas te ;
translated: The response to that is as follows: “Because he is a human being, like someone else.”

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par bsgrub pa sun dbyung zhing /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par bsgrub pa sun dbyung zhing /
translated: This is the refutation of the proof that the Tathāgata is not omniscient.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrub pa ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsgrub pa ston te /
translated: This is the teaching of the proof that the Tathāgata is omniscient.

original: de la 'dir pha rol po dag don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes ston na ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs mi ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la 'dir pha rol po dag don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes ston na ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs mi ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: Here, if the opponent teaches that the ultimate Tathāgata is not omniscient, then the meaning of the opponent’s reason, “because he is not a human being,” is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku yin pas chos kyi sku de mi la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku yin pas chos kyi sku de mi la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the ultimate Tathāgata is the dharmakāya, and that dharmakāya is free from the elaborations of humans and so on.

original: chos kyi sku la mi la sogs pa sems can rnams kyi chos gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad med pa'i phyir dang ; don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa thag pa med pa'i chos kyi tshogs stobs bcu la sogs pa che ba'i yon tan rnams kyang khams gsum par ma gtogs pa'i phyir don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa mi nyid yin par ma🔽grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽mi yin @191a * //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la mi la sogs pa sems can rnams kyi chos gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad med pa'i phyir dang ; don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa thag pa med pa'i chos kyi tshogs stobs bcu la sogs pa che ba'i yon tan rnams kyang khams gsum par ma gtogs pa'i phyir don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa mi nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir ro // mi yin @191a * //
translated: Because all phenomena of sentient beings such as humans and so on do not exist in the dharmakāya, and because the qualities of the great qualities of the ten powers and so on of the supramundane, noncomposite, ultimate tathāgata are not included in the three realms, the ultimate tathāgata is not established as a human.

original: pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
analyzed: pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only is the meaning of the reason “because he is a human” not established,

original: de'i phyir 'dis byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon dag kyang shes par bya zhing zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon dag kyang shes par bya zhing zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: but also because of that, one should understand the faults of reasons such as “because he is a creator” and so on.

original: pha rol po dag de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: pha rol po dag de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te ;
translated: The opponent says, “The Tathāgata is not omniscient,

original: byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gang dag ji snyed brjod du zin kyang don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs su de dag mi rung ste /
analyzed: byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gang dag ji snyed brjod du zin kyang don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs su de dag mi rung ste /
translated: Although you may state any number of reasons such as “because it is a product,” they are not suitable as reasons for the ultimate Tathāgata not being omniscient.

original: dper na sgra ni rtag te mig gi gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin du thams cad ma grub pa'i skyon dag kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra ni rtag te mig gi gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin du thams cad ma grub pa'i skyon dag kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: For example, just as the statement “Sound is permanent because it is apprehended by the eye” is, you should understand that all the faults of nonestablishment are similar.🔽The faults of the examples of ordinary people and so on should be stated.

original: mi phal pa la sogs pa'i dpe'i skyon dag kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gis dpe ma grub par ston te /
analyzed: mi phal pa la sogs pa'i dpe'i skyon dag kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gis dpe ma grub par ston te /
translated: This shows that the examples of the counterparts are not established.

original: pha rol po dag na re dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes zer ba'i dpe mi phal pa la sogs pa khas blangs pa de dag kyang kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir gang gis de bzhin gshegs
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes zer ba'i dpe mi phal pa la sogs pa khas blangs pa de dag kyang kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir gang gis de bzhin gshegs
translated: The counterparts say, “For example, it is like something else.” The examples of ordinary people and so on that they accept are also in our system, because ultimately all phenomena are not produced.

original: pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa mtshon pa'i dper rung ba /
analyzed: pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa mtshon pa'i dper rung ba /
translated: It is not suitable as an example illustrating someone who is not omniscient.

original: mi phal pa la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa yang yod pa ma yin pas pha rol po dag gi dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mi phal pa la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa yang yod pa ma yin pas pha rol po dag gi dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: And since there are no ordinary beings who are not omniscient, you should also state the error that the exemplificand of the opponent is not established.

original: de ltar pha rol po dag la don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dang / dpe med pas don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du grub pas rnam pa de nyid kyis kho bo cag gi 'dod pa grub po /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol po dag la don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dang / dpe med pas don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du grub pas rnam pa de nyid kyis kho bo cag gi 'dod pa grub po /
translated: Since the opponent has no reason or example to prove that the ultimate Tathāgata is not omniscient, the ultimate Tathāgata is established as omniscient. Therefore, by that very mode, our own position is established.

original: pha rol po'i sgrub pa sun dbyung ba dang / rang dbang du rjes su dpag pas thams cad mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par sgrub pa de sun phyung bas de'i phyir kho bo cag gis khyed tshar bcad cing bdag cag rgyal bar byas so //
analyzed: pha rol po'i sgrub pa sun dbyung ba dang / rang dbang du rjes su dpag pas thams cad mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par sgrub pa de sun phyung bas de'i phyir kho bo cag gis khyed tshar bcad cing bdag cag rgyal bar byas so //
translated: The refutation of the opponent’s proof and the refutation of the autonomous inference that proves that the Omniscient One is not omniscient, therefore, we have defeated you and we have won.🔽With respect to the side of wisdom, the faults of the reason and example in the same way, and the faults of the reason that apprehends it and the possession of an object, and so on, should be stated.

original: ye shes kyi phyogs la yang rnam pa de nyid kyis gtan tshigs dang / dpe'i skyon dag dang / de'i gtan tshigs 'dzin pa nyid dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon dag kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma yin te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi phyogs la yang rnam pa de nyid kyis gtan tshigs dang / dpe'i skyon dag dang / de'i gtan tshigs 'dzin pa nyid dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon dag kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma yin te /
translated: The opponent’s proof that the wisdom of the Tathāgata is not the wisdom of an omniscient one,

original: shes pa yin pa'i @191b phyir dper na so so'i skye bo'i shes pa bzhin no zhes ye shes phyogs su byas te /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par bsgrub pa sun dbyung zhing /
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i @191b phyir dper na so so'i skye bo'i shes pa bzhin no zhes ye shes phyogs su byas te /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par bsgrub pa sun dbyung zhing /
translated: because it is a consciousness, like the consciousness of an ordinary being, is refuted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes nyid yin par bsgrub pa ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes nyid yin par bsgrub pa ston te /

translated: Because they are objects of knowledge, like placing a flawless jewel in the palm of one's hand. In this way, through the power of inference based on one's own experience, it is established that the Blessed One is omniscient.

translated: Or, the meaning of the term “omniscience” in the statement by the Bhagavat, “I am omniscient,” exists, because it is stated.

original: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang / grags pas gnod de zhes bya ba ni 'on te pha rol po dag gis dam bcas pa'i de'i don cung zad kyang mi mkhyen pa yin na ni de lta na phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang grags pas gnod par 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //

translated: If the opponent does not know the meaning of that term even slightly, then the former position is undermined and is undermined by what is commonly held.

original: ji ltar phyogs snga ma la gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar phyogs snga ma la gnod par 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: de ni mi yin pa'i phyir zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: sngar pha rol po dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /

original: mi yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir mi yin no zhes sngar khas blangs pa'i phyogs la da 'dir chung zad kyang mi mkhyen pa nyid do zhes dam bcas pas gnod @193a * //🔽par 'gyur te /

analyzed: mi yin na ni chung zad kyang mi shes pa'i chos med pa'i phyir dam bcas pa de'i don 'gal bas ma grub po //
translated: This is because the meaning of the thesis is contradictory.

original: ji ltar grags pas gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar grags pas gnod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that the opponent’s thesis is undermined by what is commonly acknowledged?

analyzed: so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i dpe dag 'jig rten la grags pas mi rung ste /
translated: The examples of ordinary beings and so on are not suitable because they are commonly acknowledged in the world.

translated: The example of a common being who is not omniscient, which the opponent himself accepts, is contradicted by what is commonly acknowledged in the world.

original: 'di ltar 'di na dud 'gro zas dang / gnas dang / nyal ba dang / 'khrig pa'i 'du shes bzhi pa dag gis kyang de dag tsam shes na mi la sogs pa gzhan gyis yul 'ga' zhig shes pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na dud 'gro zas dang / gnas dang / nyal ba dang / 'khrig pa'i 'du shes bzhi pa dag gis kyang de dag tsam shes na mi la sogs pa gzhan gyis yul 'ga' zhig shes pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: For in the world, even animals are seen to know just enough to get food, shelter, sleep, and sex. So what need is there to speak of other humans knowing some things?

original: de'i phyir dam bcas pa de 'jig rten la grags pa dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir yang ma grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bcas pa de 'jig rten la grags pa dang 'gal ba'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir yang ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, because the thesis is undermined by contradiction of what is commonly acknowledged in the world, it is not established.

original: gzhan yang pha rol po dag na re tha snyad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa zas gtsang gi rigs su skyes pa 'di la mi nyid dang / smra ba po nyid grub pas de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig de yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang pha rol po dag na re tha snyad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa zas gtsang gi rigs su skyes pa 'di la mi nyid dang / smra ba po nyid grub pas de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig de yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: Moreover, the statement “This Tathāgata of conventional truth who was born into the Śākya clan is a human and a speaker, and therefore he is not omniscient” is also not established.

original: 'di ltar dam pa'i chos pa da ma dkar po'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'di ltar dam pa'i chos pa da ma dkar po'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra of the White Lotus of the Sacred Teachings says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal snga nas /🔽bskal pa grangs med pa'i snga rol nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes 'byung bas tha snyad kyi sgo nas kyang rnam par dag pa'i lha nyid yin pas mi nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi nyid
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal snga nas / bskal pa grangs med pa'i snga rol nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes 'byung bas tha snyad kyi sgo nas kyang rnam par dag pa'i lha nyid yin pas mi nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi nyid
translated: The Bhagavat said:🔽“I fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment incalculable eons ago.”

original: du yang ma grub la /
analyzed: du yang ma grub la /
translated: Since he is a pure god even conventionally, he is not a human, and therefore he is not established as a human.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra Teaching the Secrets of the Tathāgatas says:

original: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi nub mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas gang gi nub mo phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi nub mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas gang gi nub mo phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya
translated: Śāntamati, from the night when the Tathāgata fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening until the night when he will pass into parinirvāṇa in the dhātu without remainder of the aggregates,🔽

original: ngan las 'das ba'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pas tha na yi ge gcig tsam yang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: ngan las 'das ba'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pas tha na yi ge gcig tsam yang ma gsungs so //
translated: Śāntamati, from the night when the Tathāgata fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening until the night when he will pass into parinirvāṇa in the dhātu without remainder of the aggregates, the Tathāgata has not uttered even a single syllable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa @193b ste ;🔽dbugs 'byung bar yang mi mdzad /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa @193b ste ; dbugs 'byung bar yang mi mdzad /
translated: Śāntamati, the Tathāgata is always in equipoise.🔽He does not exhale.

original: dbugs rngub par yang mi mdzad /🔽rnam bar rtog par yang mi mdzad /
analyzed: dbugs rngub par yang mi mdzad / rnam bar rtog par yang mi mdzad /
translated: He does not inhale.🔽He does not conceptualize.

original: rnam par dpyod par yang mi mdzad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod par yang mi mdzad pa'i phyir te /
translated: He does not analyze.

original: 'di ltar sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gi shugs kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gi shugs kyis /
translated: Because of the power of his previous aspirations,

original: lhun gyis grub pas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa tshim bar byed pa'i gsung yang 'byung la /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa tshim bar byed pa'i gsung yang 'byung la /
translated: The speech that satisfies the wishes of sentient beings arises spontaneously,🔽and the three vehicles are also taught.

original: theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa yang ston to zhes 'byung bas tha snyad kyi sgo nas kyang gsung brjod pa mi mnga' bas smra ba po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir smra ba po nyid du ma grub pas /
analyzed: theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa yang ston to zhes 'byung bas tha snyad kyi sgo nas kyang gsung brjod pa mi mnga' bas smra ba po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir smra ba po nyid du ma grub pas /
translated: Therefore, because the Buddha does not speak conventionally, he is not a speaker. Since he is not established as a speaker,

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag la ni khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag la ni khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med do //
translated: we are not undermined with respect to our assertion.

original: ji ste gzhan dag gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar du gtogs pa dang / ma gtogs pa dag ji ltar shes pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mkhyen to zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ste gzhan dag gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar du gtogs pa dang / ma gtogs pa dag ji ltar shes pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mkhyen to zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the Bhagavān does not know the past, future, and present in the way that others do, then that is establishing what is already established.

original: de dag gis log pa'i shes pas shes bya log par shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ste pha rol po dag 'di skad ces lha chen po dang / khyab 'jug dang / rkang mig dang / 'phel ba dang / ser skya dang /🔽gzegs zan la sogs pa dag gis dus gsum gyi khongs su gtogs pa dang ma gtogs pa'i dngos po dag ji ltar shes pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin
analyzed: de dag gis log pa'i shes pas shes bya log par shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ste pha rol po dag 'di skad ces lha chen po dang / khyab 'jug dang / rkang mig dang / 'phel ba dang / ser skya dang / gzegs zan la sogs pa dag gis dus gsum gyi khongs su gtogs pa dang ma gtogs pa'i dngos po dag ji ltar shes pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin
translated: “Because they know objects of knowledge that are wrongly cognized by wrong consciousness” is this: If the opponent says, “The great god, Viṣṇu, Akṣapāda, Kaṇāda, Kapila, and so on know things that are included in the three times and not included in the three times, but the Bhagavat does not know them, therefore he is not omniscient,” then that is establishing what is already established for us.

original: / lha chen po la sogs pa de dag gis log pa'i shes pas shes bya ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid log par shes pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das so so yang dag par rig pa'i mkhyen par kho bo cag gi gzhung la yang grub pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / lha chen po la sogs pa de dag gis log pa'i shes pas shes bya ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid log par shes pa de ltar bcom ldan 'das so so yang dag par rig pa'i mkhyen par kho bo cag gi gzhung la yang grub pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because those great gods and so on know objects of knowledge that exist in the number of things that are wrongly cognized by wrong consciousness and know objects of knowledge that exist in the way they are wrongly cognized, the Bhagavat knows them with the knowledge of the correct and discerning awareness. Therefore that is also illogical.

original: ji ste mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ngan pa mkhyen pa'o zhe na ni kho bo cag gi ston pa thams cad shes pa'o zhes sgrub pa rnams kyi rang gi ston pa dag gi gtan tshigs thams cad ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: ji ste mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ngan pa mkhyen pa'o zhe na ni kho bo cag gi ston pa thams cad shes pa'o zhes sgrub pa rnams kyi rang gi ston pa dag gi gtan tshigs thams cad ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni
translated: But if you say that he does not know them, then it is bad that he knows them.

original: ji ste pha rol po dag 'di skad ces thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyu med pa dang ; mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang / rtag pa dang chad par lta ba la sogs pa ngan pa dag mkhyen pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: ji ste pha rol po dag 'di skad ces thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyu med pa dang ; mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang / rtag pa dang chad par lta ba la sogs pa ngan pa dag mkhyen pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: But if the opponent says, “He is not omniscient because he knows bad things such as causelessness, incompatible causes, eternalism, nihilism, and so on,” then the reason is not established.

original: 'di na mu stegs can dag kho bo cag gi ston pa rdzogs byed la sogs thams cad shes pa'o zhes bsgrub pa rnams kyi rang gi ston pa rdzogs byed la @194a * //
analyzed: 'di na mu stegs can dag kho bo cag gi ston pa rdzogs byed la sogs thams cad shes pa'o zhes bsgrub pa rnams kyi rang gi ston pa rdzogs byed la @194a * //
translated: Here, the tīrthikas say, “Our teacher Pūraṇa is omniscient.”

original: sogs pa dag rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang / rtag pa dang / chad par lta ba la sogs pa ngan pa dag shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par mthong bas des na ji re zhig ngan pa mkhyen pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'gyur ram ;
analyzed: sogs pa dag rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang / rtag pa dang / chad par lta ba la sogs pa ngan pa dag shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par mthong bas des na ji re zhig ngan pa mkhyen pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'gyur ram ;
translated: and so on, that is, the bad views of causelessness, incompatible causes, eternalism, and nihilism, and so on, he would not be omniscient.

original: 'on te ngan par shes pas rdzogs byed la sogs pa dag thams cad shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs thams cad ma nges pa nyid yin pas de yang gyi na'o //🔽dpyod pa can dag gi ni rgyal dpog la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mu stegs dpyod ba can rig byed kyi mtha' gsang ba sra ba dag gi gzhung las 'jig rten na thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya
analyzed: 'on te ngan par shes pas rdzogs byed la sogs pa dag thams cad shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs thams cad ma nges pa nyid yin pas de yang gyi na'o // dpyod pa can dag gi ni rgyal dpog la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mu stegs dpyod ba can rig byed kyi mtha' gsang ba sra ba dag gi gzhung las 'jig rten na thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya
translated: But if you say that because he knows the bad, the Tathāgata is not omniscient, or that because he knows the bad, Pūraṇa and so on are not omniscient, then all of your reasons are indeterminate, and so your argument is inconclusive.🔽The Lokāyata and so on of the Mīmāṃsakas are indeterminate, and so on.

original: ba ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: ba ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: This passage explains that according to the tīrthika Mīmāṃsakas, who are the upholders of the secret and rigid Vedānta, there is no omniscient one in the world.

original: rig byed 'ba' zhig yong gi rtag pa byed pa po gzhan med pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas shes pa can gzhan ni kha cig ni yang dag pa'i shes pa can yin /
analyzed: rig byed 'ba' zhig yong gi rtag pa byed pa po gzhan med pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas shes pa can gzhan ni kha cig ni yang dag pa'i shes pa can yin /
translated: Some say: The Vedas alone are eternal and there is no other permanent creator.

original: kha cig ni log pa'i shes pa can yin par zad kyi /
analyzed: kha cig ni log pa'i shes pa can yin par zad kyi /
translated: Some say: Some are omniscient and some possess correct knowledge and some possess wrong knowledge.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa gzhan 'ga' yang med pas de bzhin gshegs pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa gzhan 'ga' yang med pas de bzhin gshegs pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: But there is no other omniscient being. Therefore the Tathagata is not omniscient.

original: de dag gi gzhung de yang 'di na dpyod pa can dag nyid kyi ston pa rgyal dpog la sogs pa dag kyang rigs byed kyi mtha' smra bar zad kyi /
analyzed: de dag gi gzhung de yang 'di na dpyod pa can dag nyid kyi ston pa rgyal dpog la sogs pa dag kyang rigs byed kyi mtha' smra bar zad kyi /
translated: Some say: The texts of the Lokayatas are merely the assertions of their teacher Brihaspati and so on.

original: rang nyid thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par mthong bas des na ji re zhig rig byed thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rang nyid thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par mthong bas des na ji re zhig rig byed thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: But since they are not omniscient, how could the Tathagata be omniscient because the Vedas are not omniscient?

original: 'on te rgyal dpog la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas des kyang gzhung mi tshugs so zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'on te rgyal dpog la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pas des kyang gzhung mi tshugs so zhes ston to //
translated: But it is not certain that the Jaina and so on are not omniscient, and therefore your scriptures are not established.

original: de'i phyir de dag la brgal zhing brtag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la brgal zhing brtag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the refutation and investigation of those,

original: re zhig rab rib kyis zil gyis non pa de dag la /
analyzed: re zhig rab rib kyis zil gyis non pa de dag la /
translated: first, this is said to those who are overcome by cataracts:

original: 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di skad ces dri bar bya ste /
translated: You should be asked this:

original: gang gis zhes bya ba gang gi ngo bo nyid shes pa de yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba gang gi ngo bo nyid shes pa de yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “That by which” means that the one who knows the nature of that is said to possess correct knowledge.

original: khyed na re rig byed 'ba' zhig yong gi rtag pa byed pa po gzhan med la /
analyzed: khyed na re rig byed 'ba' zhig yong gi rtag pa byed pa po gzhan med la /
translated: You say that the Vedas alone are permanent, and that there is no other permanent creator.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa yin pas shes pa can gzhan ni kha cig ni yang dag pa'i shes pa can yin /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa yin pas shes pa can gzhan ni kha cig ni yang dag pa'i shes pa can yin /
translated: Since they are omniscient, some are said to possess correct knowledge,

original: kha cig ni log pa'i shes pa can yin par zad kyi /
analyzed: kha cig ni log pa'i shes pa can yin par zad kyi /
translated: and some are said to possess false knowledge.

original: thams @194b cad mkhyen pa gzhan 'ga' yang med pas de bzhin gshegs pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: thams @194b cad mkhyen pa gzhan 'ga' yang med pas de bzhin gshegs pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: and there is no other omniscient being, then the Tathāgata is not omniscient.

original: 'o na shes pa can gzhan dag las gang gis zhes bya ba /
analyzed: 'o na shes pa can gzhan dag las gang gis zhes bya ba /
translated: “Well then, what is the knowledge of others?”

original: gang gi ngo bo nyid shes pa de yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan par brjod pa smros shig ces dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo nyid shes pa de yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan par brjod pa smros shig ces dri bar bya'o //
translated: “Tell us, what is the knowledge of the nature of reality of one who is said to possess correct knowledge?”

original: de skad ces dris pa na ;🔽de dag gal te 'di skad ces 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di 'o zhes de dag grub pa'i mtha' yongs su bzung ste smra na zhes bya ba ni de skad ces dris pa na /
analyzed: de skad ces dris pa na ; de dag gal te 'di skad ces 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di 'o zhes de dag grub pa'i mtha' yongs su bzung ste smra na zhes bya ba ni de skad ces dris pa na /
translated: When they are asked this,🔽if they say, “The nature of reality is this,” and they state their philosophical position,

original: de dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi ston pa rgyal dpog la sogs pa 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa 'di yon no //
analyzed: de dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gi ston pa rgyal dpog la sogs pa 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa 'di yon no //
translated: then when they are asked this, they say, “The nature of reality of our teacher, Kaṇāda, and so on, is this. He possesses correct knowledge. He is a teacher.”

original: khyed kyi ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa 'di yin no zhes de dag rang gi grub pa'i mtha' yongs su bzung ste smra na 'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa 'di'i ngo bo nyid ni log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa 'di yin no zhes de dag rang gi grub pa'i mtha' yongs su bzung ste smra na 'o //
translated: If you say that the nature of this Tathagata, your teacher, is that he possesses wrong awareness, then you are advocating your own tenets.

original: de dag de skad smra na /🔽'grel pa byed bas de dag la /
analyzed: de dag de skad smra na / 'grel pa byed bas de dag la /
translated: If they say that,🔽the commentator says that he will extensively explain the refutations of them

original: dgag pa skabs ji ltar gsungs pa dag rgya cher brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽'di na rgyal dpog la sogs pa dang so so'i skye bo gzhan dag kyang rig byed ma yin pas log pa'i shes pa dang ldan par mthong bas des na ji re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa rig byed ma yin pas so so'i skye bo gzhan dag bzhin du
analyzed: dgag pa skabs ji ltar gsungs pa dag rgya cher brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te / 'di na rgyal dpog la sogs pa dang so so'i skye bo gzhan dag kyang rig byed ma yin pas log pa'i shes pa dang ldan par mthong bas des na ji re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa rig byed ma yin pas so so'i skye bo gzhan dag bzhin du
translated: just as they are set forth in the Prasannapada.🔽Here, since it is seen that even the Lokayatas and other ordinary beings possess nonindicative form, then how could the Tathagata possess wrong awareness like other ordinary beings?

original: log pa'i shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ram /
translated: Would they possess a distorted consciousness?🔽🔽

original: 'on te rgyal dpog la sogs pa dag rig byed ma yin pas so so'i skye bo gzhan dag bzhin du log pa'i shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur bam nges pas de bzhin gshegs pa log pa'i shes pa dang ldan par ma grub po zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'on te rgyal dpog la sogs pa dag rig byed ma yin pas so so'i skye bo gzhan dag bzhin du log pa'i shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur bam nges pas de bzhin gshegs pa log pa'i shes pa dang ldan par ma grub po zhes bya ba dang /
translated: The Vedas state:

original: rig byed nyid las gang zhig glang po che thal kar mche ba drug dang ldan par sbrul te /
analyzed: rig byed nyid las gang zhig glang po che thal kar mche ba drug dang ldan par sbrul te /
translated: One who is born from a mother’s womb and who emanates as a white elephant with six tusks and🔽who enters his mother’s womb and is born and drinks from the ocean of all objects of knowledge is omniscient in the world.

original: yum gyi lhums su zhugs shing 'khrungs nas shes bya'i rgya mtsho thams cad 'thung ba de ni 'jig rten na thams cad mkhyen ba nyid yin no zhes 'byung ba de zla gzhan med pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin par nges pa'i gtan
analyzed: yum gyi lhums su zhugs shing 'khrungs nas shes bya'i rgya mtsho thams cad 'thung ba de ni 'jig rten na thams cad mkhyen ba nyid yin no zhes 'byung ba de zla gzhan med pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin par nges pa'i gtan
translated: Since there is no other moon, it is certain that the Tathāgata himself is omniscience.

original: tshigs dag rgya cher brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshigs dag rgya cher brjod par bya ste /
translated: I will extensively explain the reasons for that.

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pa grub po //
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pa grub po //
translated: Therefore omniscience is established.

original: gang dag mkhas par rlom pas 'khrul pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gang dag mkhas par rlom pas 'khrul pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: Some who are arrogant about their knowledge say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te /
translated: The Tathagata is not omniscient,

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po lung ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / mdzes ldan ma gsod pa ma sbran pa'i phyir @195a * //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po lung ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / mdzes ldan ma gsod pa ma sbran pa'i phyir @195a * //
