analyzed: gtso bo dang skyes bu'o zhe na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag na re thams cad ces bya ba nam mkha'i gos can dag 'dod pa'i srog la sogs pa dag gam / bye brag pa dag 'dod pa'i tshig gi don drug gi rdzas dag gam /
translated: if the opponent says that all refers to life force and so on, which are asserted by the Naked Ascetics,🔽the six categories, which are asserted by the Vaisheshikas,

original: grangs can dag 'dod pa'i gtso bo dang skyes bu'o zhe na'o //
analyzed: grangs can dag 'dod pa'i gtso bo dang skyes bu'o zhe na'o //
translated: or prakriti and purusha, which are asserted by the Samkhyas,

original: de dag thams cad ma yin par dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ma yin par dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to refute that all refers to those,

original: de dag de ltar ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de dag de ltar ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: since they do not exist inherently in that way,

original: de dag thams cad nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /🔽srog la sogs pa de dag ni de ltar ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te / srog la sogs pa de dag ni de ltar ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But they are not all of that nature.🔽Life force and so on do not exist by their own intrinsic reality because they are not produced, like a sky flower.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin pas de'i phyir de dag thams cad nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas de lung ma bstan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin pas de'i phyir de dag thams cad nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas de lung ma bstan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes byar mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, because they are not all of that nature, it is not tenable to say, “The Tathāgata is not omniscient because he did not prophesy that.”

original: gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason’s basis is not established.

original: ji ste spyi bo zhe na ni zhes bya bas ni ji ste pha rol po dag na re thams cad ces bya ba yod pa nyid ce 'am /
analyzed: ji ste spyi bo zhe na ni zhes bya bas ni ji ste pha rol po dag na re thams cad ces bya ba yod pa nyid ce 'am /
translated: If you say, “The head,” then if you say, “all” refers to a universal,

original: rta nyid ce 'am /
analyzed: rta nyid ce 'am /
translated: like “horseness” or “cow-ness,”

original: ba lang nyid ces bya ba lta bu'i spyi chen po dang / nyi tshe ba'i spyi zhes bya ba dngos po thams cad dang / kha cig la khyad par med pa'i tshig gi don zhig yod pa ste /
analyzed: ba lang nyid ces bya ba lta bu'i spyi chen po dang / nyi tshe ba'i spyi zhes bya ba dngos po thams cad dang / kha cig la khyad par med pa'i tshig gi don zhig yod pa ste /
translated: or a universal that is a particular, or a word meaning that is not differentiated in some things,

original: de bye brag tu lung ma bstan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhe na'o //
analyzed: de bye brag tu lung ma bstan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhe na'o //
translated: because it is not specified, it is not omniscient.

original: de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute that, he says:

original: des de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen te bya ba smras te /
analyzed: des de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen te bya ba smras te /
translated: He knows them to be realityless just as it is.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa des spyi de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa des spyi de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen te /
translated: The Tathagata knows those universals to be realityless just as it is.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du lung bstan pas /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du lung bstan pas /
translated: By teaching realitylessness,

original: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: the opponent's reason is not established.

original: spyi de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ji ltar mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: spyi de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ji ltar mkhyen ce na /
translated: How does he know those universals to be realityless?

original: de ltar ni bstan kyang yin la ston par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ltar ni bstan kyang yin la ston par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says, He teaches and will teach that.

original: bstan bcos 'di @200a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di @200a * //
translated: In this treatise

original: nyid las so //
analyzed: nyid las so //
translated: itself.

original: dpyod pa can dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa can dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some of the logicians say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas smras pa yin te /
translated: The scriptures of the Tathagata are spoken by one who is not omniscient.

original: byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na bye brag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no zhes bya bas ni mu stegs dpyod pa can dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na bye brag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no zhes bya bas ni mu stegs dpyod pa can dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: The statement, Because it has an author, like the treatises of the Vaisesikas, is a syllogism that proves that the Tathagata is not omniscient.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab byed pa po dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyis thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par smras pas de ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te /🔽de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab byed pa po dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyis thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par smras pas de ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i tshig yin te / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: This is because some non-Buddhist logicians claim that the scriptures of the Tathagata are not the word of an omniscient being because they have an author.🔽The subject, the scriptures of the Tathagata, are established as not being the word of an omniscient being because they have an author.

original: dper na bye brag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos 'di ni byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas smras pa yin pas /
analyzed: dper na bye brag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos 'di ni byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas smras pa yin pas /
translated: The example is the treatises of the Vaisesikas, which are not the word of an omniscient being because they have an author.

original: de ston pa gzegs zan la sogs pa dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyang byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas smras pa yin pas de ston pa de bzhin
analyzed: de ston pa gzegs zan la sogs pa dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyang byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas smras pa yin pas de ston pa de bzhin
translated: And just as the teacher Kanada and so on are not omniscient, so too the scriptures of the Tathagata are not omniscient because they are produced by a person.

original: gshegs pa nyid kyang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gshegs pa nyid kyang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore the Tathagata who teaches them is not omniscient.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary says:

original: de dag ni dam bcas pa'i don kyang rnam par brtags nas snga ma bzhin du skyon brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag ni dam bcas pa'i don kyang rnam par brtags nas snga ma bzhin du skyon brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “Having analyzed the meaning of the thesis, the fault should be stated as before.”

original: 'dis ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas smras pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don kyang re zhig gang yin /🔽ci thams cad ni mi mkhyen la cung zad mkhyen pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'dis ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas smras pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don kyang re zhig gang yin / ci thams cad ni mi mkhyen la cung zad mkhyen pa yin nam /
translated: This means that the meaning of the thesis “They are not omniscient because they speak” should first be analyzed.🔽Is it that they do not know everything but know some things?

original: 'on te cung zad kyang mi mkhyen pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te cung zad kyang mi mkhyen pa yin /
translated: Or is it that they do not know anything at all?

original: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni des ci zhig mi mkhyen par 'dod /
analyzed: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni des ci zhig mi mkhyen par 'dod /
translated: If you assert the former, then what do you assert that he does not know?

original: gal te dbang po las 'das pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po las 'das pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say he does not know what is beyond the sense faculties,

original: des de mkhyen te /
analyzed: des de mkhyen te /
translated: then he does know that.

original: shes bya yin pa'i phyir nyid kyi phyag mthil du nor bu dri ma med pa la sogs pa bzhag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes bya yin pa'i phyir nyid kyi phyag mthil du nor bu dri ma med pa la sogs pa bzhag pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is an object of knowledge, it is like placing a stainless jewel in the palm of one’s hand.

original: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang / grags pas gnod de de ni mi yin pa'i phyir zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i dpe dag 'jig rten la grags pas @200b mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang / grags pas gnod de de ni mi yin pa'i phyir zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i dpe dag 'jig rten la grags pas @200b mi rung ste /
translated: If you assert the latter, then the former is undermined and it is undermined by what is renowned, because you accept that he is a human being, and the examples of ordinary beings and so on are not suitable because they are renowned in the world.

original: de dag gis kyang yul 'ga' zhig shes pa'i phyir ro zhes de dag gi dam bcas pa'i don kyang rnam par brtags nas snga ma bzhin du skyon brjod par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang yul 'ga' zhig shes pa'i phyir ro zhes de dag gi dam bcas pa'i don kyang rnam par brtags nas snga ma bzhin du skyon brjod par bya ba bstan to //
translated: Because they know some objects. Having analyzed the meaning of their assertions, the fault should be stated as before.

original: rig byed ni byed pa po dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: rig byed ni byed pa po dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Vedas are associated with an author.

original: bklag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na bye brag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin pas rig byed kyang byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs byed
analyzed: bklag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na bye brag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin pas rig byed kyang byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs byed
translated: “The Vedas have an author because they are a composition, like a pot, and because they are a composition, like a treatise.”🔽The following is the response of the Buddhist:🔽“The Vedas have an author because they are a composition, like the treatises of the Vaiśeṣikas and so on.”🔽This is the statement of the opponent’s argument.🔽The following is the response of the Buddhist:🔽“The Vedas also have an author because they are a composition, like the treatises of the Naiyāyikas and so on.”

original: pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir dpyod pa can dag gi rig byed kyang byed pa po dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir dpyod pa can dag gi rig byed kyang byed pa po dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: This is the statement of the opponent’s argument.🔽The following is the response of the Buddhist:

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “The Vedas also have an author because they are a composition, like the treatises of the Mīmāṃsakas and so on.”🔽This is the statement of the opponent’s argument.🔽The following is the response of the Buddhist:🔽“The Vedas also have an author because they are a composition, like the treatises of the Vaiśeṣikas and so on.”🔽This is the statement of the opponent’s argument.🔽The following is the response of the Buddhist:🔽“The Vedas also have an author because they are a composition, like the treatises of the Naiyāyikas and so on.”🔽This is the statement of the opponent’s argument.🔽The following is the response of the Buddhist:🔽“The Vedas also have an author because they are a composition, like the treatises of the Mīmāṃsakas and so on.”🔽This is the statement of the opponent’s argument.

original: dper na bye brag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos ni bklag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir byed pa po dang bcas pa yin pa de bzhin du dpyod pa can dag gi rig byed kyang bklag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /🔽byed pa po dang bcas pa yin pas rig byed kyang byed pa po dang bcas pa yin par grub po //
analyzed: dper na bye brag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos ni bklag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir byed pa po dang bcas pa yin pa de bzhin du dpyod pa can dag gi rig byed kyang bklag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir / byed pa po dang bcas pa yin pas rig byed kyang byed pa po dang bcas pa yin par grub po //
translated: Similarly, the Vedas of the Mimaṃsakas are endowed with an author because they are to be read.🔽Therefore the Vedas are established as endowed with an author.

original: des na rig byed smra ba dag gi lung las /🔽rig byed la ni mi smra gang //
analyzed: des na rig byed smra ba dag gi lung las / rig byed la ni mi smra gang //
translated: Thus the Vedas are asserted to be omniscient because it is said in the scriptures of the Vedavādins:🔽What is not stated in the Vedas?

original: rig byed la ni mi snang gang //
analyzed: rig byed la ni mi snang gang //
translated: What does not appear in the Vedas?

original: thams cad med par brjod par bya //
analyzed: thams cad med par brjod par bya //
translated: All are to be expressed.

original: rig byed 'dra ba'i thos pa med //
analyzed: rig byed 'dra ba'i thos pa med //
translated: There is no learning similar to the Vedas.

original: ces 'byung bas rig byed ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir des na re zhig byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces 'byung bas rig byed ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir des na re zhig byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because they are endowed with an author, the Vedas are not eternal.

original: dper na bye brag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas smras pa yin pas de ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'gyur ba yin nam /🔽'on te byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir dpyod pa can dag gi rig byed thams cad mkhyen par 'dod pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa de ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin par 'gyur
analyzed: dper na bye brag pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas smras pa yin pas de ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par 'gyur ba yin nam / 'on te byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir dpyod pa can dag gi rig byed thams cad mkhyen par 'dod pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa de ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin par 'gyur
translated: For example, is the Tathagata not omniscient, since all the scriptures of the Tathagata were spoken by someone who is not omniscient, just like the treatises of the Vaisesikas and so on?🔽Or, just as the Mimāṃsakas assert that the Vedas are omniscient because they have an author, in the same way, since the scriptures of the Tathāgata were spoken by an omniscient being, is the teacher, the Tathāgata, omniscient?

original: ba ma nges pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab ni thams cad mkhyen pa mi ma yin pas smras pa yin te zhes dam @201a
analyzed: ba ma nges pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs byed pa po dang bcas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab ni thams cad mkhyen pa mi ma yin pas smras pa yin te zhes dam @201a
translated: Since this is not certain, the reason that the opponent gives, “because it has an author,” is not certain. Therefore the scriptures of the Tathāgata were spoken by a nonhuman omniscient being.

original: * // bcas pa'i don ma grub pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: * // bcas pa'i don ma grub pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyang thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa yin la /
translated: and the meaning of the words is not established, then the scriptures of the Tathagata are spoken by an omniscient one.

original: de ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin par grub po /🔽// / bam po bdun cu gnyis pa /
analyzed: de ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin par grub po / // / bam po bdun cu gnyis pa /
translated: And the teacher, the Tathagata, is established as being omniscient.

original: ji ste rig byed kyi tshig dag ni byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ste rig byed kyi tshig dag ni byas pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the words of the Vedas are not created🔽because the creator is not remembered,

original: byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir ro zhe zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa can dag byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi rig byed kyi tshig dag byed pa pos byas pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir ro zhe zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa can dag byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi rig byed kyi tshig dag byed pa pos byas pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: the Mimaṃsakas say that the words of the Vedas are not created by a creator because the creator is not remembered.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are applied in order.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says here:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba bstan dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba bstan dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is difficult to demonstrate the pervasion of the reason.

original: rig byed kyi tshig dag ni byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig byed kyi tshig dag ni byas pa ma yin te /
translated: The words of the Vedas are not created,🔽because we do not recall the creator, just like so and so.

original: byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe bstan dka' ba'i phyir de ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe bstan dka' ba'i phyir de ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: It is not good because it is difficult to demonstrate the pervasion of the reason with an example.

original: ji ste khron pa rnying pa'i byed pa po mi dran bzhin no zhe na ni khron pa byas pa yin na ni de byas pa yin pas de'i byed pa po mi dran yang med pa ma yin pas byas pa ma yin pa'i dper yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ji ste khron pa rnying pa'i byed pa po mi dran bzhin no zhe na ni khron pa byas pa yin na ni de byas pa yin pas de'i byed pa po mi dran yang med pa ma yin pas byas pa ma yin pa'i dper yang mi rung ngo //
translated: But if you say, “We do not recall the creator of an old well,” if the well is created, then it is created, and so it is not the case that we do not recall its creator. Therefore it is not suitable as an example of something uncreated.

original: ji ste nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa'i byed pa po mi dran pa bzhin no zhe na yang /
analyzed: ji ste nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa'i byed pa po mi dran pa bzhin no zhe na yang /
translated: But if you say, “It is like not recalling the creator of a sky flower and so on,”

original: rig byed yod pa la byed pa po med par bsgrub pa'i dper na nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa la /
analyzed: rig byed yod pa la byed pa po med par bsgrub pa'i dper na nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa la /
translated: then in the proof that the Vedas exist but their creator does not exist, a sky flower and so on are nonexistent.

original: byed pa po mi dran pa mi rung bas khyed kyi bsgrub pa de la ji ltar bsgres kyang /
analyzed: byed pa po mi dran pa mi rung bas khyed kyi bsgrub pa de la ji ltar bsgres kyang /
translated: Since it is illogical that the agent is not remembered, no matter how you interpret your proof,

original: gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe med pas mi rung ngo //🔽lung las nges brjod ni ri bo nges pa zhes bya bar byas la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe med pas mi rung ngo // lung las nges brjod ni ri bo nges pa zhes bya bar byas la /
translated: it is illogical because there is no example that follows the reason.🔽In the scriptures, the Ṛg Veda is said to be the mountain of certainty,

original: snyan tshig dag ni ri bo snyan pa zhes bya bar byas la /
analyzed: snyan tshig dag ni ri bo snyan pa zhes bya bar byas la /
translated: the Yajur Veda is said to be the mountain of fame,

original: srid srung nyi ma'i rgyud ni ri bo skal ldan phug ron can du byas so zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: srid srung nyi ma'i rgyud ni ri bo skal ldan phug ron can du byas so zhes 'byung bas /
translated: and the Sāma Veda is said to be the mountain of the fortunate dove.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don rang la yang ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni spyod pa can dag gi gtan tshigs byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya bas rig byed kyi tshig dag byas pa ma yin par sgrub pa de rang la yang ma grub🔽pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don rang la yang ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni spyod pa can dag gi gtan tshigs byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya bas rig byed kyi tshig dag byas pa ma yin par sgrub pa de rang la yang ma grub pa nyid du ston te /
translated: The statement “The meaning of the reason is not established for you” shows that the reason of the Carvāka, “because the agent is not remembered,” is not established for them.

original: rig byed smra ba dag nyid kyi lung las nges brjod kyi rig byed ni ri bo nges pa zhes bya bar byas la /
analyzed: rig byed smra ba dag nyid kyi lung las nges brjod kyi rig byed ni ri bo nges pa zhes bya bar byas la /
translated: In the scriptures of the proponents of the Vedas, the Ṛg Veda is said to be the mountain of certainty,🔽the Yajur Veda is said to be the mountain of fame,🔽and the Sāma Veda is said to be the mountain of the fortunate dove.

original: snyan tshig gi @201b rig byed dag ni ri bo snyan pa zhes bya bar byas /
analyzed: snyan tshig gi @201b rig byed dag ni ri bo snyan pa zhes bya bar byas /
translated: The hymns of the Rig Veda were composed on the mountain called the pleasant.🔽The Rig Veda of the Sāma Veda called the lineage of the sun was composed on the mountain called the cave of the fortunate dove.

original: sring srung gi rig byed nyi ma'i rgyud ces bya ba ni ri bo skal ldan phug ron can zhes bya bar byas so zhes 'byung bas de dag gi byed pa po mi dran yang gnas de dag tu byas so zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: sring srung gi rig byed nyi ma'i rgyud ces bya ba ni ri bo skal ldan phug ron can zhes bya bar byas so zhes 'byung bas de dag gi byed pa po mi dran yang gnas de dag tu byas so zhes 'byung bas /
translated: Since it is said that although the composers of these are not remembered, they were composed in those places,🔽just as it is not established that an old well was not made even though its maker is not remembered,

original: dper na khron pa rnying pa'i byed pa po mi dran yang de byas pa ma yin par mi 'grub pa bzhin du khyed kyang gtan tshigs byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya bas rig byed kyi tshig dag byas pa ma yin par sgrub pa de'i don
analyzed: dper na khron pa rnying pa'i byed pa po mi dran yang de byas pa ma yin par mi 'grub pa bzhin du khyed kyang gtan tshigs byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya bas rig byed kyi tshig dag byas pa ma yin par sgrub pa de'i don
translated: you also have not established the meaning of your argument that the words of the Vedas are not made because you do not remember their maker.

original: yang rang la ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang rang la ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Again, this is not established for you.🔽If you say that this is not a fault because it is clear,

original: gal te gsal ba dag gis skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa can dag na re rig byed ni sus kyang ma byas pa yong gis yod pa rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba dag gis skyon med do zhe na zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa can dag na re rig byed ni sus kyang ma byas pa yong gis yod pa rtag pa yin te /
translated: the Mīmāṃsakas say that the Vedas exist eternally without being made by anyone.

original: dper na brda sprod pa ni sus kyang ma byas pa yong gis yod pa rtag pa yin yang 'jig rten na ni de shes pa med cing mi gsal bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: dper na brda sprod pa ni sus kyang ma byas pa yong gis yod pa rtag pa yin yang 'jig rten na ni de shes pa med cing mi gsal bar gyur pa na /
translated: For example, grammar is permanent, existing without being created by anyone, but when it is not known in the world and becomes unclear,

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin nam pa ni ni la sogs pa dag gis lha yul dang mi yul du gsal bar byas pa bzhin du rig byed kyang ri bo nges pa dang / snyan pa dang skal ldan phug ron can dag tu rig byed klog pa kha cig gis gsal bar byas pas kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin nam pa ni ni la sogs pa dag gis lha yul dang mi yul du gsal bar byas pa bzhin du rig byed kyang ri bo nges pa dang / snyan pa dang skal ldan phug ron can dag tu rig byed klog pa kha cig gis gsal bar byas pas kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i skyon med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: it is clarified in the celestial realm and the human realm by the lord of the gods, Indra, and so on. Similarly, the Vedas are clarified by some who recite the Vedas in the mountains, in the cave of Kalapana, and so on. Therefore, our reason is not faulty.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary says:

original: phyogs des kyang mi nus te ;
analyzed: phyogs des kyang mi nus te ;
translated: That position is also untenable,

original: gsal ba snga ma bzhin du dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gsal ba snga ma bzhin du dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because the previous clarifications are refuted.

original: rig byed mi gsal ba ni gsal bar mi byed de /
analyzed: rig byed mi gsal ba ni gsal bar mi byed de /
translated: An unclear Veda does not clarify.

original: mi gsal ba'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes /
translated: Because it is unclear, it is like, for example, a sky flower.

original: grangs can gyi gsal ba dgag pa sngar bstan pa bzhin dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs can gyi gsal ba dgag pa sngar bstan pa bzhin dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is a refutation of the manifestation of the Samkhyas, as previously explained.

original: rig byed kyi tshig dag ni byas pa yin te /
analyzed: rig byed kyi tshig dag ni byas pa yin te /
translated: The words of the Vedas are created because

original: rtogs par 'dod pa'i don go sla ba nyid du tshig gi rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs par 'dod pa'i don go sla ba nyid du tshig gi rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the sequence of words is taught in order to easily understand the meaning that is desired to be known.

original: dper na grangs can gyi bstan bcos kyi tshig dag bzhin no zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas rig byed kyi tshig dag byas pa nyid yin par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: dper na grangs can gyi bstan bcos kyi tshig dag bzhin no zhes bya bas ni dbu ma pas rig byed kyi tshig dag byas pa nyid yin par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: For example, it is like the words of the treatises of the Samkhyas. This teaches the Madhyamikas' inference that proves that the words of the Vedas are created.

original: de dag ni chos can dang ; bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang ; bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the property to be proven, the proving property, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na grangs can gyi bstan bcos kyi tshig dag ni rtogs par 'dod pa'i don go sla ba nyid du tshig gi rim pa bstan pa'i phyir ser skya la sogs pas byas pa yin pa de bzhin du dpyod pa can gyi @202a * //🔽rig byed kyi tshig dag kyang rtogs par 'dod pa'i don go sla ba nyid du tshig gi rim pa bstan pa'i phyir byed pa po 'ga' zhig gis byas pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na grangs can gyi bstan bcos kyi tshig dag ni rtogs par 'dod pa'i don go sla ba nyid du tshig gi rim pa bstan pa'i phyir ser skya la sogs pas byas pa yin pa de bzhin du dpyod pa can gyi @202a * // rig byed kyi tshig dag kyang rtogs par 'dod pa'i don go sla ba nyid du tshig gi rim pa bstan pa'i phyir byed pa po 'ga' zhig gis byas pa yin no //
translated: For example, the words of the Sāṃkhya treatises were composed by Kapila and so on in order to teach the sequence of words for the purpose of easily understanding the meaning that is to be understood.🔽In the same way, the words of the Vedānta were composed by some author in order to teach the sequence of words for the purpose of easily understanding the meaning that is to be understood.

original: rtogs par 'dod pa'i don go sla ba nyid du tshig gi rim pa bstan pa ni dper na rig byed las /
analyzed: rtogs par 'dod pa'i don go sla ba nyid du tshig gi rim pa bstan pa ni dper na rig byed las /
translated: The teaching of the sequence of words for the purpose of easily understanding the meaning that is to be understood is, for example, from the Vedas:

analyzed: ma no dzyo ti /
translated: manojyoti

analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu la sogs pa dag 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: and so on.

original: de bzhin du ji skad bstan pa'i yan lag lhag ma dag 'dod pa nyid dang / gzung ba nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / don dang ldan pa nyid dang / chos sgrub pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji skad bstan pa'i yan lag lhag ma dag 'dod pa nyid dang / gzung ba nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / don dang ldan pa nyid dang / chos sgrub pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Similarly, one should state the inference extensively, saying: “In the same way, the remaining parts as they are taught are just desired, just apprehended, just expressed, just meaningful, just established in the Dharma, and so on, because of the reasons.”

original: sngar bstan pa'i yan lag lhag ma chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / dpe de dag gtan tshigs 'di dag gis kyang bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i yan lag lhag ma chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / dpe de dag gtan tshigs 'di dag gis kyang bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The remaining parts taught earlier, the subject, the property to be established, and the example, should be established by these reasons.

original: rig byed kyi tshig dag ni byas pa yin te /
analyzed: rig byed kyi tshig dag ni byas pa yin te /
translated: The words of the Vedas are produced,

original: bram ze rnams kyi 'dod pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bram ze rnams kyi 'dod pa dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are desired and so on by Brahmins.

original: dper na grangs can gyi bstan bcos kyi tshig dag bzhin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na grangs can gyi bstan bcos kyi tshig dag bzhin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: For example, like the words of the Sāṃkhya treatise.

original: dpyod pa pa dag gis rab tu brtags pa'i sgra la ni sgra'i ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: dpyod pa pa dag gis rab tu brtags pa'i sgra la ni sgra'i ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: The sound that is thoroughly investigated by the Mīmāṃsakas does not have the nature of sound because it is apprehended by the sense faculties, like, for example, form.

original: dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa can dag gi gzhung las rig byed kyi sgra la rtag pa ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa can dag gi gzhung las rig byed kyi sgra la rtag pa ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: This is the presentation of an inference that refutes the assertion by Mīmāṃsakas that the sound of the Vedas has eternal nature.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na gzugs ni dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du sgra yang dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: dper na gzugs ni dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du sgra yang dbang po'i gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: For example, form does not have nature because it is apprehended by the sense faculties. Likewise, sound also does not have nature because it is apprehended by the sense faculties.

original: sgra ni gsal bar bya ba ma yin te rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra ni gsal bar bya ba ma yin te rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Sound is not something that is made manifest because it is the cause of understanding.

original: dper na yan lag gi las bzhin no zhes dpyod pa can gyi gzhung las rig byed kyi sgra ni yong gis yod pa skad kyi dbyings kyi bag la zha zhing 'dug pa /
analyzed: dper na yan lag gi las bzhin no zhes dpyod pa can gyi gzhung las rig byed kyi sgra ni yong gis yod pa skad kyi dbyings kyi bag la zha zhing 'dug pa /
translated: For example, it is like the activity of a limb.

original: rkan dang / mchu dang / so dang / lce la sogs pa'i bya bas gsal bar byed do zhes zer ba dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: rkan dang / mchu dang / so dang / lce la sogs pa'i bya bas gsal bar byed do zhes zer ba dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: This is the presentation of an inference that refutes the assertion in the texts of the Analysts that the sound of a Vedic statement that exists by its very nature is latent in the phonemes and is made manifest by the activity of the palate, lips, teeth, tongue, and so on.

original: @202b de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: @202b de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the property of the probandum, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na yan lag gi las zhes bya ba lag rtsis ni de'i bsgyur ba las tha snyad rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na yan lag gi las zhes bya ba lag rtsis ni de'i bsgyur ba las tha snyad rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the so-called activity of a limb, such as the calculation of the movements of the planets, is not something that is made manifest but is something that is produced because it is the cause for understanding the conventional term.

original: gsal bar bya ba ma yin gyi bskyed par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du sgra yang smra ba las tha snyad rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gsal bar bya ba ma yin gyi /🔽bskyed par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba ma yin gyi bskyed par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du sgra yang smra ba las tha snyad rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gsal bar bya ba ma yin gyi /🔽bskyed par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, sound is not something that is made manifest but is something that is produced because it is the cause for understanding the conventional term from the statement.

original: de bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / shes bya nyid dang / chos sgrub pa nyid dang / dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / shes bya nyid dang / chos sgrub pa nyid dang / dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: So too, it should be extensively stated that it is inferred because of reasons such as it is an existent, it is an object of expression, it is an object of knowledge, it is a phenomenon to be established, it is a cause of joy and of torment, and so on.

original: phyogs dang dpe snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang dpe snga ma'i gtan tshigs ni 'di dag kyang yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The reason of the former position and example should be applied to these as well.🔽This should be understood to refute the assertion that it is clarified by the nonarisen deity itself.

original: 'dis sngon ma byung ba'i lha nyid kyis gsal bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes zer ba dgag pa yang khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga ma 'dis /
analyzed: 'dis sngon ma byung ba'i lha nyid kyis gsal bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes zer ba dgag pa yang khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa snga ma 'dis /
translated: This is the former inference that refutes clarification.

original: dpyod pa dag gi gzhung las rig byed kyi tshig dag ni /
analyzed: dpyod pa dag gi gzhung las rig byed kyi tshig dag ni /
translated: The Mīmāṃsakas say that the words of the Vedas

original: sus kyang ma byas pa yong gis yod pa rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: sus kyang ma byas pa yong gis yod pa rtag pa yin te /
translated: are not created by anyone, they exist primordially, and they are permanent.

original: 'jig rten na rig byed 'don bdag gi rgyud la mi gsal bar gyur ba na tshangs pas gzhung bsrangs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na rig byed 'don bdag gi rgyud la mi gsal bar gyur ba na tshangs pas gzhung bsrangs te /
translated: In the world, when the recitation of the Vedas is unclear in one's mindstream, Brahma clarifies it.

original: gsal bar byas pas rig byed ni lha nyid kyis gsal bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes zer ba dgag pa yang de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsal bar byas pas rig byed ni lha nyid kyis gsal bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes zer ba dgag pa yang de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since he clarified it, the Vedas are to be clarified by the gods themselves.

original: rig byed ni byed pa po tshul khrims 'chal pas byas par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rig byed ni byed pa po tshul khrims 'chal pas byas par shes par bya ste /
translated: The Vedas are to be understood as composed by a degenerate being,

original: 'tshe ba dang bgrod par bya ba ma yin par 'gro ba dang / chang 'thung ba chos su ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'tshe ba dang bgrod par bya ba ma yin par 'gro ba dang / chang 'thung ba chos su ston pa'i phyir /
translated: because they teach violence, going to forbidden places, and drinking alcohol.

original: dper na bar sig la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no zhes bya bas ni /🔽dpyod pa can dag gi rig byed dag byed pa mos byas pa lta los kyang yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na bar sig la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no zhes bya bas ni / dpyod pa can dag gi rig byed dag byed pa mos byas pa lta los kyang yin gyi /
translated: For example, like the treatises of the Barsikas and so on.🔽This shows that the Vedas are also composed by a degenerate being,

original: byas pa'i nang na yang byed pa po sdig can tshul khrims 'chal ba zhig gis byas par rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: byas pa'i nang na yang byed pa po sdig can tshul khrims 'chal ba zhig gis byas par rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: even among those composed by a degenerate being.

original: de dag chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na bar sig la sogs pa'i bstan bcos ni byi smyil la sogs pas srog chags la 'tshe ba dang / bu sring dang nyal ba la sogs pas bgrod par bya ba ma yin par 'gro ba dang / lkog tu myos kyang bla'i zhes bya @203a * //
analyzed: de dag chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na bar sig la sogs pa'i bstan bcos ni byi smyil la sogs pas srog chags la 'tshe ba dang / bu sring dang nyal ba la sogs pas bgrod par bya ba ma yin par 'gro ba dang / lkog tu myos kyang bla'i zhes bya @203a * //
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason and the example.

original: ba la sogs pas chang 'thung ba dag chos su ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ba la sogs pas chang 'thung ba dag chos su ston pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the treatises of the Persians teach that it is proper to harm living beings with such things as poison, to have intercourse with women who should not be approached such as one's mother or daughter and to drink alcohol with such things as the words, it is better to drink alcohol in secret.

original: byed pa po tshul khrims 'chal bas byas par shes par byas pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: byed pa po tshul khrims 'chal bas byas par shes par byas pa de bzhin du /
translated: Since they are composed by immoral authors, they are to be rejected.

translated: Similarly, the harm to living beings at the time of the sacrifice of the followers of Kapila is the cause for going to miserable realms because they intentionally and unmistakenly kill.
