translated: If some unwise person here argues that just as when one is carried away by the current of a great river, one grasps at even a clump of grass or kuśa grass, in the same way, one who is carried away by the current of karma grasps at even an unwholesome action that has the character of harm, which is a cause that leads to the lower realms, then to this we say the following.

original: khyed dbu ma pas mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te zhes dam bcas pa 'di la mchod sbyin gyi gnas su zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i rnam par dbye ba ni mchod sbyin gyi gnas kyi nang
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te zhes dam bcas pa 'di la mchod sbyin gyi gnas su zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i rnam par dbye ba ni mchod sbyin gyi gnas kyi nang
translated: You Mādhyamikas have asserted that the action that has the character of harm in the context of a sacrifice is a cause that leads to the lower realms. In this assertion, the phrase “in the context of a sacrifice” is a specification.

original: du zhes bya ba'i sgra yin pas des na mchod sbyin gyi gnas phyi nang du ni 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba kho bo cag kyang mi byed pas khyed na re mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu
analyzed: du zhes bya ba'i sgra yin pas des na mchod sbyin gyi gnas phyi nang du ni 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba kho bo cag kyang mi byed pas khyed na re mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu
translated: Therefore, since the proof that you state, “The action characterized by violence in the context of sacrifice is the cause of going to a miserable realm,

original: yin pas mi bya'o zhes zer ba'i bsgrub pa de grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: yin pas mi bya'o zhes zer ba'i bsgrub pa de grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin pas mi rung ste /
translated: therefore it should not be performed,” is established, the fault of the proof does not apply to us.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi gzhung las kyang mchod sbyin gyi gnas zhes bya ba ni kun sbyin pa'i me dang / khyim bdag gis byas pa'i me dang / mchod pa'i me zhes bya ba sbyin sreg gi thab khung gsum po dag yin pas kho bo cag gi sbyin sreg mkhan dag kyang thab gsum po de dag gi nang nyid du phyugs gsod pa la sogs pa 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi gzhung las kyang mchod sbyin gyi gnas zhes bya ba ni kun sbyin pa'i me dang / khyim bdag gis byas pa'i me dang / mchod pa'i me zhes bya ba sbyin sreg gi thab khung gsum po dag yin pas kho bo cag gi sbyin sreg mkhan dag kyang thab gsum po de dag gi nang nyid du phyugs gsod pa la sogs pa 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba mi byed de /
translated: In this way, in our scriptures, the so-called context of sacrifice refers to the three hearths called the fire of universal giving, the fire made by the householder, and the fire of worship. Therefore the sacrificers of our system do not perform the action characterized by violence, such as killing cattle, in the context of those three hearths.

original: mchod sbyin gyi gnas kyi phyi rol phyogs gzhan du phyugs gsod pa la sogs pa'i 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba byas nas sha la sogs pa thab de gsum gyi nang du sbyin sreg byed pas de na ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes zer
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi gnas kyi phyi rol phyogs gzhan du phyugs gsod pa la sogs pa'i 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba byas nas sha la sogs pa thab de gsum gyi nang du sbyin sreg byed pas de na ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes zer
translated: They say that the act of killing animals and so on outside the sacrificial ground is not a cause for rebirth in the lower realms because the meat and so on are offered into the fire.

original: na / de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /🔽'dir kho bos mchod sbyin gyi gnas su zhes smras pa'i tshig de'i rnam par dbye ba ni mchod sbyin gyi gnas kyi nang du @205a * //
analyzed: na / de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste / 'dir kho bos mchod sbyin gyi gnas su zhes smras pa'i tshig de'i rnam par dbye ba ni mchod sbyin gyi gnas kyi nang du @205a * //
translated: To this we reply as follows.🔽The word “sacrificial ground” in the statement “Here, I say that the sacrificial ground” is not a locative case that means “inside the sacrificial ground.”

original: zhes bya ba'i sgra ma yin gyi mchod sbyin gyi gnas kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra yin pas /🔽des na ji tsam du mchod sbyin gyi gnas kyi phyir ram /🔽de'i don du'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgra ma yin gyi mchod sbyin gyi gnas kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra yin pas / des na ji tsam du mchod sbyin gyi gnas kyi phyir ram / de'i don du'am /
translated: It is a locative case that means “for the sake of the sacrificial ground.”🔽Therefore, to the extent that one performs the act of killing animals and so on for the sake of the sacrificial ground,🔽for the purpose of the sacrificial ground,

original: de'i ched du phyugs gsod pa la sogs pa 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba byed na sbyin sreg gi thab kyi nang du yang rung /
analyzed: de'i ched du phyugs gsod pa la sogs pa 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba byed na sbyin sreg gi thab kyi nang du yang rung /
translated: or for the sake of the sacrificial ground,🔽whether one offers the meat and so on into the fire or not,

original: thab dogs su yang rung /
analyzed: thab dogs su yang rung /
translated: It is also suitable in the kitchen.

original: mchod sbyin gyi gnas kyi nang rol du yang rung /
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi gnas kyi nang rol du yang rung /
translated: It is also suitable inside the sacrificial enclosure.

original: phyi rol du yang rung /
analyzed: phyi rol du yang rung /
translated: It is also suitable outside.

original: de'i phyogs su yang rung /
analyzed: de'i phyogs su yang rung /
translated: It is also suitable in that direction.

original: phyogs gzhan du yang rung ste /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan du yang rung ste /
translated: It is also suitable in another direction.

original: de dag thams cad ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: All of those are causes for going to the miserable realms.

original: gzhan gsod par rjes su gnang ba sngon du btang ba nyid yin na bya ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba bzhin no zhes dam bcas pa de'i phyir kho bo'i sgrub pa de sgrub
analyzed: gzhan gsod par rjes su gnang ba sngon du btang ba nyid yin na bya ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba bzhin no zhes dam bcas pa de'i phyir kho bo'i sgrub pa de sgrub
translated: If you assert that it is permitted to kill others, then it is a special action. Therefore, like the action that has the characteristic of harming in a place that is not a sacrificial enclosure, that is your proof.

original: pa la grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir khyod kyi sgrub pa des ni dper na chu chen po'i rgyun gyis khyer ba na rtsva ka sha dang ku sha tsam la 'jus pas pha mi lon pa dang 'dra bar mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi
analyzed: pa la grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir khyod kyi sgrub pa des ni dper na chu chen po'i rgyun gyis khyer ba na rtsva ka sha dang ku sha tsam la 'jus pas pha mi lon pa dang 'dra bar mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi
translated: Since that is not established, your proof is like someone who is carried away by the current of a great river and who cannot reach the other shore by grasping at just a blade of kash or kusha grass.

original: bya ba ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: bya ba ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin par mi 'grub po //
translated: It is not established that it is not a cause for going to a bad rebirth.

original: gang dag 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag pas kyang sdig che bar rig byed smra ba'i tha ma lag gi rjes su zhugs nas mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya🔽ba ltar chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag pas kyang sdig che bar rig byed smra ba'i tha ma lag gi rjes su zhugs nas mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ltar chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Some say: The final Vedas that teach the performance of animal sacrifice are not nonvirtuous karma because they are not a cause for going to a bad rebirth.🔽But that is not so, because it is not established that they are not a cause for going to a bad rebirth.

original: bstan bcos las chos ma yin pa mi ston pa'i phyir dpe ma grub po zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni bram zer dpyod pa can srog chags la 'tshe ba sdig can zang zing 'dod pa gang dag 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag pas kyang sdig che ba
analyzed: bstan bcos las chos ma yin pa mi ston pa'i phyir dpe ma grub po zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni bram zer dpyod pa can srog chags la 'tshe ba sdig can zang zing 'dod pa gang dag 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag pas kyang sdig che ba
translated: Some say: The performance of animal sacrifice, which is characterized by violence, is not a nonvirtuous action because it is not a nonvirtue, since it is not taught in the treatises.🔽This is like the performance of animal sacrifice, which is characterized by violence, not being a site of sacrifice because it is not a site of sacrifice.🔽This is like the final Vedas that teach the performance of animal sacrifice, which are not nonvirtuous because they are not taught in the treatises.

original: rig byed smra ba'i tha ma lag gi rjes su zhugs pa dag dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa snga ma'i dpe mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong pas ma grub🔽po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: rig byed smra ba'i tha ma lag gi rjes su zhugs pa dag dbu ma pa'i sgrub pa snga ma'i dpe mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong pas ma grub po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is that the subject, the action that has the characteristic of violence, is not established as empty of the property of the probandum.

original: de dag na re mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa de bden pas mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i
analyzed: de dag na re mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa de bden pas mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i
translated: They say that the action that has the characteristic of violence, which is not a site of sacrifice, is the cause of going to a bad migration. Since that is true, the action that has the characteristic of violence, which is a site of sacrifice, is not an action that has the characteristic of violence, which is not a site of sacrifice.

original: mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ltar chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ltar chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not an action that is not a Dharma.

original: ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni @205b rig byed kyi bstan bcos las 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni @205b rig byed kyi bstan bcos las 'byung la /
translated: Because the action that has the characteristic of violence, which is a site of sacrifice, occurs in the treatises of the Vedas.

original: rig byed kyi bstan bcos ni yid ches pa'i lung yin pas de las chos ma yin pa mi ston pa'i phyir mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin pas khyod kyi dpe mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma
analyzed: rig byed kyi bstan bcos ni yid ches pa'i lung yin pas de las chos ma yin pa mi ston pa'i phyir mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin pas khyod kyi dpe mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma
translated: Because the treatises of the Vedas are authoritative scripture, they do not teach non-Dharma. Therefore, the act of violence in the context of sacrifice is not a cause for going to the lower realms.

original: yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong pa'i phyir ma grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis stong pa'i phyir ma grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus your example of the act of violence in the context of sacrifice is not established because it is empty of the property to be proven.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de dag ni 'jig rten rgyang phan pa blo gros sbyang ba ma byas pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de dag ni 'jig rten rgyang phan pa blo gros sbyang ba ma byas pa /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says: These are the main arguments of the Lokāyatas, who have not trained their minds,

original: mi dge ba'i bya ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'jug pa gang yin pa de gtso cher sgrub par byed pa yin pas gtam 'dre bar byas pa yang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i bya ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'jug pa gang yin pa de gtso cher sgrub par byed pa yin pas gtam 'dre bar byas pa yang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: who delight in nonvirtuous actions. Although this is not a friendly conversation,

original: 'on kyang de dag gi lugs dgag pa brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gi lugs dgag pa brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: However, we will state the refutation of their system.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid kyang nyams la gzhan dag kyang chud za bar byed pa yin pas gtam 'dre bar bya ba yang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid kyang nyams la gzhan dag kyang chud za bar byed pa yin pas gtam 'dre bar bya ba yang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: They are not even fit to be refuted in debate, because they are themselves ruined and they ruin others.

original: 'on kyang de dag bdag nyid nyams pa la snying brtse ba dang / gzhan dag chud za bar byed pa bzlog pa'i phyir de dag gi lugs dgag pa brjod par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag bdag nyid nyams pa la snying brtse ba dang / gzhan dag chud za bar byed pa bzlog pa'i phyir de dag gi lugs dgag pa brjod par bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: However, we will state the refutation of their system out of compassion for those who are ruined and in order to stop others from being ruined.

original: de dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di la de'i gnas la 'bras bu ji lta bu mngon par sgrub par byed pa de lta bu kho na'i 'bras bu tshe phyi ma la byed pa po la mngon par
analyzed: de dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir / mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di la de'i gnas la 'bras bu ji lta bu mngon par sgrub par byed pa de lta bu kho na'i 'bras bu tshe phyi ma la byed pa po la mngon par
translated: In order to demonstrate the inference that refutes them,🔽the root text says:

original: 'grub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'grub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Whatever action has the characteristic of harming living beings in the context of a sacrifice, the agent will definitely experience a result in the next life that is similar to the result that would have arisen in this life for that living being.

original: bya ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir dper na sbyin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bya ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir dper na sbyin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is a specific action, like, for example, generosity.

original: des na mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gang yin pa de ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pas dbu ma pa'i dpe snga ma de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis mi stong par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
analyzed: des na mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gang yin pa de ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pas dbu ma pa'i dpe snga ma de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis mi stong par bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ston te /
translated: Thus, since the action characterized by violence in the context of sacrifice is the cause of going to miserable realms, the former example of the Madhyamikas is taught to be an inference that proves that the subject is not empty of the property of the probandum.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Moreover, they are to be applied in order as the subject, the property of the probandum, the proving property, and the example.

original: dper na sbyin pa ni dge ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir tshe 'di la sbyin pa de'i gnas mchod pa dang / drin bsab pa dang / snying rje bdag la chos dang / zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ji lta bu mngon par sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: dper na sbyin pa ni dge ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir tshe 'di la sbyin pa de'i gnas mchod pa dang / drin bsab pa dang / snying rje bdag la chos dang / zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ji lta bu mngon par sgrub par byed pa /
translated: For example, generosity is a specific virtue, and in this life, the result of that generosity is the establishment of the result of generosity, such as worship, repayment of kindness, and the giving of Dharma, material things, and fearlessness to those who are kind.

original: de lta bu kho na'i 'bras bu tshe phyi ma la sbyin pa po la mngon par @206a * //
analyzed: de lta bu kho na'i 'bras bu tshe phyi ma la sbyin pa po la mngon par @206a * //
translated: The result of such an act is that in the next life the giver will obtain the result of the act of killing.

original: 'grub par byed pa de bzhin du mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gang yin pa de yang mi dge ba'i bya ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir tshe 'di la 'tshe ba de'i gnas phyugs la sogs pa'i lus la bcing ba dang /
analyzed: 'grub par byed pa de bzhin du mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gang yin pa de yang mi dge ba'i bya ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir tshe 'di la 'tshe ba de'i gnas phyugs la sogs pa'i lus la bcing ba dang /
translated: Similarly, the act of killing that is done in a place of sacrifice is a specific nonvirtuous act. Thus, in this life, the result of that act of killing is that the body of the victim, such as an animal, is bound,🔽beaten, stabbed with a weapon, killed, and its flesh is roasted and so on.

original: bsub pa dang / mtshon gyis gdab pa dang / srog gcod pa dang / sha sreg pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ji lta bu mngon par sgrub par byed pa de lta bu kho na'i 'bras bu tshe phyi ma la byed pa po la mngon par grub pa byed pa yin pas mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya
analyzed: bsub pa dang / mtshon gyis gdab pa dang / srog gcod pa dang / sha sreg pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ji lta bu mngon par sgrub par byed pa de lta bu kho na'i 'bras bu tshe phyi ma la byed pa po la mngon par grub pa byed pa yin pas mchod sbyin gyi gnas su 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya
translated: In the next life, the agent of that act of killing will obtain a result that is similar to the result of that act of killing.

original: ba gang yin pa de ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kho bo'i dpe mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis mi
analyzed: ba gang yin pa de ni ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kho bo'i dpe mchod sbyin gyi gnas ma yin par 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba chos kyis mi
translated: Because that which is a sacrifice is a cause of going to miserable realms, it is like the example of my sacrifice, which is not a cause of going to miserable realms, since it is an action characterized by nonviolence.

original: stong pas grub pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pas grub pa yin no //
translated: This is established by the property of the probandum being nonempty.

original: gang dag 'di skad ces phyugs mchod sbyin du spyad pa ni chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag 'di skad ces phyugs mchod sbyin du spyad pa ni chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who say, “Sacrificing cattle is not nonvirtuous,

original: de'i ched nyid yin pa'i phyir gang zhi gang gi ched du sbyar ba de'i ched du spyad pa chos ma yin pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ched nyid yin pa'i phyir gang zhi gang gi ched du sbyar ba de'i ched du spyad pa chos ma yin pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur te /
translated: because it is for that purpose,” and “That which is applied for the sake of something is applied for that purpose, and it is not a cause of nonvirtue,”

original: dper na sbyin bdag gis bram ze'i ched du 'bras chen sbyar ba bzhin no zhes zer na zhes bya bas ni dpyod pa can dang / par sig dang / mo go sha dang / mu su la man dang / tar sog la sogs pa dag gi gzhung las phyugs la sogs pa dud 'gro rnams mchod sbyin du spyad pa dang /
analyzed: dper na sbyin bdag gis bram ze'i ched du 'bras chen sbyar ba bzhin no zhes zer na zhes bya bas ni dpyod pa can dang / par sig dang / mo go sha dang / mu su la man dang / tar sog la sogs pa dag gi gzhung las phyugs la sogs pa dud 'gro rnams mchod sbyin du spyad pa dang /
translated: The phrase for example, like the preparation of rice for a brahmin by a patron indicates the scriptures of the Lokāyatas, the Ājīvikas, the Mīmāṃsakas, the Mīmāṃsā, the Musulmans, the Tārsakas, and so on, which say, Since animals such as cattle are used in sacrifices and

original: mis bza' ba'i rkyen du bya ba yin pas de dag mchod sbyin du spyad pa dang / mis zos pa la sdig pa med do zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston te /
analyzed: mis bza' ba'i rkyen du bya ba yin pas de dag mchod sbyin du spyad pa dang / mis zos pa la sdig pa med do zhes zer ba'i gzhung ston te /
translated: humans are the condition for eating, there is no sin in using them in sacrifices and humans eating them.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang ; dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang ; dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proof, the application, and the example, respectively.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary here says, That is not good.

original: 'ga' zhig gis phyugs mchod sbyin gyi ched du sprul to zhes bya ba de mi 'grub ste /🔽sprul pa po 'ga' zhig gis blo sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis phyugs mchod sbyin gyi ched du sprul to zhes bya ba de mi 'grub ste / sprul pa po 'ga' zhig gis blo sngon du btang ste /
translated: Some say: They emanate for the purpose of animal sacrifice.

original: byas par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: byas par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: That is not established because the emanator does not accept that he is acting after first directing his mind to that.

original: dud 'gro'i mchod sbyin gyis lha ma nyes par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de yang 'jig rten slu ba'i tshig yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i mchod sbyin gyis lha ma nyes par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de yang 'jig rten slu ba'i tshig yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the statement Animals are sacrificed to the gods is a lie that deceives the world,🔽the root text states:

original: dud 'gro phyugs ngan 'gro log par ltung bar skyes pa bde ba shin tu dkon pa sha kho na med pa 'chi bas 'jigs skrag pa @206b mya ngan bya bar 'os pa dag bsad pas lha lha'i phreng ba dang / byug pa dang rgyan dang /
analyzed: dud 'gro phyugs ngan 'gro log par ltung bar skyes pa bde ba shin tu dkon pa sha kho na med pa 'chi bas 'jigs skrag pa @206b mya ngan bya bar 'os pa dag bsad pas lha lha'i phreng ba dang / byug pa dang rgyan dang /
translated: Animals are born in the lower rebirths of animals and are extremely miserable.

original: gos 'chang ba'i gzugs can bdud rtsi mchog tu yid du 'od ba ro zhim pa'i zas za bar 'byor ba chen po dang ldan pa rnams dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la su zhig yid ches pa skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gos 'chang ba'i gzugs can bdud rtsi mchog tu yid du 'od ba ro zhim pa'i zas za bar 'byor ba chen po dang ldan pa rnams dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la su zhig yid ches pa skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Who would believe that those who wear clothes, who eat food that is the best of elixirs, and who have great wealth are happy?

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inference that is the same as that,

original: phyugs dag ni mchod sbyin gyi ched ma yin te /
analyzed: phyugs dag ni mchod sbyin gyi ched ma yin te /
translated: it is said, “Cattle are not for the purpose of sacrifice,

original: longs spyod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin bya ba'i 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: longs spyod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin bya ba'i 'bras bu bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because they are for enjoyment, like the result of the sacrifice.”

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na mchod sbyin bya ba'i 'bras bu mtho ris su skye ba la sogs pa ni longs spyod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mchod sbyin gyi ched ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin bya ba'i 'bras bu mtho ris su skye ba la sogs pa ni longs spyod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mchod sbyin gyi ched ma yin te /
translated: For example, the result of the sacrifice, such as rebirth in the higher realms, is not for the purpose of the sacrifice because it is for enjoyment.

original: 'di ltar mchod sbyin nyid de'i ched yin pa de bzhin du phyugs dag kyang bzho ba dang bkal ba la sogs pas longs spyod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mchod sbyin gyi ched ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mchod sbyin nyid de'i ched yin pa de bzhin du phyugs dag kyang bzho ba dang bkal ba la sogs pas longs spyod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mchod sbyin gyi ched ma yin te /
translated: Just as the sacrifice is for the sake of the priest, in the same way, cattle are not for the sake of the sacrifice, because they are to be used for milking, carrying loads, and so on.

original: 'di ltar mchod sbyin nyid de dag gi ched yin pas gang dag 'di skad ces phyugs mchod sbyin du spyad pa ni chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mchod sbyin nyid de dag gi ched yin pas gang dag 'di skad ces phyugs mchod sbyin du spyad pa ni chos ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the sacrifice is for the sake of those, because those who say, “It is not wrong to use cattle in sacrifice,”

original: de'i ched nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub po //
analyzed: de'i ched nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub po //
translated: say that the reason is not established.

original: de bzhin du yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs de'i gtan tshigs ni yod pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / shes bya nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs de'i gtan tshigs ni yod pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / shes bya nyid dang /
translated: In the same way, the reasons “because of existence” and so on should be extensively stated in the inference.

original: chos sgrub pa nyid dang / dga' ba dang yongs su gdud ba'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa dag kyang yin par sbyang ro /
analyzed: chos sgrub pa nyid dang / dga' ba dang yongs su gdud ba'i rgyu nyid la sogs pa dag kyang yin par sbyang ro /
translated: It is also the cause of the practice of Dharma itself, of joy, and of complete satisfaction.

original: de ltar spyod pa can dag rig byed ni sus kyang ma byas pa yong gis yod pa rtag pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin par bsgrub pa'i gzhung su na dbyung ba bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa can dag rig byed ni sus kyang ma byas pa yong gis yod pa rtag pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin par bsgrub pa'i gzhung su na dbyung ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, the proponents of the Vedas have demonstrated the treatise that proves that the Vedas exist primordially, are eternal, and are omniscient, without being created by anyone.

original: de ni phyogs tsam zhig nye bar bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin dgag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni phyogs tsam zhig nye bar bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin dgag pa'o //
translated: This is just a brief indication of the refutation of sacrifice.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog go zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog go zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa'o //
translated: This is sufficient for a digression on the proof of omniscience.

original: de'i phyir de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid phyin ci ma log par ston par dka' ba lha dang / mi'i bla ma rnams kyis bkur ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid phyin ci ma log par ston par dka' ba lha dang / mi'i bla ma rnams kyis bkur ba ste /
translated: Therefore, in this way, omniscience is difficult to demonstrate without error regarding the essencelessness of all phenomena, and it is revered by the gurus of gods and humans.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das stobs bcu mnga' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad @207a * //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das stobs bcu mnga' ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad @207a * //
translated: That is the Blessed One, the one who possesses the ten powers. This is the conclusion and the measure of the treatise.

original: ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The effect of the mother.

original: de ltar phas kyi rgol ba mu stegs byed glang po'i rigs can rnams kyi tshig dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' seng ge'i sgra lta bu'i lung gis tshar bcad pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de ltar phas kyi rgol ba mu stegs byed glang po'i rigs can rnams kyi tshig dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' seng ge'i sgra lta bu'i lung gis tshar bcad pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du grub po //
translated: Thus, the words of the tirthikas, the opponents, who are like a herd of elephants, are refuted by the scriptures of the Tathagata, which are like the lion's roar, and thus the omniscience of the Tathagata is established.🔽Since we have gone too far into this discussion, let us return to the point at hand.

original: gtam ha cang 'phros pas chog gis skabs nyid la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya bas ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par smra ba sun dbyung ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgrub pa de tsam gyis chog gis da ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i skabs nyid la 'jug par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: gtam ha cang 'phros pas chog gis skabs nyid la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya bas ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par smra ba sun dbyung ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgrub pa de tsam gyis chog gis da ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med par bsgrub pa'i skabs nyid la 'jug par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that it is sufficient to refute the non-omniscient and to establish omniscience, and that now we should return to the point at hand, namely, the establishment of the ultimate realitylessness of the Tathagata.

original: 'dir smras pa khyod kyis chos thams cad spros pa med do zhes khas blangs la /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa khyod kyis chos thams cad spros pa med do zhes khas blangs la /
translated: Here, you accept that all phenomena are free of mental proliferation.

original: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes spros par yang byed pas de'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa la khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes spros par yang byed pas de'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa la khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the opponent's statement that the Madhyamaka position is undermined by its own assertions.

original: de'i lan du 'dir bshad pa de ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad spros pa med pa ni bden no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir bshad pa de ni bden mod kyi zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad spros pa med pa ni bden no zhes ston to //
translated: In response to that, the text says, This is true, indicating that it is true that all phenomena are free from elaborations.

original: don dam par spros pa med pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: don dam par spros pa med pa bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that ultimately they are free from elaborations.

original: kun rdzob tu stong ngo zhes spros pas ma bstan na sgrub par byed pa dag gis de mi rtogs pas don dam pa rtogs par bya ba'i thabs su tha snyad du spros pas bstan to zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu stong ngo zhes spros pas ma bstan na sgrub par byed pa dag gis de mi rtogs pas don dam pa rtogs par bya ba'i thabs su tha snyad du spros pas bstan to zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: However, if one does not teach that they are empty by elaborating conventionally, those to be guided will not understand that. Therefore, in order to teach the ultimate by means of conventional elaborations as a method for realizing the ultimate, the text says:

original: gal te chos thams cad stong ngo zhes ma brten pa yang sgrub par byed pas thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa med par chos thams cad stong ngo zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur na ni don dam par /🔽stong ngo zhes kyang mi brjod de //🔽mi stong zhes kyang mi bya zhing //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad stong ngo zhes ma brten pa yang sgrub par byed pas thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa med par chos thams cad stong ngo zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur na ni don dam par / stong ngo zhes kyang mi brjod de // mi stong zhes kyang mi bya zhing //
translated: If one were to establish that all phenomena are empty without depending on the words of the Buddha, then one would realize that all phenomena are empty without the knowledge derived from hearing.🔽But this is not so.🔽Therefore, one should not say that all phenomena are empty,🔽nor should one say that they are not empty,🔽nor should one say that they are both,

original: gnyis dang gnyis min mi bya ste //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis min mi bya ste // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: nor should one say that they are neither.

original: de ltar de skad spros par bya yang mi dgos pa zhig na zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar de skad spros par bya yang mi dgos pa zhig na zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is not necessary to elaborate in this way.

original: de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang rjes su mthun par sgrub par byed pa rnams kyis de ltar rtogs par bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag gis /
analyzed: de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang rjes su mthun par sgrub par byed pa rnams kyis de ltar rtogs par bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag gis /
translated: But if one does not do it this way, then in order to realize that all phenomena are empty, those who practice in accordance with the accumulations of merit and wisdom should understand that the expressions “emptiness” and so on are used

original: gdags pa'i don du brjod par bya //
analyzed: gdags pa'i don du brjod par bya //
translated: for the purpose of designation.

original: yang dag pa ma yin par rtog pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir tshogs gnyis rdzogs par bya ba dang / lta ba dan pa'i dri ma dag bkru ba'i phyir kun rdzob @207b tu stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag gis stong pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par rtog pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de lta ma yin pas de'i phyir tshogs gnyis rdzogs par bya ba dang / lta ba dan pa'i dri ma dag bkru ba'i phyir kun rdzob @207b tu stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag gis stong pa dang /
translated: Since it is not like that, therefore, in order to complete the two accumulations and wash away the stains of the view of the transitory collection, by means of expressions such as “emptiness” and so on, in the conventional sense, it is elaborated and taught as “empty,” “not empty,” “both,” and “neither.”

original: mi stong pa dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin no zhes spros te bstan par bya ba la skyon med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mi stong pa dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin no zhes spros te bstan par bya ba la skyon med do zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, there is no fault in teaching.

original: da ni kun rdzob du stong pa nyid la sogs par bstan pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni kun rdzob du stong pa nyid la sogs par bstan pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the purpose of teaching emptiness and so on in the conventional sense,🔽it is said:

original: de la re zhig lta ba'i ling tog gzhig pa'i phyir shes bya stong ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig lta ba'i ling tog gzhig pa'i phyir shes bya stong ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In order to destroy the cataract of view, it should be said that the object of knowledge is empty.

original: med par lta ba spang ba'i phyir sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu lta bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: med par lta ba spang ba'i phyir sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu lta bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In order to abandon the view of nihilism, it should be said that it is not empty, by way of having the nature of an illusion and a mirage.

original: don dam par rang las skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid du skyes pa'i phyir gnyi ga zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par rang las skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid du skyes pa'i phyir gnyi ga zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because there is no arising from self ultimately, and because they arise as the nature of illusions, etc., they should be said to be both.

original: gang yang rung ba'i mthar ltung ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir dang / bden pa gnyis la rnam par ltos pas gnyi gar lta ba'i skyon gyi dug bsal ba'i phyir dang / don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gnyi ga ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i mthar ltung ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir dang / bden pa gnyis la rnam par ltos pas gnyi gar lta ba'i skyon gyi dug bsal ba'i phyir dang / don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gnyi ga ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In order to avoid falling into either extreme, and in order to remove the poison of the faults of the views of both and neither by relying on the two truths, and in order to realize the ultimate truth, they should be said to be neither.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yang dag pa ma yin par rtog pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir stong pa nyid la sogs pa brjod de zhes bya ba ni dgos pa bzhi bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yang dag pa ma yin par rtog pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir stong pa nyid la sogs pa brjod de zhes bya ba ni dgos pa bzhi bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to wash away the stain of false imagination, emptiness, etc., is taught. This is the conclusion of the presentation of the four purposes.

original: mi mthun pa bzhi po de dag bkru ba'i phyir stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa bzhi po de dag bkru ba'i phyir stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In order to wash away those four disagreements, emptiness, non-emptiness, both, and neither are mentioned.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs par mi mthun pa de dag spang ba'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs par mi mthun pa de dag spang ba'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of the abandonment of those disagreements regarding emptiness and so on,

original: ji skad du stong pa nyid ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las nges par 'byin pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ji skad du stong pa nyid ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las nges par 'byin pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: he says, “For example, it is said, ‘Emptiness is the deliverance from all views.’”

original: de nyid kyi khungs slob dpon 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs slob dpon 'phags pa lhas mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of that very [statement], the master Āryadeva’s composition,

original: gzhan yang / gal te dngos por rang bzhin yod //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te dngos por rang bzhin yod //
translated: he says, “Moreover, if entities have intrinsic reality,

original: stong mthong yon tan ji zhig yod //
analyzed: stong mthong yon tan ji zhig yod //
translated: what benefit is there in seeing emptiness?

original: rtog pas bcings pa mthong bas na //
analyzed: rtog pas bcings pa mthong bas na //
translated: Seeing the bondage of conceptualization,

original: 'dir ni de nyid gdags par bya //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir ni de nyid gdags par bya //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: here that very [emptiness] is to be imputed.”

original: gal te don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid kyis yod par gyur na stong pa mthong ba la yon tan ji zhig yod de /
analyzed: gal te don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid kyis yod par gyur na stong pa mthong ba la yon tan ji zhig yod de /
translated: If ultimately things existed inherently, what good quality would there be in seeing emptiness?

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid mthong ba la yon tan 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid mthong ba la yon tan 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: In that case, since there would be no change in their nature, there would be no good quality whatsoever in seeing emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid mthong ba la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa zhes bya ba'i yon tan yod pas de'i phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo @208a * //🔽nyid yod pa ma yin no //🔽gal te gzhan dag na re dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med na yang stong pa nyid mthong ba la yon tan ji yod lta ba dag dngos po yod na ni stong pa nyid mthong bas de dag sel bas stong pa nyid mthong ba la lta ba sel
analyzed: stong pa nyid mthong ba la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa zhes bya ba'i yon tan yod pas de'i phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo @208a * // nyid yod pa ma yin no // gal te gzhan dag na re dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med na yang stong pa nyid mthong ba la yon tan ji yod lta ba dag dngos po yod na ni stong pa nyid mthong bas de dag sel bas stong pa nyid mthong ba la lta ba sel
translated: But since the good quality called “attaining nirvana” exists in seeing emptiness, therefore things do not exist inherently.

original: ba'i yon tan yod do zhe na /
analyzed: ba'i yon tan yod do zhe na /
translated: If others say that even if things do not exist inherently, what good quality is there in seeing emptiness? But if views exist as things, then since they are eliminated by seeing emptiness, there is the good quality of eliminating views in seeing emptiness.

original: de'i lan du rtog pas bcings pa mthong bas na //
analyzed: de'i lan du rtog pas bcings pa mthong bas na //
translated: In response to that, the root verse says that seeing the bondage of conceptuality is the good quality of seeing emptiness.

original: 'dir ni de nyid dgag par bya //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir ni de nyid dgag par bya // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here, that itself is to be refuted.

original: 'di'i don ni dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid yin yang mi stong par rtog pa la mngon par zhe na pas /🔽'khor bar bcings pas bcings pa dag 'di na mthong bas na /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid yin yang mi stong par rtog pa la mngon par zhe na pas / 'khor bar bcings pas bcings pa dag 'di na mthong bas na /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Although all things are emptiness, one is bound in cyclic existence by the manifest adherence to the conception of non-emptiness.

original: de'i phyir mi stong par rtog pas 'khor bar bcings pa'i rtog pa de nyid 'dir dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid mthong ba la yon tan yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi stong par rtog pas 'khor bar bcings pa'i rtog pa de nyid 'dir dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid mthong ba la yon tan yod do //
translated: Thus, since one is bound in cyclic existence by the conception of non-emptiness, that very conception is to be refuted here. Therefore, there is a benefit in seeing emptiness.

original: de lta bas na gang dag 'di skad ces gal te don dam par dngos po rnams yod pa ma yin na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag rgyu med par ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhes zer ba de dag gi lan kyang /🔽rtog pas bcings pa mthong bas na //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang dag 'di skad ces gal te don dam par dngos po rnams yod pa ma yin na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag rgyu med par ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhes zer ba de dag gi lan kyang / rtog pas bcings pa mthong bas na //
translated: Thus, the response to those who say, “If ultimately things do not exist, then how could the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified be tenable without a cause?”

original: zhes bya ba 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di nyid yin te /
translated: is this very statement: “One is bound in cyclic existence by the conception of non-emptiness.”

original: dper na khyim thab gzhan du song ba'i chung mas rang gi khyim thab shi ba'i gtam thos pa'i 'og tu da tsam bdag gi khyim thab bud med gzhan dang 'khrig cing 'dug go snyam pa'i rtog pa skyes na gzhi med pa'i rtog pa des rang gi sems pa
analyzed: dper na khyim thab gzhan du song ba'i chung mas rang gi khyim thab shi ba'i gtam thos pa'i 'og tu da tsam bdag gi khyim thab bud med gzhan dang 'khrig cing 'dug go snyam pa'i rtog pa skyes na gzhi med pa'i rtog pa des rang gi sems pa
translated: For example, when a wife whose husband is away hears the news that her husband has died, and then later on she thinks, “Just now my husband was coupling with another woman,” the thought that arises is groundless.🔽Because of that groundless thought, she becomes bound by jealousy and hatred.

original: phrag dog dang / zhe sdang skyes pas bcings pa dag 'di ni mthong bas dngos po yod pa ma yin bzhin du rang gi rtog pas bcings pa de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pas de 'dir dgag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phrag dog dang / zhe sdang skyes pas bcings pa dag 'di ni mthong bas dngos po yod pa ma yin bzhin du rang gi rtog pas bcings pa de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pas de 'dir dgag par bya ba yin no //
translated: This is like being bound by one’s own thought, although there is no object. Since that is the cause of the afflictions, it is what is to be refuted here.

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If the dependent nature existed,

original: ngo bo nyid mi spong ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa spong ba yang mi srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mi spong ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa spong ba yang mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be impossible to eliminate the afflictions, because its nature could not be relinquished.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis zhus pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis zhus pa /
translated: The noble Subhūti asked the Bhagavat:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te don dam par dngos po thams cad stong pa lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te don dam par dngos po thams cad stong pa lags na /
translated: Blessed One, if ultimately all things are empty,

original: 'o na ji ltar so so'i skye bo rnam par gzhag pa dang / dag bcom pa'i bar dag rnam par gzhag / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar so so'i skye bo rnam par gzhag pa dang / dag bcom pa'i bar dag rnam par gzhag / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: then how are ordinary beings posited, up to how are arhats posited?” The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na mi zhig gnyid log pa'i rmi lam na bdag nyid sprul gdug pas zin te zhi ba la thug pa las dug sman zos pa dang bdag nyid drug med @208b par shes pa de la dug kyang med sman yang med pa de
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na mi zhig gnyid log pa'i rmi lam na bdag nyid sprul gdug pas zin te zhi ba la thug pa las dug sman zos pa dang bdag nyid drug med @208b par shes pa de la dug kyang med sman yang med pa de
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this: for example, a person who falls asleep and in a dream is bitten by a poisonous snake. He takes an antidote to the poison and regains his health. He knows that he is free from poison. In that, there is no poison and no antidote.🔽In the same way, ultimately, in things that do not exist, it is imputed that there is a difference between those with afflictions and those without afflictions.”

original: bzhin du don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin pa dag la tha dad du nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par 'dogs so zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang /🔽kun rdzob tu ni dngos rnams yod //
analyzed: bzhin du don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin pa dag la tha dad du nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par 'dogs so zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang / kun rdzob tu ni dngos rnams yod //
translated: And the noble Sūtra on Entering Lanka also says,🔽Things exist conventionally.

original: don dam du ni dngos po med //
analyzed: don dam du ni dngos po med //
translated: Ultimately, things do not exist.

original: ces gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa blo gros chen pos zhus pa /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa blo gros chen pos zhus pa /
translated: And the noble Sūtra Requested by Mahāmati says,

original: gal te don dam par ngo bo nyid ma mchis na de lta na kun rdzob kyi bden pa mchis sam /
analyzed: gal te don dam par ngo bo nyid ma mchis na de lta na kun rdzob kyi bden pa mchis sam /
translated: “If things do not intrinsically exist in the ultimate, then do conventional truths exist?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat replied,

original: dngos nyid med la gang 'khrul pa //
analyzed: dngos nyid med la gang 'khrul pa //
translated: “That which is confused about the absence of intrinsic reality

original: de ni kun rdzob bden pa'o //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob bden pa'o //
translated: is the conventional truth.

original: zhes gsungs pas gang dngos po nyid med par yongs su ma shes pas ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas gang dngos po nyid med par yongs su ma shes pas ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Thus, that which is confused—that is, the misconception that things have intrinsic nature because their lack of intrinsic nature is not fully understood—is the conventional truth.

original: de nyid ngo bo nyid med pa ni don dam pa yin pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid ngo bo nyid med pa ni don dam pa yin pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the absence of intrinsic nature is the ultimate, things are established as being without intrinsic nature, and nirvāṇa is attained.

original: gal te gnyi ga ma yin no zhes spros pa byed pas spros pa yang ma spangs so zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re gnyi ga ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang spros pa yin pas khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga ma yin no zhes spros pa byed pas spros pa yang ma spangs so zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re gnyi ga ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang spros pa yin pas khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon
translated: If you say that the objection still stands because you have not abandoned mental fabrication since you engage in mental fabrication by saying “neither,”

original: yod do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: yod do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: then this is the opponent’s statement that since “neither” is also mental fabrication, the objection still stands because it contradicts your assertion.

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: de las gzhan pa'i spros pa dgag par 'dod pas de skad smras kyang skyon med de zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i spros pa dgag par 'dod pas de skad smras kyang skyon med de zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: we say that although we say that in order to refute mental fabrication other than that, there is no error.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa las gzhan pa stong pa dang / mi stong pa zhes pa dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa las gzhan pa stong pa dang / mi stong pa zhes pa dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we assert that emptiness and nonemptiness are other than “neither,” we assert that they are refuted.

original: de nyid kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: dper na rang nyid sgra mi 'dod pas gzhan dag gi sgra dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir sgra ma 'byin zhes brjod pa la skyon med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: dper na rang nyid sgra mi 'dod pas gzhan dag gi sgra dgag par 'dod pa'i phyir sgra ma 'byin zhes brjod pa la skyon med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: he says, for example, it is like the absence of error when someone says, “Do not make a sound” because he himself does not want to make a sound but wants to stop others from making a sound.

original: yang na don dam pa ston par byed pa rgyu'i shes pa tha snyad pa'i shes pa khyad par la don dam pa nye bar gdags pa byas nas don dam par dngos po rnams stong ngo zhes dam bcas pa'i phyir skyon med de zhes bya bas ni sngar don🔽dam par ni spros pa med mod kyi kun rdzob tu ma spros na don dam pa mi rtogs pas kun rdzob kyi sgo nas don dam par stong pa nyid do zhes bstan pa de las rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston te /
analyzed: yang na don dam pa ston par byed pa rgyu'i shes pa tha snyad pa'i shes pa khyad par la don dam pa nye bar gdags pa byas nas don dam par dngos po rnams stong ngo zhes dam bcas pa'i phyir skyon med de zhes bya bas ni sngar don dam par ni spros pa med mod kyi kun rdzob tu ma spros na don dam pa mi rtogs pas kun rdzob kyi sgo nas don dam par stong pa nyid do zhes bstan pa de las rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ston te /
translated: Or else, the ultimate is imputed to the causal consciousness that teaches the ultimate, and the conventional consciousness that is qualified, and it is said that ultimately things are empty.🔽This is saying that although ultimately there is no conceptual elaboration, if there were no elaboration conventionally, the ultimate could not be realized. Therefore, it is taught that ultimately things are empty from the conventional perspective. This is explained in a different way.

original: 'dis ni don dam pa ston pa'i shes pa kun rdzob pa la don dam pa nye bar btags te /🔽don dam par dngos po rnams @209a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni don dam pa ston pa'i shes pa kun rdzob pa la don dam pa nye bar btags te / don dam par dngos po rnams @209a * //
translated: This is saying that the ultimate is imputed to the conventional consciousness that teaches the ultimate, and it is taught that ultimately things are empty.

original: stong ngo zhes bstan pa khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: stong ngo zhes bstan pa khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon med do zhes bstan to //
translated: This is saying that there is no fault of contradiction in accepting this teaching.

original: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of this,

original: 'og nas kyang /
analyzed: 'og nas kyang /
translated: the text below says:

original: tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
analyzed: tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
translated: Without depending on conventions,

original: dam pa'i don ni bstan mi nus //🔽zhes 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dam pa'i don ni bstan mi nus // zhes 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The ultimate truth cannot be taught.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa brtag pa'i skabs nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa brtag pa'i skabs nas 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated in the chapter on the noble truths.

original: gzhan yang mi stong pa dgag pa kho na'i phyir stong pa nyid ces brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi stong pa dgag pa kho na'i phyir stong pa nyid ces brjod par zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, he says that emptiness is mentioned only to refute non-emptiness,🔽but since it is not taught that emptiness is to be established, there is no fault.

original: stong pa nyid du bsgrub pa gtso cher ma bstan pas skyon med do zhes bya bas ni med par dgag pa bstan gyi ma yin par dgag pa ma bstan pas skyon med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du bsgrub pa gtso cher ma bstan pas skyon med do zhes bya bas ni med par dgag pa bstan gyi ma yin par dgag pa ma bstan pas skyon med do zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that he teaches that there is no fault because he teaches an implicative negation, not an absolute negation.

original: de'i phyir de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid stong yang gang dag 'di skad ces 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa de rtag pa 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid stong yang gang dag 'di skad ces 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa de rtag pa 'am /
translated: Therefore, in this way, although the Tathāgata is empty of intrinsic reality, those who say, “The Tathāgata is permanent,”

original: mi rtag pa'am /🔽rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa'am /🔽rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'am / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa'am / rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: “impermanent,”🔽“both permanent and impermanent,”

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa'am /
translated: “neither permanent nor impermanent,”

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten mtha' yod pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten mtha' yod pa'am /
translated: and similarly, “the world has an end,”

original: 'jig rten mtha' med pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' med pa'am /
translated: “the world is endless,”

original: mtha' yod kyang yod la /🔽mtha' med kyang med pa'am /🔽mtha' yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mtha' yod kyang yod la / mtha' med kyang med pa'am / mtha' yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Because it would follow that the self would be both finite and infinite,

original: mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: or neither finite nor infinite.

original: de dag ji ltar 'grub pa de bzhin du bdag kyang 'grub la /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar 'grub pa de bzhin du bdag kyang 'grub la /
translated: The self would be established in the same way that those are established,🔽and things would also be established.🔽Those who assert that the self and the aggregates substantially exist say, “The Tathāgata would be one of the four: permanent, impermanent, both, or neither.”

original: dngos po rnams kyang 'grub po zhes zer ba zhes bya ba ni bdag dang phung po rdzas su yod par smra ba dag / de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhi po dag las gang yang rung ba gcig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam pa po'i de bzhin gshegs pa rdzas su yod par grub pas bdag kyang rdzas su yod par grub la /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyang 'grub po zhes zer ba zhes bya ba ni bdag dang phung po rdzas su yod par smra ba dag / de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhi po dag las gang yang rung ba gcig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam pa po'i de bzhin gshegs pa rdzas su yod par grub pas bdag kyang rdzas su yod par grub la /
translated: The reason is, “Because it would follow that the Tathāgata who is an ultimate existent would be substantially existent.” Therefore the self would be substantially existent.

original: 'jig rten mtha' yod pa dang / mtha' med pa la sogs pa bzhi po dag las gang yang rung ba gcig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis kun rdzob pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rdzas su yod par grub pas dngos po rnams kyang rdzas su yod par grub po zhes zer ba'i
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' yod pa dang / mtha' med pa la sogs pa bzhi po dag las gang yang rung ba gcig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis kun rdzob pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rdzas su yod par grub pas dngos po rnams kyang rdzas su yod par grub po zhes zer ba'i
translated: The reason “because it would follow that the Tathāgata would be any one of the four alternatives, such as the world having an end or no end” proves that the Tathāgata of the conventional truth exists substantially. Therefore things also exist substantially.

original: tshig yin no //
analyzed: tshig yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: Therefore this is explained:

original: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
translated: The four such as permanent and impermanent

original: zhi ba 'di lug la yod //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di lug la yod //
translated: Do not exist in this peace.

original: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
translated: The four such as having an end and not having an end

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
translated: Do not exist in this peace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i zhi ba 'di la ste zhes bya bas ni don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku ngo bo nyid kyis @209b ma skyes pa zhi ba 'di la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhir lung bstan du med la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i zhi ba 'di la ste zhes bya bas ni don dam pa pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku ngo bo nyid kyis @209b ma skyes pa zhi ba 'di la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhir lung bstan du med la /
translated: The four such as permanent and impermanent cannot be declared in this peace, which is the Tathāgata not arisen by an essence, that is, the ultimate Tathāgata, the dharma body not arisen by an essence.

original: kun rdzob pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs kyi sku don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa zhi ba 'di la mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs pa bzhir lung bstan du med pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir bdag dang dngos po
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs kyi sku don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa zhi ba 'di la mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs pa bzhir lung bstan du med pas pha rol po'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir bdag dang dngos po
translated: The ultimate non-arising of the conventional tathāgata, the form body, is peace. Since it cannot be declared in the four ways, such as having an end, it is not the case that the opponent’s reason is not established.

original: rnams ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa'i dper de bzhin gshegs pa ma grub po zhes ston to //
analyzed: rnams ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa'i dper de bzhin gshegs pa ma grub po zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, the example of the tathāgata is not established for those who assert that the self and things exist inherently.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that point,

original: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs grub na dpe yang 'grub pa zhig na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs grub na dpe yang 'grub pa zhig na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “If the reason is established, then the example is also established,” which is the remainder of the sentence.

original: gtan tshigs rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa dag ma grub pas dpe de bzhin gshegs pa yang mi 'grub po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa dag ma grub pas dpe de bzhin gshegs pa yang mi 'grub po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since the reasons such as being permanent and impermanent are not established, the example, the tathāgata, is not established.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni don dam par ni pha rol po'i gtan tshigs rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa dag gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa la med pas thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ma grub la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni don dam par ni pha rol po'i gtan tshigs rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa dag gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa la med pas thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ma grub la /
translated: Therefore, the reason is contradictory because ultimately, the reasoner’s reasons such as permanence and impermanence do not exist in the Tathāgata, and hence they are not commonly established.

original: kun rdzob tu ni don dam par sgrub pa dang 'gal ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni don dam par sgrub pa dang 'gal ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: Conventionally, it is taught that the reason is contradictory because it contradicts the proof.

original: yang na sgrub pa ji skad bstan pas bcom ldan 'das brten nas gdags pa ngo bo nyid stong pa la /
analyzed: yang na sgrub pa ji skad bstan pas bcom ldan 'das brten nas gdags pa ngo bo nyid stong pa la /
translated: Or, the proof is as follows: The Blessed One taught that dependent imputation is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //

analyzed: gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid @211b do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: difference, and so on.

original: kha cig ni de bzhin gshegs pa don dam par phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin par yongs su rtog / kha cig ni khams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / kha cig ni skye mched kyi ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: kha cig ni de bzhin gshegs pa don dam par phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin par yongs su rtog / kha cig ni khams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / kha cig ni skye mched kyi ngo bo nyid /
translated: Some imagine that the Tathāgata is ultimately the nature of the aggregates, some imagine that he is the nature of the constituents, some imagine that he is the nature of the sources,

original: kha cig ni mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid /🔽kha cig ni mtshan gzhi'i ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: kha cig ni mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid / kha cig ni mtshan gzhi'i ngo bo nyid /
translated: some imagine that he is the nature of characteristics,🔽some imagine that he is the nature of the basis of characteristics,

original: kha cig ni rgyu'i ngo bo nyid ;
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyu'i ngo bo nyid ;
translated: some imagine that he is the nature of causes,

original: kha cig ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid /🔽kha cig ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid / kha cig ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid /
translated: some imagine that he is the nature of effects,🔽some imagine that he is the nature of things,

original: kha cig ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: kha cig ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid /
translated: some imagine that he is the nature of nonthings,🔽and some imagine that he is the nature of sameness and difference.

original: kha cig ni gcig pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: kha cig ni gcig pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid /
translated: Some imagine that the Tathāgata is the entity of one,🔽some imagine that he is the entity of another, and so on.

original: kha cig ni gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa de dag ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid tsam du zad de /
analyzed: kha cig ni gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su rtog pa de dag ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid tsam du zad de /
translated: But these are mere imagined entities,

original: don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas de dag gi bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'gro ba 'di dag kyang ngo bo nyid med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas de dag gi bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'gro ba 'di dag kyang ngo bo nyid med do zhes ston to //
translated: because in reality they do not exist. Therefore, the Tathāgata and this world do not have an intrinsic reality.

original: de la re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa phung po'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa phung po'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that the Tathāgata imagined to be the entity of the aggregates is essenceless,🔽it says:

original: de la / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma rtogs par //
analyzed: de la / gzugs kyi rgyu ni ma rtogs par //
translated: Without realizing the cause of form,

original: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: form is not perceived.

original: zhes der bstan pa'i tshul gyis phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes der bstan pa'i tshul gyis phung po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: As it is taught there, because the aggregates are essenceless, the Tathāgata who is of their nature is also essenceless.

original: phung po brtag pa'i skabs der de skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: phung po brtag pa'i skabs der de skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: This is the way it is taught in the chapter on the examination of the aggregates.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the absence of intrinsic reality of the perfect examination of the realm of the tathāgata, of entity, of nonentity, of the basis of characteristics, and of the nature of characteristics,🔽it says:

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
translated: Prior to the characteristic of space,

original: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: space does not exist in the least.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa der /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa der /
translated: And so on.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa khams drug po dag yongs su brtags na dngos po yang ma yin /🔽dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la sogs pa khams drug po dag yongs su brtags na dngos po yang ma yin / dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
translated: Here, when the six elements such as space are perfectly examined, they are not entities,🔽they are not nonentities,

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin /
translated: they are not the basis of characteristics,🔽and they are not the nature of characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pas dngos po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du brtags pa yang yongs su brtags na dngos po yang ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pas dngos po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du brtags pa yang yongs su brtags na dngos po yang ma yin /
translated: Likewise, when the imputed identity of the thus-gone one as the nature of the consciousness element, and so on, is thoroughly investigated, it is not a thing,

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
translated: it is not a nonthing,

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang ma yin /
translated: it is not a basis of characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pas dngos @212a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pas dngos @212a * //
translated: and it is not a characteristic.🔽Therefore, because of the identitylessness of things,

original: po dang ; dngos po med pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: po dang ; dngos po med pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: nonthings, bases of characteristics, and characteristics,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is taught to be identitylessness.

original: khams brtag pa'i skabs der de skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: khams brtag pa'i skabs der de skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: This is stated in the context of the investigation of the elements.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skye mched kyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skye mched kyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the identitylessness of the imputed identity of the thus-gone one as the nature of the sense sources,

original: ji ltar skye mched brtag par skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de las ma gtogs pa'i lta ba po la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du skye mched kyi bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa yang ngo bo nyid
analyzed: ji ltar skye mched brtag par skye mched rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa de las ma gtogs pa'i lta ba po la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du skye mched kyi bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa yang ngo bo nyid
translated: Just as the analysis of the senses shows that the senses are devoid of intrinsic existence, and apart from that there is no such thing as a seer and so on, in the same way, the Tathāgata, who is the nature of the senses, is also devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: med pa nyid yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: med pa nyid yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Just as the analysis of the sense bases teaches that the sense bases are essenceless, and apart from that there is no such thing as a seer and so on, in the same way, since the Tathagata, who is the nature of the sense bases, is also essenceless, the Tathagata is essenceless.

original: skye mched brtag pa'i skabs der de skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: skye mched brtag pa'i skabs der de skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: This is stated in the chapter on the analysis of the sense bases, in the same way that it is taught there.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa de bzhin du yongs su brtags pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar me dang bud shing brtag par gcig pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa de bzhin du yongs su brtags pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar me dang bud shing brtag par gcig pa nyid dang /
translated: In order to teach that the Tathagata is essenceless in the sense of being the nature of identity and difference, and so on, just as fire and fuel are essenceless, the chapter on fire and fuel is stated.

original: gzhan nyid dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid bkag pas de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du shes pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa dang / shes bya dang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: gzhan nyid dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid bkag pas de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du shes pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa dang / shes bya dang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: Since they are refuted as being the same or different, or as being inexpressible, they are essenceless.🔽Likewise, the Tathāgata, which is characterized by consciousness, and the characteristic of the collection of the Buddha’s qualities,🔽and the Tathāgata, which is the collection of the dharmadhātu, are not essentially the same or different, or inexpressible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus pa can dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dag kyang gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus pa can dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dag kyang gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is essenceless.

original: me dang bud shing /
analyzed: me dang bud shing /
translated: This is just like the case of fire and fuel.

original: brtag par de skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
