analyzed: brtag par de skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: This is the way to understand the refutation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su brtag pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su brtag pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the Tathāgata is essenceless in terms of being the nature of cause and effect, etc.,

original: skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / song ba dang / ma song ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed par song ba dang / ma song ba la sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i rab tu byed par skye ba la sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / song ba dang / ma song ba brtag pa'i rab tu byed par song ba dang / ma song ba la sogs pa bkag pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because arising and so on are refuted in the chapter on nonarising, and because going, not going, and so on are refuted in the chapter on the analysis of going and not going, arising and so on have no intrinsic reality, and so the Tathāgata has no intrinsic reality.

original: rab tu byed pa da dag rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / skye ba dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba dgag pa ji skad bstan pa'i tshul @212b gyis so //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ji lta bar 'gro ba 'di yang ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya bas ni /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa dngos nyid med //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa da dag rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / skye ba dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba dgag pa ji skad bstan pa'i tshul @212b gyis so // de bzhin gshegs pa ji lta bar 'gro ba 'di yang ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya bas ni / de bzhin gshegs pa dngos nyid med //
translated: This is because the chapters explain that the activity of cause and effect, arising, going, and so on are refuted by the method taught.

original: 'gro 'di ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: 'gro 'di ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Just as the Tathāgata has no intrinsic reality, so too this world has no intrinsic reality.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the summary of the chapter:🔽The Tathāgata has no intrinsic reality.🔽This world has no intrinsic reality.

original: de lta bas na mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, since there is no similar example, the meaning of the reason is not established, and it is contradictory. This is the summary of the section.

original: pha rol po dag don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhin no zhes bya ba de ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub pas mthun pa'i
analyzed: pha rol po dag don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhin no zhes bya ba de ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub pas mthun pa'i
translated: The opponent’s example of the Tathāgata’s body, which is similar to the position that ultimately things such as form exist inherently, is not established as existing inherently.

original: phyogs med pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs dngos po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid la /
analyzed: phyogs med pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs dngos po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid la /
translated: Since there is no similar example, the meaning of the reason, “because things exist,” is not established ultimately.

original: kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Conventionally, it is contradictory.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i bsgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang / tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i bsgrub pa'i skyon brjod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang / tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The meaning of this chapter is that the teaching of the Tathagata's dharmakaya is the expression of the faults of the proof stated by the opponent in the first chapter.🔽The meaning of this chapter is to be seen as the result of valid cognition, for in this chapter, the twenty-second chapter of the investigation of the Tathagata, the result of valid cognition is the meaning of the chapter.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu gnyis pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur blta ba ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por mdo sde pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba dag gis don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu gnyis pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur blta ba ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i dang por mdo sde pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba dag gis don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: In the first chapter of this text, the Sautrantikas and Vaibhaikas say that ultimately, entities such as form do indeed exist inherently.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhin no zhes bya ba smras pa'i dpe de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du brjod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhin no zhes bya ba smras pa'i dpe de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du brjod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bstan pa yin te /
translated: Because it is a thing, like the body of the Tathāgata.”🔽The body of the Tathāgata is taught to be the Dharma Body of the Tathāgata, because it is said that the Tathāgata himself is essenceless.

original: 'di ltar phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags pa'i rnam pa de dag thams cad chos kyi sku la yod pa ma yin pas de dag yongs su brtsal ba nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su brtags pa'i rnam pa de dag thams cad chos kyi sku la yod pa ma yin pas de dag yongs su brtsal ba nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since all of these aspects that are imagined to be the essence of the aggregates, constituents, sense-spheres, characteristics, bases of characteristics, causes, effects, things, non-things, sameness, difference, and so on do not exist in the Dharma Body, by searching for them, the Dharma Body of the Tathāgata is established.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa bden pa pos bstan pa'i le'u las btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu gzugs mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //🔽rnam par shes pa'i bar du mthong ba ni de bzhin @213a * //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa bden pa pos bstan pa'i le'u las btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu gzugs mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no // rnam par shes pa'i bar du mthong ba ni de bzhin @213a * //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, seeing form is not seeing the Tathāgata.

original: gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Seeing up to consciousness is not seeing the Tathāgata.

original: sa'i khams mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sa'i khams mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Seeing the earth element is not seeing the Tathāgata.

original: rlung gi khams kyi bar du mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi bar du mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Seeing up to the wind element is not seeing the Tathāgata.

original: bdag mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Seeing a self is not seeing the Tathāgata.

original: sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag mthong ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //🔽ngar 'dzin pa mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag mthong ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no // ngar 'dzin pa mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Seeing a sentient being, a living being, one who is nourished, a human, or a person is not seeing the Tathāgata.🔽Seeing grasping an “I” is not seeing the Tathāgata.

original: nga yir 'dzin pa mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Seeing grasping an “I am” is not seeing the Tathāgata.

original: mtshan ma mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: Seeing the Tathāgata is not seeing signs.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar mtshan ma rnams ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar mtshan ma rnams ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, in this way, not seeing signs is seeing the Tathāgata.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Seeing without attachment is not seeing the Tathāgata.

original: dngos po med pa mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Seeing non-entities is not seeing the Tathāgata.🔽Seeing the limit of reality is not seeing the Tathāgata.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /🔽de'i phyir / sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ma yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste / de'i phyir / sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
translated: As it is said,

original: de la sku med der de med //
analyzed: de la sku med der de med //
translated: The Tathāgata is not the body, nor is he other than the body.🔽The body is not the Tathāgata, nor is he in the body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
translated: The Tathāgata does not possess a body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
translated: What then is the Tathāgata?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa sun phyung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa sun phyung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, it is not the case that the Tathāgata is refuted by statements such as these.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku don dam pa dang / gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa dag don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gsal ba'i don gyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku don dam pa dang / gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa dag don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gsal ba'i don gyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The ultimate reality of the Tathāgata’s Dharma body and the conventional reality of his form body are both devoid of intrinsic reality, and this is the meaning of the statement that the Tathāgata’s Dharma body is unobservable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bstan pa 'di la yon tan ji yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya ste ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bstan pa 'di la yon tan ji yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya ste ;
translated: To demonstrate the qualities of this teaching on the Tathāgata’s Dharma body and to dispel the claim of others that this teaching is merely a dry treatise of sophistry, here we will also establish the scriptural sources of this teaching.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, the noble Sūtra on Entering Lanka says:

original: blo gros chen po rtag pa ma yin pa dang / mi rtag pa ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / rgyu ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas ma yin pa dang / blo ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: blo gros chen po rtag pa ma yin pa dang / mi rtag pa ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / rgyu ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas ma yin pa dang / blo ma yin pa dang /
translated: Mahāmati, it is not permanent, not impermanent, not a result, not a cause, not compounded, not uncompounded, not cognition,

original: rtogs par bya ba ma @213b yin pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid ma yin pa dang / phung po rnams ma yin pa dang / phung po rnams las gzhan ma yin pa dang / brjod pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba ma @213b yin pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma yin pa dang / mtshan nyid ma yin pa dang / phung po rnams ma yin pa dang / phung po rnams las gzhan ma yin pa dang / brjod pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: not an object of realization, not a basis of characteristics, not a characteristic, not the aggregates, not different from the aggregates, not expressible,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / gnyi ga dang 'brel pa ma yin pa dang / gang dmigs su med pa de ni spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / gcig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / gnyi ga dang 'brel pa ma yin pa dang / gang dmigs su med pa de ni spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'o //
translated: not inexpressible, not the same, not different, not connected with both, and it is not apprehended. That which is not apprehended is beyond all conceptual elaborations.

original: gang spros pa thams cad las 'das pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gang spros pa thams cad las 'das pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: That which is beyond all conceptual elaborations is the Tathāgata.”

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: Likewise, the Sūtra Teaching the Secrets of the Tathāgatas says:🔽Śhāntimati, the body of the tathāgatas is called the dharmakāya.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dgu dang / gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga dang / gsung rab kyi sku'i mtshan nyid gcig dang /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dgu dang / gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga dang / gsung rab kyi sku'i mtshan nyid gcig dang /
translated: It teaches the nine aspects of the characteristics of the dharmakāya of the tathāgatas, the five aspects of the characteristics of the rūpakāya, the one aspect of the characteristics of the body of the scriptures,

original: sku gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi dang / chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid gzhan rnam pa drug bstan te /
analyzed: sku gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi dang / chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid gzhan rnam pa drug bstan te /
translated: the four aspects of the characteristics of both bodies, and the six other aspects of the characteristics of the dharmakāya.

original: de la chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dgu la /
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dgu la /
translated: The nine aspects of the characteristics of the dharmakāya are as follows.

original: nam mkha'i sku zhes bya ba ni shes bya la ye shes kyi mthu thogs pa med pa bstan te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i sku zhes bya ba ni shes bya la ye shes kyi mthu thogs pa med pa bstan te /
translated: The “space-like body” teaches the unimpeded power of the wisdom of the tathāgatas with regard to objects of knowledge.

original: ji ltar nam mkhas dngos po thams cad la khyab pa de ltar chos kyi sku'i rgyu las byung ba'i ye shes kyis shes bya thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkhas dngos po thams cad la khyab pa de ltar chos kyi sku'i rgyu las byung ba'i ye shes kyis shes bya thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as space pervades all things, so the wisdom that arises from the cause of the dharmakāya pervades all objects of knowledge.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang mnyam pa bstan te /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang mnyam pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the body that is equal to the unequalled” indicates that the body of a tathāgata is equal to all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa gzhan la med pas de dag dang mi mnyam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag nas gzhan dang mi mnyam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang mnyam par bstan
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa gzhan la med pas de dag dang mi mnyam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dpe nyid du nye bar gzhag nas gzhan dang mi mnyam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang mnyam par bstan
translated: The qualities of a tathāgata do not exist in anyone who is not a tathāgata. Therefore, after the tathāgatas, who are unequalled in that they possess those qualities, have been presented as an example, the tathāgatas, who are equal to those tathāgatas who are unequalled, are then presented.

original: te / dper na /
analyzed: te / dper na /
translated: For example,

original: snyan dngags kyi mtshan nyid las de dang mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan med pa la de nyid dper gzhag pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: snyan dngags kyi mtshan nyid las de dang mthun pa'i phyogs gzhan med pa la de nyid dper gzhag pa 'di lta ste /
translated: in the definition of poetry, when there is nothing else that is similar to it, that very thing is presented as an example.

original: sgra sgrogs kyi bu dang rangs byed kyi bu'i g-yul sprod pa ni sgra sgrogs kyi bu dang rangs byed kyi bu'i g-yul nyid 'dra'o zhes bya ba lta bu 'am //
analyzed: sgra sgrogs kyi bu dang rangs byed kyi bu'i g-yul sprod pa ni sgra sgrogs kyi bu dang rangs byed kyi bu'i g-yul nyid 'dra'o zhes bya ba lta bu 'am //
translated: For example, “The battle between the sons of Ghaṭotkaca and the sons of Rāvaṇa is like the battle between the sons of Ghaṭotkaca and the sons of Rāvaṇa.”

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med la sogs pa'i chos kyi sku 'gro ba gzhan dang mi mnyam pa de dang 'dir mnyam pas mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med la sogs pa'i chos kyi sku 'gro ba gzhan dang mi mnyam pa de dang 'dir mnyam pas mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Or else, the dharmakaya of the Tathagata Amitabha and so forth is unequalled by other beings, and here it is equal to that, so it is the equal of the unequal.

original: yang na mi mnyam pa ni gang dag phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa @214a * //🔽la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag ste /
analyzed: yang na mi mnyam pa ni gang dag phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa @214a * // la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag ste /
translated: Or else, the unequal is attachment and aversion to those who benefit and harm,🔽respectively.

original: de dag sku 'di la mnyam pas mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de dag sku 'di la mnyam pas mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Since they are equal in this body, it is the equal of the unequal.

original: yang na ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan dang phan tshun mnyam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan dang phan tshun mnyam pa yin gyi /
translated: Or else, the characteristic of an objective support is equal to the characteristic of another objective support,

original: stong pa nyid du dmigs pa ni de dag dang mi mnyam te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du dmigs pa ni de dag dang mi mnyam te /
translated: but the objective support of emptiness is not equal to them.

original: mi mnyam pa des mnyam par gyur pa'i sku ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa des mnyam par gyur pa'i sku ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: The body that is equalized by that inequality is the equal of the unequal.

original: 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni yon tan mchog tu gyur pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni yon tan mchog tu gyur pa nyid bstan te /
translated: The line “the body that is superior to all worlds” teaches the quality of being supreme.

original: gang yon tan mchog tu gyur cing lhag pa de nyid 'jig rten na khyad par du 'phags pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yon tan mchog tu gyur cing lhag pa de nyid 'jig rten na khyad par du 'phags pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is supreme in terms of qualities is said to be especially exalted in the world.

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yin par bstan te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yin par bstan te /
translated: The body that is the reality of all sentient beings is explained by the phrase “the body that is the reality of all sentient beings.”

original: 'di ltar chos kyi sku stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni sems can thams cad la rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi sku stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni sems can thams cad la rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the Dharma body, which has the characteristic of emptiness, is the reality of all sentient beings because it is the reality of all sentient beings.

original: dpe med pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni yon tan rnams kyi gong na lhag pa gzhan med pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: dpe med pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni yon tan rnams kyi gong na lhag pa gzhan med pa nyid bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the body that is incomparable” teaches that there is nothing higher than its qualities.

original: 'di ltar yon tan gyis lhag pa dpe nyid du byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar yon tan gyis lhag pa dpe nyid du byed kyi /
translated: Thus, a higher quality is made into an analogy,

original: dma' ba dpe nyid du mi byed de /
analyzed: dma' ba dpe nyid du mi byed de /
translated: but a lower quality is not made into an analogy.

original: dper na bu mo'i bzhin zla ba 'dra'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bu mo'i bzhin zla ba 'dra'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “The face of the young woman is like the moon.”

original: 'dra ba med pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni de'i yon tan rnams gzhan la med par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dra ba med pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni de'i yon tan rnams gzhan la med par bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the body that is without equal” teaches that its qualities are not found in others.

original: 'di ltar yon tan mnyam pa la 'dra ba zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yon tan mnyam pa la 'dra ba zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that equality of qualities is sameness.

original: rnam par dag pa'i sku zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sku zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par bstan te /
translated: The phrase “body of purity” shows the absence of the conceptualization of the grasped.

original: 'di ltar gang la ngar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa de rnam par dag par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la ngar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa de rnam par dag par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that in which the conceptualization of “I” does not exist is held to be pure.

original: dri ma med pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa med par bstan te /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa med par bstan te /
translated: The phrase “stainless body” shows the absence of the conceptualization of the grasper.

original: 'di ltar gang la nga yir 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med cing phyi rol gyi yun mi dmigs pa de dri ma med par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la nga yir 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med cing phyi rol gyi yun mi dmigs pa de dri ma med par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that in which the conceptualization of “mine” does not exist and external things are not perceived is held to be stainless.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyi ga med par bstan te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyi ga med par bstan te /
translated: The phrase “uncontaminated body” shows the absence of both the conceptualization of the grasped and the conceptualization of the grasper.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs par bya ba dag yod na kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs par bya ba dag yod na kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because if there were defilement and the defiled, there would be contamination.

original: stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas de gnyis med na kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas de gnyis med na kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are of one taste in emptiness, if those two do not exist, it is not defiled.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dgu @214b bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa dgu @214b bstan to //
translated: Thus, those nine aspects indicate the characteristics of the dharmakāya of the Tathāgata.

original: gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga la /
translated: The five aspects indicate the characteristics of the rūpakāya.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sku zhes bya bas ni sgo nga las skye ba'i skye gnas dri mas mgos pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sku zhes bya bas ni sgo nga las skye ba'i skye gnas dri mas mgos pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The statement “the body that is naturally luminous” indicates that it is not born from an egg, because it is free from the stain of birth.

original: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni mang la nas skye ba'i skye gnas kyis ma bsdus pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni mang la nas skye ba'i skye gnas kyis ma bsdus pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The statement “the body that is naturally unborn” indicates that it is not born from a womb, because it is free from the stain of birth.

original: rang bzhin gyis ma byung ba'i sku zhes bya bas ni drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas su ma gtogs pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma byung ba'i sku zhes bya bas ni drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas su ma gtogs pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The statement “the body that is naturally non-arisen” indicates that it is not born from heat and moisture, because it is free from the stain of birth.

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang ma 'dres pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang ma 'dres pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The statement “the body that is not mixed with mind, mentality, and consciousness” indicates that it is not born spontaneously, because it is free from the stain of birth.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The cause of the afflictions is taught to be the absence of the mode of birth by transformation.

original: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs dang / bsod nams dang ye shes la sogs pa'i rkyen las byung ba sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs dang / bsod nams dang ye shes la sogs pa'i rkyen las byung ba sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
translated: The essence of the body that is like an illusion, a mirage, and the reflection of the moon in water is taught to be the essence of the body of manifestation, which arises from the power of previous aspirations and the conditions of merit, wisdom, and so on.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga yin no //
translated: These are the five characteristics of the form body of the Tathāgata.

original: gsung rab kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gcig ni /
analyzed: gsung rab kyi sku'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gcig ni /
translated: The one characteristic of the body of the scriptures is

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pas nges par 'byung ba'i sku zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pas nges par 'byung ba'i sku zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: taught by the phrase “the body that is the escape through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.”

original: des ni rnam par thar pa gsum la sogs pa bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gsung rab kyi sku bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des ni rnam par thar pa gsum la sogs pa bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gsung rab kyi sku bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: Through this, one should understand that the body of the scriptures is taught through the characteristic of teaching the three doors of liberation and so on.

original: sku gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi la /
analyzed: sku gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi la /
translated: The four characteristics of both bodies are

original: phyogs bcu'i nam mkhas khyab pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni chos kyi sku'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang bstan la /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i nam mkhas khyab pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni chos kyi sku'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang bstan la /
translated: The phrase “his body pervades the space of the ten directions” indicates the characteristic of emptiness of the Dharma Body.

original: gzugs kyi sku'i rdzu 'phrul rnam par ston pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku'i rdzu 'phrul rnam par ston pa yang bstan to //
translated: The phrase “he manifests the miracles of the Form Body” indicates the manifestation of the Form Body.

original: sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni sku de gnyis nyid kyis sems can la phan 'dogs pa la sems snyoms pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni sku de gnyis nyid kyis sems can la phan 'dogs pa la sems snyoms pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase “his body is impartial toward all sentient beings” indicates that, by means of these two bodies, he benefits sentient beings impartially.

original: mtha' yas mu med pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni sku de gnyis nyid kyis 'khor bar gdul ba'i dbang gis sku nye bar stong pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: mtha' yas mu med pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni sku de gnyis nyid kyis 'khor bar gdul ba'i dbang gis sku nye bar stong pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase “his body is infinite and boundless” indicates that, by means of these two bodies, he never abandons the world because of the need to discipline sentient beings.

original: g-yo ba med pa dang rlom sems med pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni sku de gnyis nyid bdag dang gzhan gyi rlom sems dang bral zhing gdul ba dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don las mi g-yo ba nyid bstan te /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa dang rlom sems med pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni sku de gnyis nyid bdag dang gzhan gyi rlom sems dang bral zhing gdul ba dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don las mi g-yo ba nyid bstan te /
translated: The phrase “his body is without movement and without conceit” indicates that, by means of these two bodies, he is free from the conceit of self and other and never abandons the task of disciplining the immeasurable sentient beings.

original: de dag ni sku gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sku gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: These are the four characteristics of the two bodies.

original: chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid gzhan rnam pa drug la /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid gzhan rnam pa drug la /
translated: The other six characteristics of the Dharma Body are:

original: mi gnas pas gnas pa las mi g-yo ba thob pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni lung mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan @215a * //
analyzed: mi gnas pas gnas pa las mi g-yo ba thob pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni lung mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan @215a * //
translated: The statement, “The Body which has attained the unmoving state through non-abiding,” teaches the characteristic of the non-apprehension of scriptural instruction.

original: to ; / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni phung po lnga po dag dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba bstan to //
analyzed: to ; / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni phung po lnga po dag dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba bstan to //
translated: The statement, “The Body which is not the reality of form, feeling, conception, impulse, or consciousness,” teaches the characteristic of the Dharma Body as being unlike the five aggregates.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gis rab tu phye ba ma yin pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gis rab tu phye ba ma yin pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par bstan to //
translated: The statement, “The Body which is not distinguished by earth, water, fire, or air,” teaches the characteristic of the Dharma Body as not being composed of the elements.

original: 'byung ba ma yin pa dang / 'byung ba ma yin pa ma yin pa dang / 'byung ba chen pos rab tu phye ba ma yin pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'byung ba ma yin pa dang / 'byung ba ma yin pa ma yin pa dang / 'byung ba chen pos rab tu phye ba ma yin pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par bstan to //
translated: The statement, “The Body which is not an element, not non-element, and not distinguished by the great elements,” teaches the characteristic of the Dharma Body as not being the reality of the elements.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa ma yin pa'i chos 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa ma yin pa'i chos 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin par bstan to //
translated: The body that is not real and not unreal, which is not in accord with the whole world, shows that it is not characterized by action, affliction, and birth.

original: mig las ma byung ba dang / rna ba la mi brten pa dang / snas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa dang / lces rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang / lus dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyi sku'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: mig las ma byung ba dang / rna ba la mi brten pa dang / snas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa dang / lces rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang / lus dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i sku zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyi sku'i ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: The body that does not arise from the eye, that does not depend on the ear, that is not cognized by the nose, that is not distinguished by the tongue, that is not associated with the body, shows the essence of the natural body.

original: de dag la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi gsang ba bstan pa de dag kyang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi gsang ba bstan pa de dag kyang grub pa yin no //
translated: These and other such teachings on the secret of the body, speech, and mind of the Tathāgata are established.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa sgo mtha' yas pas grub pa'i gzungs las /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa sgo mtha' yas pas grub pa'i gzungs las /
translated: Similarly, in the Noble Dhāraṇī of the Accomplishment of Infinite Gates,🔽it says:

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'ba' zhig sgom par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'ba' zhig sgom par byed de /
translated: “One should cultivate the recollection of the Buddha alone.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs las mi mthong ba dang / gzugs ma yin pa dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs las mi mthong ba dang / gzugs ma yin pa dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba dang /
translated: It is not seeing the Tathagata as form, or as not form, or as the major or minor marks, or as ethics, or concentration, or wisdom, or liberation, or the vision of the wisdom of liberation.🔽It is not seeing him in terms of time, clan, family, birth, retinue, his own attributes, or the attributes of others.

original: dus dang / rus dang / rigs dang / skye ba dang / 'khor dang / bdag nyid kyi rnam pa dang / gzhan gyi rnam pa las mi mthong ba de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag kyang grub pa yin te /
analyzed: dus dang / rus dang / rigs dang / skye ba dang / 'khor dang / bdag nyid kyi rnam pa dang / gzhan gyi rnam pa las mi mthong ba de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag kyang grub pa yin te /
translated: This is the recollection of the Buddha.

original: ji skad smos pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag dang bral ba ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag dang bral ba ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha is free from the conceptualizations mentioned above.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul la 'jug pa ye shes snang ba'i rgyan gyi mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul la 'jug pa ye shes snang ba'i rgyan gyi mdo las /
translated: Similarly, the noble Sūtra on the Ornament of the Light of Awareness of the Range of All Buddhas says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu skye med chos //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu skye med chos //
translated: The Tathagata is always unborn and non-arisen.

original: chos rnams thams cad bde bar gshegs dang @215b 'dra ;
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad bde bar gshegs dang @215b 'dra ;
translated: All phenomena are like the Sugata.

original: / mtshan mar 'dzin pa byis pa'i blo can rnams //
analyzed: / mtshan mar 'dzin pa byis pa'i blo can rnams //
translated: Those with childish understanding grasp at signs.

original: 'jig rten dag na med pa'i chos la spyod //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na med pa'i chos la spyod //
translated: They engage with phenomena that do not exist in the world.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zag med dge ba yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zag med dge ba yin //
translated: The Tathagata is uncontaminated virtue.

original: chos kyi gzugs brnyan lta bur gyur pa ste //
analyzed: chos kyi gzugs brnyan lta bur gyur pa ste //
translated: He is like a reflection of the Dharma.

original: 'di la de nyid de bzhin gshegs med kyang //
analyzed: 'di la de nyid de bzhin gshegs med kyang //
translated: In this, there is no Tathagata as such,

original: 'jig rten kun du gzugs brnyan kun nas snang ;
analyzed: 'jig rten kun du gzugs brnyan kun nas snang ;
translated: Yet his reflection appears in all worlds.

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bden pa gnyis kyi tshul du bstan pa de dag kyang grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bden pa gnyis kyi tshul du bstan pa de dag kyang grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the teachings on the body of the Tathagata in terms of the two truths are established.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: Similarly, the noble Sutra on Entering Lanka says:

original: phung po brten pa'i rdzogs sangs rgyas //🔽gang gis gang du mthong ba med //
analyzed: phung po brten pa'i rdzogs sangs rgyas // gang gis gang du mthong ba med //
translated: The perfect Buddha is the basis of the aggregates.🔽He is not seen by anyone anywhere.

original: gang gis gang du gang ma mthong //
analyzed: gang gis gang du gang ma mthong //
translated: He is not seen by anyone anywhere.

original: de ni ji ltar bstan par bya //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar bstan par bya //
translated: How can he be taught?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus, the statements of the above cited passages are established.

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bstan pa 'di'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku bstan pa 'di'i yon tan dang khungs yin te /
translated: The establishment of these passages that inspire confidence is the source and good quality of this teaching on the dharmakāya of the Tathāgata.

original: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang /
analyzed: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang /
translated: The teaching of these passages is the very object to be explained by this treatise.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //🔽slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: This is due to the power of the wisdom of the master and the skill of the commentator.🔽The commentary on the Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on the Root Verses on the Middle Way,

original: dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las / de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: composed by the master Bhāviveka,🔽is completed.🔽The commentary on the twenty-second chapter, “Examination of the Tathāgata,”

original: rab tu byed pa nyi shu gnyis pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar brdzogs so /🔽// / bam po bdun cu gsum pa /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa nyi shu gnyis pa rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon spyan ras gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar brdzogs so /🔽// / bam po bdun cu gsum pa /
translated: composed by the master Avalokitavrata, is completed.

original: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum po brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum po brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, in the same way, the twenty-three chapters are begun by the power of the meaning of the teaching of the unreality of the erroneous opposites, through the refutation of the special opposites of emptiness.

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du blta ste /
translated: The word “power” in this context should be viewed as having the sense of the cause of the commitment and the sense of the connection with the text that follows.

original: tshig gi don snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is the same as before.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With respect to that, from the point of view of the cause of the commitment,

original: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: now, in the same way, the refutation of the special opposites of emptiness is stated.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang pa brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bcas pa mdzad pas 'dir @216a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang pa brtsam pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bcas pa mdzad pas 'dir @216a * //
translated: The treatise-writer, in the first chapter of the examination of conditions, made the assertion that all things are unproduced.

original: yang bstan bcos mdzad pas sngar ji ltar dam bca' ba de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
analyzed: yang bstan bcos mdzad pas sngar ji ltar dam bca' ba de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
translated: Here, the treatise-writer, in terms of the meaning of the cause of engaging in that assertion, says this.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i lugs bzhin du'o //
translated: “Just as” means in accordance with the previously explained system.

original: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
translated: Emptiness is one’s own position.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol bar byed pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The position of the opponent is the position that is contrary to that.

original: 'di ltar ste /🔽don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ste / don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
translated: It is as follows.🔽They are proponents of the ultimate existence of things.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par 'og nas /
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par 'og nas /
translated: The “distinctions” of that are the distinctions of the opponent’s position that ultimately things exist by way of their own entities, which will be presented below.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rnams //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rnams //
translated: Desire, hatred, and ignorance

original: kun du rtog las 'byung bar gsungs //
analyzed: kun du rtog las 'byung bar gsungs //
translated: are said to arise from conceptualization.

original: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten pa nyid las kun du 'byung //
analyzed: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten pa nyid las kun du 'byung //
translated: They arise from the pleasant, the unpleasant, and error,🔽which are based on what is unreal.

original: zhes bya bas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: This is the argument: in reality, the aggregates and so on do exist inherently,

original: rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
analyzed: rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no // zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa 'byung ba dag yin no //
translated: because they arise in dependence on causes, just like, for example, desire and so on.🔽This is the argument.🔽Refuting that

original: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: means that chapter twenty-three is composed in order to refute that.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the meaning of the passage that will be cited below,

original: phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that chapter twenty-three is composed in order to demonstrate that error is essenceless.

original: phyin ci log brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
analyzed: phyin ci log brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
translated: The meaning of the following passage from the treatise, the twenty-third chapter of the perfection of wisdom, is the teaching of the essencelessness of error. Therefore, it is said with reference to that:

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
translated: What is the result of this chapter?

original: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
translated: By what aspects is that result attained?

original: phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The teaching of the essencelessness of error is its result.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas de'i phyir 'dir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to
translated: That result is attained by the aspect of the refutation of the specific counter-positions to emptiness. Therefore, the author of the commentary first teaches the result of the means and the means in this context of the introduction to the chapter.🔽In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: // stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the specific counter-positions to emptiness.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rnams //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rnams //
translated: Attachment, aversion, and delusion

original: kun du @216b rtog las 'byung bar gsungs //
analyzed: kun du @216b rtog las 'byung bar gsungs //
translated: are said to arise from false imagination.

original: bstan bcos las so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: From the treatises.

original: lung las 'dod chags la sogs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa las 'byung bar gsungs so //
analyzed: lung las 'dod chags la sogs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa las 'byung bar gsungs so //
translated: In the scriptures it says that attachment and so on arise from false imagination.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug de dag kyang go rims bzhin du /🔽sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten pa nyid las kun du 'byung //
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug de dag kyang go rims bzhin du / sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten pa nyid las kun du 'byung //
translated: In order to teach that very point in detail,

original: zhes bya ba smras te /🔽sdug pa'i phyin ci log la brten pa nyid las 'dod chags kun du 'byung la /🔽mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log la brten pa nyid las zhes sdang kun du 'byung /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te / sdug pa'i phyin ci log la brten pa nyid las 'dod chags kun du 'byung la / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log la brten pa nyid las zhes sdang kun du 'byung /
translated: it says:🔽Attachment, aversion, and delusion🔽arise from the beautiful, the ugly, and error.

original: gnyi ga'i phyin ci log la brten pa nyid las gti mug kun du 'byung bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i phyin ci log la brten pa nyid las gti mug kun du 'byung bar sbyar ro //
translated: Attachment arises from the error of the beautiful.🔽Aversion arises from the error of the ugly.🔽Delusion arises from the error of both.

original: nyid las zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don te /🔽sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log la brten pa nyid las kun du 'byung gi ma brten par mi 'byung ngo zhes nges par gzung gi / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log nyid la brten nas zhes bya bar ni nges par mi gzung ste /🔽de dag skye ba'i rkyen tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag kyang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni nyid ces bya ba'i sgra brtan pa nyid las zhes bya bar sbyar gyi /
analyzed: nyid las zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don te / sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log la brten pa nyid las kun du 'byung gi ma brten par mi 'byung ngo zhes nges par gzung gi / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log nyid la brten nas zhes bya bar ni nges par mi gzung ste / de dag skye ba'i rkyen tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa dag kyang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni nyid ces bya ba'i sgra brtan pa nyid las zhes bya bar sbyar gyi /
translated: The term “just” has the meaning of restriction.🔽It restricts the meaning to “just from the error of attractiveness and the error of unattractiveness,” but it does not restrict the meaning to “just from the error of attractiveness and the error of unattractiveness.”🔽It is taught that the term “just” is applied to “just from the error of attractiveness and the error of unattractiveness” and not to “just from the error of attractiveness and the error of unattractiveness” because the conditions for the arising of those errors, such as improper mental attention, also exist.

original: phyin ci log nyid la zhes bya bar mi sbyar ba'i sgra bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: phyin ci log nyid la zhes bya bar mi sbyar ba'i sgra bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: The term “just” is applied to “just from the error of attractiveness and the error of unattractiveness” and not to “just from the error of attractiveness and the error of unattractiveness” because the conditions for the arising of those errors, such as improper mental attention, also exist.

original: de ltar na de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin te zhes bya bas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu la brten nas 'byung bas ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni 'dir don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag rgyu la brten nas 'byung bas ngo
analyzed: de ltar na de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin te zhes bya bas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu la brten nas 'byung bas ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni 'dir don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag rgyu la brten nas 'byung bas ngo
translated: Thus, the words “in that case, this is a similar example” indicate that since attachment and so on arise in dependence on causes, they do not exist by their own intrinsic nature.🔽

original: bo nyid yod par bsgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bo nyid yod par bsgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the words “in that case, this is a word of example of similar quality” indicate that since attachment and so on arise in dependence on a cause, their existence by its own intrinsic reality is taught here as a word of example of similar quality that proves the existence by its own intrinsic reality of the aggregates and so on in the ultimate through their arising in dependence on a cause.

original: 'o na dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs dag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs dag gang yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the thesis and what is the reason?

original: de'i phyir / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis dpe bstan pas yan lag lhag ma dag mngon no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos kyi dbang gis dpe bstan pas yan lag lhag ma dag mngon no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “The remaining limbs are evident through teaching the example by the power of the property of the probandum and the property of the proof.”

original: bsgrub par bya ba chos don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dbang gis dpe 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu la brten nas 'byung bas don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa dag bstan pas dam bcas pa dang /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba chos don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dbang gis dpe 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyu la brten nas 'byung bas don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa dag bstan pas dam bcas pa dang /
translated: The probandum is the ultimate reality of phenomena, which is the mere intrinsic reality of the aggregates and so on.🔽The remaining parts of the reason are evident by the force of the statement, “Because they arise in dependence on causes,” which is the proof statement.

original: gtan tshigs kyi yan lag lhag ma dag mngon no //🔽de ni de'i rjes @217a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi yan lag lhag ma dag mngon no // de ni de'i rjes @217a * //
translated: The example is stated by the words, “Just as desire and so on.”

original: su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir / de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: To teach the inference, he says,

original: rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: “Therefore, the aggregates and so on have intrinsic reality in the ultimate because they arise in dependence on causes, just as desire and so on.”

original: gang ngo bo nyid med pa de ni rgyu la brten nas mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid med pa de ni rgyu la brten nas mi 'byung ste /
translated: That which lacks intrinsic reality does not arise in dependence on causes,

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: like a sky flower.

original: phung po la sogs pa dag ni rang rang gi rgyu la brten nas 'byung bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa dag ni rang rang gi rgyu la brten nas 'byung bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the aggregates and so on arise in dependence on their own causes, therefore, by the power of the reason stated, the aggregates and so on exist only with intrinsic reality ultimately.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proof, the example of the similar class, the example of the dissimilar class, the application, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: 'di na nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa lta bu gang rgyu la brten nas mi 'byung ba de ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: 'di na nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa lta bu gang rgyu la brten nas mi 'byung ba de ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin gyi ;
translated: Here, whatever does not arise in dependence on a cause, like a sky flower and so on, does not exist with intrinsic reality.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin pas de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa dag kyang rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho🔽na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin pas de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa dag kyang rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Desire and so on arise in dependence on a cause, therefore they definitely exist ultimately by intrinsic reality. Likewise, the aggregates and so on also arise in dependence on a cause, therefore they definitely exist ultimately by intrinsic reality.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: To refute that specific counter-position to emptiness, in order to teach the absence of intrinsic reality of error, the author of the commentary responds:

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽gang dag sdug dang mi sdug pa'i //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gang dag sdug dang mi sdug pa'i //
translated: Here it is said:🔽Those that arise in dependence on🔽Desire and so on, which you teach as examples,

original: phyin ci log la brten 'byung ba //
analyzed: phyin ci log la brten 'byung ba //
translated: are error in regard to the attractive and unattractive.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa khyed kyi dpe nyid du bstan pa dag go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa khyed kyi dpe nyid du bstan pa dag go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Those afflictions such as desire and so on, which you teach as examples, are error in regard to the attractive and unattractive.

original: des ni pha rol po dag gi dpe mi 'grub par sun dbyung ba'i phyogs su bstan to //
analyzed: des ni pha rol po dag gi dpe mi 'grub par sun dbyung ba'i phyogs su bstan to //
translated: This teaches the refutation of the opponent’s example, which is not established.

original: de dag ngo bo nyid las med //🔽gang gi phyir sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so zhes bya bas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid las med par dam bca' ba bstan te /
analyzed: de dag ngo bo nyid las med // gang gi phyir sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so zhes bya bas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid las med par dam bca' ba bstan te /
translated: They do not exist through their intrinsic reality.🔽Since they arise in dependence on causes, as previously explained, the thesis that they do not exist through their intrinsic reality is presented.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba gang yin pa ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid las med do zhes sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis de dag ngo bo nyid las med par dam bca'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba gang yin pa ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid las med do zhes sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis de dag ngo bo nyid las med par dam bca'o //
translated: Since they are imputed in dependence on other things, causes and conditions, they do not exist through their intrinsic reality.

original: de phyir nyon mongs yang dag med //
analyzed: de phyir nyon mongs yang dag med //
translated: Therefore, the afflictions do not exist in reality.

original: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni don dam @217b par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni mjug bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni don dam @217b par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya bas ni mjug bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: Since “in reality” means “ultimately,” the conclusion is presented.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag sdug pa la sogs pa la brten nas 'byung bas ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag sdug pa la sogs pa la brten nas 'byung bas ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, because such things as attachment arise in dependence on such things as the attractive, they are essenceless. Therefore, afflictions are ultimately essenceless.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, the example is incomplete.

original: des ni pha rol po dag gi dpe 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma grub par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni pha rol po dag gi dpe 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma grub par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the example of the opponent, “such as attachment,” is not established.

original: tha snyad pa'i dper rtog na ni bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi lan gdab dka' ste /
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i dper rtog na ni bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi lan gdab dka' ste /
translated: If one imagines that the example is conventional, then it is difficult to respond to the incompleteness of the predicate.🔽Because ultimately afflictions are essenceless.

original: don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi dpe de tha snyad par grub na ni bsgrub par bya ba chos don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho
analyzed: don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi dpe de tha snyad par grub na ni bsgrub par bya ba chos don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho
translated: This shows that if the opponent’s example is established as conventional, then the predicate of the proposition, “ultimately the aggregates and so on are not essentially existent,” is incomplete.

original: na yin te zhes bya ba de dpe la med pa nyid kyi lan gdab dka' ste /
analyzed: na yin te zhes bya ba de dpe la med pa nyid kyi lan gdab dka' ste /
translated: “No, it is not” is a difficult response to the example,

original: don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: because it teaches that they are contradictory, since the afflictions are ultimately essenceless.🔽If you are proving that they have conventional reality, then you are proving what is already established.

original: tha snyad pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi dpe des phung po la sogs pa dag la tha snyad pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub na ni
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi dpe des phung po la sogs pa dag la tha snyad pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub na ni
translated: This shows that if you are proving that the aggregates and so on have conventional reality by means of the example of the opponent,

original: de ltar dbu ma pa la yang grub zin pas grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar dbu ma pa la yang grub zin pas grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin par bstan to //
translated: then since it is already established for the Madhyamika, the error of proving what is already established would ensue.🔽Moreover, if the self were the basis of the afflictions, such as attachment,

original: yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rten bdag ces bya ba yod na ni de la brten pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rten bdag ces bya ba yod na ni de la brten pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then the afflictions would exist in dependence on it.

original: bdag de med pas nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yod par mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes ston to //
analyzed: bdag de med pas nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yod par mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes ston to //
translated: Thus, since that self does not exist, the afflictions are also not established as existing.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / bdag gi yod nyid med nyid ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bdag gi yod nyid med nyid ni //
translated: The existence or nonexistence of the self

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: is not established in any way.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rten bdag ces bya ba'i yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid ces tha snyad gdags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rten bdag ces bya ba'i yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid ces tha snyad gdags pa'o //
translated: The existence or nonexistence of the self, which is the basis of the afflictions such as attachment, is designated as “existence” or “nonexistence.”

original: de 'grub pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grub pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not established,🔽it is said:🔽The existence or nonexistence of the self🔽is not established in any way.

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi tshul la ltos pas /
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi tshul la ltos pas /
translated: In dependence upon the mode of the ultimate and the conventional,

original: ji lta bur yang 'grub pa med ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang 'grub pa med ces bya ba smras so //
translated: it is not established in any way.🔽In order to demonstrate just that,

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:🔽The existence or nonexistence of the self🔽is not established in any way.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i smras ni nges par gzung ba'i don de /🔽'grub pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i smras ni nges par gzung ba'i don de / 'grub pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of “again” is to ascertain the meaning of “not established in any way.”

original: don dam pa'i tshul la ltos pas yod pa nyid du 'grub pa med pa nyid la kun rdzob @218a * //
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul la ltos pas yod pa nyid du 'grub pa med pa nyid la kun rdzob @218a * //
translated: In dependence upon the mode of the ultimate, existence is not established. In dependence upon the mode of the conventional,🔽nonexistence is not established.

original: kyi tshul la ltos pas med pa nyid du 'grub pa med pa nyid de gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: kyi tshul la ltos pas med pa nyid du 'grub pa med pa nyid de gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since it is dependent on the mode of being of the self, nonexistence is not established because the basis is not established.

original: de ltar / bdag de nyon mongs rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: de ltar / bdag de nyon mongs rnams kyi ni //
translated: Thus,

original: yod nyid med nyid ji ltar 'grub //🔽mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te zhes bya bas ni de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi brten bdag de yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du 'grub pa med pa nyid yin na de la brten pa nyon
analyzed: yod nyid med nyid ji ltar 'grub // mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te zhes bya bas ni de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi brten bdag de yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du 'grub pa med pa nyid yin na de la brten pa nyon
translated: How could the existence or nonexistence🔽of the afflictions in relation to the self be established?🔽The meaning of the word “not” is that nonestablishment is taught.

original: mongs pa rnams kyi yod pa nyid dang / med pa ji ltar 'grub ste /
analyzed: mongs pa rnams kyi yod pa nyid dang / med pa ji ltar 'grub ste /
translated: Thus, if the existence and nonexistence of the afflictions such as attachment in relation to the self that is the basis are not established, how could the existence and nonexistence of the afflictions that are based on it be established?

original: mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes bstan to //
translated: They are not established.

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the logic of that,

original: brten pa ni rten yod na yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: brten pa ni rten yod na yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “Because that which is based exists when the basis exists.”

original: brten pa nyon mongs pa rnams ni rten bdag yod na yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dir rten bdag yod par ma grub pas de la brten pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yod par mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: brten pa nyon mongs pa rnams ni rten bdag yod na yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dir rten bdag yod par ma grub pas de la brten pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yod par mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Since the afflictions that are supported exist when the self that is the support exists, here, since the self that is the support does not exist, the afflictions that are supported by it do not exist.🔽In order to clarify that meaning, the root text says, “Because of that, it is explained.”

original: don de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'di bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa de dag kyang rten bdag ces bya ba 'ga' zhig la brtan nas 'byung ba yin na de dag gi rten de yang 'grub pa
analyzed: don de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'di bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa de dag kyang rten bdag ces bya ba 'ga' zhig la brtan nas 'byung ba yin na de dag gi rten de yang 'grub pa
translated: If those afflictions, such as desire, arise in dependence on some self that is their support, then that support of theirs is not established.

original: yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist.

original: gal te de dag gi rten bdag ces bya ba 'ga' yang med na /
analyzed: gal te de dag gi rten bdag ces bya ba 'ga' yang med na /
translated: If there is no self that is the support of those afflictions,

original: de la brten pa nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya ba ci zhig yod de nyon mongs pa chung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas pha rol po dag gi dpe ma grub pas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na
analyzed: de la brten pa nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya ba ci zhig yod de nyon mongs pa chung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas pha rol po dag gi dpe ma grub pas don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na
translated: What are called the afflictions that depend on them? Since not even the slightest affliction exists, the example of the opponent is not established. Therefore, the meaning of the argument that the aggregates and so on exist in reality is not established.

original: yin te zhes sgrub par 'dod pa'i don grub pa med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: yin te zhes sgrub par 'dod pa'i don grub pa med do zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / nyon mongs de dag 'ga' las 'byung //
analyzed: de'i phyir / nyon mongs de dag 'ga' las 'byung //
translated: Those afflictions arise from something.

original: de'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir dang de'i longs spyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
