analyzed: de'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir dang de'i longs spyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because they are its qualities and because they are what it experiences.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa de dag kyang rten bdag ces bya ba 'ga' zhig la brten nas 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa de dag kyang rten bdag ces bya ba 'ga' zhig la brten nas 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Those afflictions such as attachment arise in dependence on something called a self,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni bdag de'i yon tan dang ; longs spyod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni bdag de'i yon tan dang ; longs spyod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the afflictions are its qualities and because they are what it experiences.

original: de yang 'grub pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de yang 'grub pa yod ma yin //
translated: But that is not established.

original: zhes bya bas ni de dag gi rten bdag de yang 'grub pa yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni de dag gi rten bdag de yang 'grub pa yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the self which is their basis is also not established.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽de ltar bdag brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyid du brtags zin to zhes bya bas ni bdag de ji ltar 'grub pa @218b yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / de ltar bdag brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyid du brtags zin to zhes bya bas ni bdag de ji ltar 'grub pa @218b yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How so?🔽We have already examined the self in the Investigation of the Agent and Action.🔽This shows that the self is not established in that way.

original: de ltar ni sngar nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar len pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyid du brtags zin to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar ni sngar nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar len pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyid du brtags zin to zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, he shows that the self is not established in the way that it is described.🔽In this way, he shows that the phenomena of the afflictions are without a basis.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi chos ni rten med pa yin par bstan to zhes bya bas ni nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni rten bdag med pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi chos ni rten med pa yin par bstan to zhes bya bas ni nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni rten bdag med pa yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the reason for establishing that the afflictions do not exist is that the self, which is their basis, does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very inference, he says,

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'dod chags la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par 'dod chags la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, in reality, attachment and so on do not exist.

original: de dag gi rten med pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo ba sangs nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: de dag gi rten med pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo ba sangs nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: Because they have no basis, like the blueness of the son of a barren woman.

original: / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: / de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo bsangs nyid ni de'i rten mo gsham gyi bu nyid med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dag kyang de dag gi rten bdag med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin no
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo bsangs nyid ni de'i rten mo gsham gyi bu nyid med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dag kyang de dag gi rten bdag med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin no
translated: For example, the blueness of the son of a barren woman does not exist because its basis, the son of a barren woman, does not exist. In the same way, the afflictions such as attachment do not exist because their basis, the self, does not exist.

original: // rang gi sde pa dag na re bdag med du zin kyang sems kyi nyon mongs pa rnams so zhes 'brel pa 'grub ste /
analyzed: // rang gi sde pa dag na re bdag med du zin kyang sems kyi nyon mongs pa rnams so zhes 'brel pa 'grub ste /
translated: Our own schools say, “Even though there is no self, the afflictions of the mind are established because they are related to the self.”

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni sems de'i chos yin pa'i phyir bdag med par smra ba rnams la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro zhes bya bas ni rang gi sde pa dag na re 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi🔽rten bdag med du zin kyang de dag gi rten sems yod pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams sems kyi chos yin par 'grub pas bdag med par smra ba rnams la dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de dag gi rten med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don ma grub pa
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni sems de'i chos yin pa'i phyir bdag med par smra ba rnams la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ro zhes bya bas ni rang gi sde pa dag na re 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rten bdag med du zin kyang de dag gi rten sems yod pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams sems kyi chos yin par 'grub pas bdag med par smra ba rnams la dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs de dag gi rten med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don ma grub pa
translated: Those who assert selflessness say that the meaning of the reason is not established for us because afflictions are phenomena of the mind.🔽This is the statement of our schools who say that although the self that is the support of attachment and so on is refuted, since the mind that is the support of those afflictions exists, the afflictions are established as phenomena of the mind.

original: nyid do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: nyid do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Therefore, for those who assert selflessness, the meaning of the reason of Madhyamaka is not established because its basis does not exist.

original: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, “The meaning of the reason is not not established.

original: sems kyi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i phyir dang / de rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pas /
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i phyir dang / de rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pas /
translated: Because the arising of mind is refuted, because the intrinsic reality of consciousness is refuted, and because substantial existence is refuted,

original: sems ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sems ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: mind is not established.

original: rkyen brtag pa dang / phung po brtag pa la sogs pa'i rab tu byed par sems kyi skye ba dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pas sems ma grub pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi @219a * //🔽don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen brtag pa dang / phung po brtag pa la sogs pa'i rab tu byed par sems kyi skye ba dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pas sems ma grub pa'i phyir kho bo'i gtan tshigs kyi @219a * // don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because the arising of mind, its intrinsic reality, and its substantial existence are refuted in such chapters as the Examination of Conditions and the Examination of the Aggregates, my reason is not unestablished.

original: gang dag yod par smra ba dag na re 'di ltar kho bo cag ni gcig la gcig med pas dngos po'i mtshan nyid med par smra ba yin pas nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de grub pas sems las byung ba rnams la
analyzed: gang dag yod par smra ba dag na re 'di ltar kho bo cag ni gcig la gcig med pas dngos po'i mtshan nyid med par smra ba yin pas nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de grub pas sems las byung ba rnams la
translated: Those who assert existence say, “In this way, since we assert that the characteristics of things do not exist because one does not exist in the other, it is established that the afflictions do not exist. Therefore the mental factors

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa dang 'brel pa yang ma grub par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya bas ni gcig la gcig med par smra ba dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa dag na re dper na bum pa la
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa dang 'brel pa yang ma grub par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro zhes bya bas ni gcig la gcig med par smra ba dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod pa dag na re dper na bum pa la
translated: For example, a cloth does not exist in a pot,

original: snam bu med la /
analyzed: snam bu med la /
translated: and a pot does not exist in a cloth.🔽Because they do not exist in each other, they are called “lacking intrinsic reality.” The intrinsic reality of the pot and cloth exists separately.

original: snam bu la yang bum pa med pas gcig la gcig med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba'i bum pa dang / snam bu'i ngo bo nyid ni so so na yod pa de bzhin du sems la yang nyon mongs pa rnams med la /
analyzed: snam bu la yang bum pa med pas gcig la gcig med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba'i bum pa dang / snam bu'i ngo bo nyid ni so so na yod pa de bzhin du sems la yang nyon mongs pa rnams med la /
translated: In the same way, afflictions do not exist in the mind,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams la yang sems med pas gcig la gcig med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pas zhes bya ba'i sems dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni so so na yod pas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams yod par 'grub
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams la yang sems med pas gcig la gcig med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pas zhes bya ba'i sems dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni so so na yod pas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams yod par 'grub
translated: and the mind does not exist in the afflictions. Because they do not exist in each other, they are called “lacking intrinsic reality.” The intrinsic reality of the mind and the afflictions exists separately. Therefore attachment and so on, the afflictions, are established as existing.

original: po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: po zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the statement of those who propound mutual nonexistence and assert that things exist.

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary explains this:

original: khyed bum pa dang snam bu dag la de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid med par 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i dngos po dang dngos po med par snang ba'i blo skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dngos po 'am /
analyzed: khyed bum pa dang snam bu dag la de las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid med par 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i dngos po dang dngos po med par snang ba'i blo skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dngos po 'am /
translated: “You assert that a vase and cloth do not have the characteristics of other things. Is that which is the cause of the arising of the cognition perceiving thing and nonthing a thing or

original: dngos po med pa zhig yin grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhig yin grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: a nonthing?”

original: khyed gcig la gcig med pas dngos po med par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po dang dngos po med par snang ba'i blo skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dngos po 'am dngos po med pa zhig yin grangs na /
analyzed: khyed gcig la gcig med pas dngos po med par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po dang dngos po med par snang ba'i blo skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dngos po 'am dngos po med pa zhig yin grangs na /
translated: You assert that a vase and cloth are nonthings because they are not each other. Is that which is the cause of the arising of the cognition perceiving thing and nonthing a thing or a nonthing?

original: brtag pa gnyi ga ltar mi 'thad par ston to //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyi ga ltar mi 'thad par ston to //
translated: It is shown that both of these analyses are untenable.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the first analysis is untenable, it is said:

original: de la gal te dngos po yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la gal te dngos po yin na ni dam bcas pa nyams so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If it is a thing, then your thesis is undermined.

original: sngar gcig la gcig med pas dngos po med do zhes dam bcas pa la da dngos por smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gcig la gcig med pas dngos po med do zhes dam bcas pa la da dngos por smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Previously, you asserted that since one does not exist in the other, they are not things. But now you speak of them as things.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the second conception is untenable, he says:

original: ji ste dngos po med pa yin na ni 'o na des na bum pa 'di'i sngo ba nyid dang dmar ba nyid 'di'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir tha snyad med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir @219b bshad pa gal te 'ga' med ji zhig yod rten🔽bum pa 'am /🔽snam bu 'ga' zhig med par brten pa sngo ba nyid dam /
analyzed: ji ste dngos po med pa yin na ni 'o na des na bum pa 'di'i sngo ba nyid dang dmar ba nyid 'di'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir tha snyad med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir @219b bshad pa gal te 'ga' med ji zhig yod rten bum pa 'am / snam bu 'ga' zhig med par brten pa sngo ba nyid dam /
translated: If they are not things, then since there would be no connection between them, there would be no conventions such as “This is the blueness or redness of this pot.”

original: dmar ba nyid ji zhig yod par 'dod ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dmar ba nyid ji zhig yod par 'dod ces bya ba smras te /
translated: If a pot or a cloth does not exist, what do you assert to be the basis of blueness or redness?

original: dngos po med pa yin na de'i 'di'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams yod par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yin na de'i 'di'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams yod par mi 'grub po //
translated: If they are not things, then since there would be no connection between them, such as “This is the blueness or redness of this pot,” then the existence of the afflictions would not be established.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: nyon mongs 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
translated: No afflictions at all exist.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa la zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa la zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The intended meaning is that the non-entity, such as the son of a barren woman, is the referent of the term “afflictions.”

original: rten sems med par brten pa nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rten sems med par brten pa nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that without the mind as the basis, the afflictions as the dependent do not exist.

original: de ltar ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa dpe nyid du mi rung bas 'dod pa'i don grub pa med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa dpe nyid du mi rung bas 'dod pa'i don grub pa med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Since this is not accepted, the example is not suitable as an existent, and therefore the intended meaning is not established. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: rten sems med par brten pa nyon mongs pa rnams yod par mi 'dod pas de'i phyir nyon mongs pa yod pa ma yin pa dpe nyid du mi rung bas /
analyzed: rten sems med par brten pa nyon mongs pa rnams yod par mi 'dod pas de'i phyir nyon mongs pa yod pa ma yin pa dpe nyid du mi rung bas /
translated: Since it is not accepted that without the mind as the basis, the afflictions as the dependent exist, therefore the example is not suitable as an existent.

original: pha rol po dag na re don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The opponent says, “In reality, the aggregates and so on do exist by their own intrinsic reality.

original: rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ba'i 'dod pa'i don grub pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ba'i 'dod pa'i don grub pa med do //
translated: The meaning of the statement is not established, because it arises in dependence on a cause, like attachment and so on.

original: rang gi sde pa rnams kyi phyir yang 'di bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji ltar sngar de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa'i skabs su /🔽sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa rnams kyi phyir yang 'di bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji ltar sngar de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa'i skabs su / sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
translated: The statement “This should be explained for our schools” and so on explains how the Tathāgata is not the aggregates in five ways, as was done in the chapter on the examination of the Tathāgata.

original: de la sku med der de med //
analyzed: de la sku med der de med //
translated: The Tathāgata is not the body, nor is he other than the body.🔽The body is not the Tathāgata, nor is the Tathāgata in the body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
translated: The Tathāgata does not possess a body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //🔽zhes bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa phyogs su byas te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams la rnam pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang nyon mongs pa rnams phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin // zhes bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa phyogs su byas te / de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams la rnam pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang nyon mongs pa rnams phyogs su byas te /
translated: What is the Tathāgata?🔽Thus, in the chapter on the examination of the Tathāgata, the Tathāgata is posited as the subject.🔽The Tathāgata is not observed when it is sought in the aggregates in five ways.

original: nyon mongs pa can la rnam pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med pa dang / nyon mongs pa can phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la rnam pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med pa dang / nyon mongs pa can phyogs su byas te /
translated: Similarly, here, when the afflicted is posited as the subject, the afflicted is not observed when it is sought in five ways.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med par ston to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med par ston to //
translated: It shows that the afflictions are not apprehended when sought in five ways.

original: de la re zhig nyon mongs pa rnams phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: de la re zhig nyon mongs pa rnams phyogs su byas te /
translated: First, the afflictions are taken as the subject.

original: nyon mongs pa can la rnam pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la rnam pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that the afflictions are not apprehended when sought in five ways in relation to a defiled mind, it says:

original: rang lus lta bzhin nyon mongs rnams //
analyzed: rang lus lta bzhin nyon mongs rnams //
translated: The afflictions are like the view of the body as a self.

original: rang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi'o //
analyzed: rang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi'o //
translated: “Self” refers to the self and what is possessed by the self.

original: @220a * // lus zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs nye bar bstsags pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: @220a * // lus zhes bya ba ni ming dang gzugs nye bar bstsags pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: “Body” is a synonym for the accumulation of name and form.

original: rang gi lus la lta ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus la lta ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba'o //
translated: “View of the body as a self” is the afflicted view that takes one’s own body as its object.

original: rang gi lus la lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba na rang gi lus la lta ba dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi lus la lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba na rang gi lus la lta ba dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: “Like the view of the body as a self” means like the view of the body as a self.🔽How so?🔽It says:

original: ji ltar ; sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: ji ltar ; sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
translated: Not body, not other than body,

original: de la sku med der de med //
analyzed: de la sku med der de med //
translated: not in body, not in it,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
translated: the Tathāgata does not possess a body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
translated: What is the Tathāgata?

original: zhes bya ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The afflictions are also like that.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i don gyis nyon mongs par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i don gyis nyon mongs par byed pa dag go //
translated: The afflictions are so called because they afflict the mind with harm.

original: nyon mongs can la rnam lngar med //🔽nyon mongs can gyi sems la ste //🔽nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs can la rnam lngar med // nyon mongs can gyi sems la ste // nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
translated: The afflicted is not the fivefold.🔽The afflicted is not the fivefold.

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / bsreg pa dang sreg pa dag gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / bsreg pa dang sreg pa dag gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The afflictions are not the afflicted because the negation of identity is refuted, and because it would follow, absurdly, that the burning and the fuel would be identical.

original: snga ma bzhin du de las gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnams med par yang nyon mongs pa can nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

translated: The afflictions are not different from the afflicted because the negation of difference is refuted, as before, and because it would follow, absurdly, that the afflicted would be afflicted even without the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can dag la med cing nyon mongs pa can yang nyon mongs pa rnams la med la ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can dag la med cing nyon mongs pa can yang nyon mongs pa rnams la med la ;
translated: Afflictions do not exist in those who are afflicted, nor do those who are afflicted exist in afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Afflictions do not possess those who are afflicted,

original: gzhan nyid med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can la rnam pa lngar med do zhes bya ba smras so //🔽da ni nyon mongs pa can phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can la rnam pa lngar med do zhes bya ba smras so // da ni nyon mongs pa can phyogs su byas te /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med par bstan pa'i phyir / rang lus lta bzhin nyon mongs can //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that when one searches in five ways, the afflicted is not apprehended as a basis of the afflictions,🔽he says:🔽The afflicted does not exist in the afflictions

original: nyon mongs pa la rnam lngar med //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la rnam lngar med //
translated: In five ways, like one’s body.

original: nyon mongs pa can nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam pa lngar med pa yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam pa lngar med pa yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The afflicted does not exist in the afflictions in five ways, just as the afflictions do not exist in the afflicted in five ways.

original: de la nyon mongs pa rnams med pa'i phyir dpe la bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gis don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te🔽/ rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa rnams med pa'i phyir dpe la bsgrub par bya ba chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gis don dam par phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te / rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the afflictions do not exist in the example, the error of the incompleteness of the predicate of the probandum exists.🔽This teaches that the example that the opponent states, “Ultimately, only the aggregates and so on exist because they arise in dependence on causes,

original: dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe de la bsgrub par bya ba chos @220b ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod par bstan to //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe de la bsgrub par bya ba chos @220b ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te zhes bya ba ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod par bstan to //
translated: like, for example, attachment and so on,” has the error of the incompleteness of the predicate of the probandum, “They exist by their own intrinsic reality.”

original: yang gzhan yang gang gi tshe kho bo cag gi phyogs la /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang gang gi tshe kho bo cag gi phyogs la /
translated: Moreover, when in our system

analyzed: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / ngo bo nyid las yod min pa //
translated: The attractive, the unattractive, and error do not exist by virtue of their intrinsic reality,🔽then at that time

original: de'i tshe / sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten nas nyon mongs gang dag yin //
analyzed: de'i tshe / sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten nas nyon mongs gang dag yin //
translated: The afflictions that arise in dependence on the attractive, the unattractive, and error

analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o zhes bya bas ni phyin ci log rnams ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin pas /

analyzed: phyin ci log gi rgyu la brten nas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar bstan to //

analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams kyi chos ni bstan nas 'byung ba ma yin pas dpe la sgrub pa'i chos ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gis don dam pa phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, since the afflictions do not arise in dependence on the teaching of the ultimate, the example has the fault of not having the property of the position.

analyzed: rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no zhes smras bar dpe de la sgrub pa'i chos rgyu la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the opponent’s example has the fault of not having the property of the position, that is, the reason “because they arise in dependence on causes” is not established.🔽The opponent says that the ultimate, such as the aggregates and so on, does exist inherently.🔽This is because they arise in dependence on causes, just like desire and so on.

analyzed: rang gi sde pa dag yang phyir zlog par byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang gi sde pa dag gzugs la sogs pa yul drug po dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i gzhi yin pas de dag la brten nas
translated: Our own schools reply: “No, because the six sense objects such as form are the basis for the arising of afflictions such as attachment.🔽Afflictions arise in dependence on them.

translated: Therefore, the example and the probandum and the property of the probandum are not incomplete.”

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that, he says:

original: gzugs sgra ro dang reg pa dang / dri dang chos dag rnam drug ni //
analyzed: gzugs sgra ro dang reg pa dang / dri dang chos dag rnam drug ni //
translated: The six sense objects such as form, sound, taste, tactility,🔽and phenomena are the six bases.

original: rnam pa drug go /
analyzed: rnam pa drug go /

original: de dag ci yin zhe na gzhi ste /
analyzed: de dag ci yin zhe na gzhi ste /

original: 'di la gnas pas gzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di la gnas pas gzhi ste /

original: de dag las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de dag las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i nges pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i nges pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs su rung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs su rung ba'o //
translated: Form is that which is suitable as form.

original: sgra zhes bya ba ni bsgrag du rung ba'o //🔽dri zhes bya ba ni snam du rung ba'o //
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba ni bsgrag du rung ba'o // dri zhes bya ba ni snam du rung ba'o //

analyzed: ro zhes bya ba ni myang du rung ba'o //

original: reg pa zhes bya ba ni reg sbyar rung ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa zhes bya ba ni reg sbyar rung ba'o //

analyzed: chos bdag ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya smras so //

analyzed: de dag gi gzhi yin par bstan pa'i phyir / rnam pa drug po de dag gi dag gzhi yin zhe na / 'dod @221a * //
translated: In order to teach that they are the basis of those,

analyzed: chags dang ni zhe sdang dang // gti mug gis ni rnam par rtag ces bya ba smras so // 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said, “The basis of those six is desire, anger, and ignorance.”

original: 'dod chags ni chags par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni chags par byed pa ste /
translated: Desire is that which causes attachment.

original: lhag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par chags pa'o //
translated: It is excessive attachment.

original: zhe sdang ni sdang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang ni sdang bar byed pa ste /
translated: Anger is that which causes aversion.

original: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems skyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems skyed pa'o //
translated: It is the generation of malice toward sentient beings.🔽Ignorance is that which causes delusion.

analyzed: gti mug ni rmongs par byed pa ste mi shes pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //

analyzed: 'dis ni phyin ci log gi chos ni gzhi yod pa yin par bstan to zhes bya bas ni /

original: tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma 'dis ni phyin ci log la brten nas 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du 'byung bar sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni de dag skye ba'i gzhi yul drug po dag yod par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma 'dis ni phyin ci log la brten nas 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du 'byung bar sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni de dag skye ba'i gzhi yul drug po dag yod par bstan to //
translated: The first verse shows that the basis of the arising of attachment, etc. is the existence of the six objects in dependence upon the erroneous.

original: de'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inference, he says,

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log gang dag la brten nas 'byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log gang dag la brten nas 'byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /

original: de dag gi gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di na gang don dam par yod pa ma yin pa de la ni gzhi med de /

analyzed: dper na long ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //

analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag la ni gzhi phyin ci log dag tu rnam par brtags pa gang dag yin pa dag yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthun phyin ci log dag yod pas de dag la brten nas nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung bar
translated: Since the bases of desire and so on are imputed to be erroneous, therefore the reason is established, and since erroneous bases exist, afflictions arise in dependence on them.

original: 'grub pas dpe'i skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'grub pas dpe'i skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus the fault of the example does not exist.

translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property of the probandum, the example of the dissimilar class, the application of the proof, and the conclusion are applied in order.

analyzed: 'di na long ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni gzhi med kyi /
translated: Here, that which does not exist, like the eye consciousness of a blind person, does not have a basis.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag la ni gzhi phyin ci log dag tu rnam par brtag pa'i yul dag yod pas de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin pas kho bo cag gi dpe la bsgrub par bya ba dang /

translated: Attachment and so on have objects that are imagined to be the bases of error, therefore attachment and so on definitely exist.

analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos ma tshang ba'i skyon med do zhes zer ro //

analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: To respond to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:🔽Form, sound, taste, tactility,

analyzed: gzugs sgra ro dang @221b reg pa dang / dri dang chos dag 'ba' zhig pa //

analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa ste /

analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi dri tsam gyis kyang ma bsgos pa dag yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

analyzed: des ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de dag gi gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don ma grub pa nyid du ston te ;
translated: This shows that the meaning of the opponent’s reason, “because their bases exist,” is not established.

original: 'di ltar don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa 'ba' zhig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa 'ba' zhig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in reality, form and so on are only devoid of intrinsic reality.

analyzed: 'o na tha snyad du gzugs la sogs pa phyin ci log tu brtag pa dag la brten nas 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But if form and so on are imagined to be erroneous conventionally, then do not attachment and so on arise on that basis?

analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad kyi bden pa la skur ba 'debs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, conventional truth is not denied,

analyzed: 'di ltar / gzugs la sog pa de dag ni //
translated: because those forms and so on🔽are like a gandharva city,

analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang // smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin // zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: dpe gsum po de dag gi yul gyi khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a city of the gandharvas.🔽

analyzed: yul dang / dus nges pa dang / rgyu nges par med par dmigs par bya ba nyid dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //

original: smig rgyu 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin yang de la mngon par zhen pas yongs su tshol ba'i phyir rkyen gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Like a mirage means that it is similar to a condition that is a real thing, because although it is empty of an intrinsic reality, it is sought by those who are attached to it.

original: rmi lam 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin yang re zhig par 'dod pas rgyu dang 'bras bu sgrub pa'i dngos por nye bar 'gro ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rmi lam 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin yang re zhig par 'dod pas rgyu dang 'bras bu sgrub pa'i dngos por nye bar 'gro ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Like a dream means that it is similar to a condition that is a real thing, because although it is devoid of intrinsic reality, it is a thing that establishes cause and effect for those who desire it.

original: da ni don dam par de dag la brten nas 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de dag gi gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gang gi phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i gzugs la sogs pa /🔽sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu dang / log par snang ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Now, in order to show that the reasonings of the opponents are unestablished and contradictory, because in reality desire, etc. do not arise in dependence on them, he says:

original: gzugs brnyan 'dra ba de dag la //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan 'dra ba de dag la //
translated: Because such forms, etc. are similar to the illusory person and to false appearances.🔽Because they are similar to reflections,

analyzed: byed pa po'i bya ba la mi ltos par skye ba nyid dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir / sdug pa dang ni mi sdug pa //
translated: they arise without depending on the activity of a creator.🔽Therefore, how could there be

original: 'byung bar yang ni ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes bya @222a * //
analyzed: 'byung bar yang ni ga la 'gyur // zhes bya @222a * //
translated: the attractive and the unattractive?

original: ba smras te /
analyzed: ba smras te /
translated: He says this.

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de //
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de //
translated: They do not arise,

original: don dam pa ba'i ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: don dam pa ba'i ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because they are empty of ultimate reality.

original: de'i phyir don dam par gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang / tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang / tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, since the basis is not ultimately established, the meaning of the reason is not established and the meaning is contradictory.🔽The opponent says, “The basis of those reasons exists.”

original: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de dag gi gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid la /🔽kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon yod do //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de dag gi gzhi yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de don dam par ni ma grub pa nyid la / kun rdzob tu ni 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon yod do //
translated: The response is, “Ultimately, it is not established.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sdug pa gang la brten nas mi sdug pa mi sdug par gdags par bya ba'i sdug pa de mi sdug pa la ma ltos par yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir sdug pa 'thad pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sdug pa gang la brten nas mi sdug pa mi sdug par gdags par bya ba'i sdug pa de mi sdug pa la ma ltos par yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir sdug pa 'thad pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: Moreover, since the pleasant that is the basis for the designation of the unpleasant does not exist without relying on the unpleasant, therefore the pleasant is not tenable.

original: mi sdug pa gang la brten nas sdug pa sdug par gdags par bya ba'i mi sdug pa de sdug pa la ma ltos par yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir mi sdug pa 'thad pa ma yin par bsgrub pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: mi sdug pa gang la brten nas sdug pa sdug par gdags par bya ba'i mi sdug pa de sdug pa la ma ltos par yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir mi sdug pa 'thad pa ma yin par bsgrub pa rnam pa gnyis ston to //
translated: Since the unpleasant, in dependence on which the pleasant is to be designated as pleasant, does not exist without relying on the pleasant, therefore the unpleasant is not established.

original: de la re shig bsgrub pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir sdug pa /🔽gang la brten nas mi sdug pa /
analyzed: de la re shig bsgrub pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir sdug pa / gang la brten nas mi sdug pa /
translated: In this regard, in order to demonstrate the first proof, he says:

original: mi sdug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi sdug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The unpleasant, in dependence on which the pleasant is designated as pleasant,🔽is not established without relying on the pleasant.

original: de'i phyir sdug pa 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug pa 'thad ma yin //
translated: Therefore the pleasant is not established.

original: mi sdug pa gang 'di ni mi sdug pa'i zhes mi sdug pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'o bu cag gis gdags par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa gang 'di ni mi sdug pa'i zhes mi sdug pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'o bu cag gis gdags par bya ba'o //
translated: The unpleasant, in dependence on which the pleasant is designated as pleasant, is to be designated by us as the nature of the unpleasant, as the unpleasant.

original: sdug pa ma ltos yod min pas //
analyzed: sdug pa ma ltos yod min pas //
translated: Since the pleasant does not exist without relying on the unpleasant,

original: sdug pa de mi sdug pa la ma ltos par sdug pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug pa de mi sdug pa la ma ltos par sdug pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the pleasant does not exist as the nature of the pleasant without relying on the unpleasant.

original: de'i phyir sdug pa 'thad pa 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug pa 'thad pa 'thad ma yin //
translated: Therefore the pleasant is not established.

original: mi sdug pa med pa'i phyir sdug pa yang de la ma ltos par sdug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: mi sdug pa med pa'i phyir sdug pa yang de la ma ltos par sdug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because there is no unpleasant, the pleasant also, not relying on that, does not become pleasant in and of itself.🔽To demonstrate the second proof,

original: bsgrub pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bsgrub pa gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: he says,

original: de bzhin du mi sdug pa gang la brten nas sdug pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi sdug pa gang la brten nas sdug pa ni /
translated: Similarly, the pleasant, in dependence on which the unpleasant is

original: sdug pa zhes bya bar rab tu 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa zhes bya bar rab tu 'grub pa'o //
translated: established,🔽is not established as the pleasant in and of itself.

original: sdug pa zhes ni gdags bya ba //
analyzed: sdug pa zhes ni gdags bya ba //
translated: The pleasant is to be designated.

original: sdug pa gang 'di ni sdug pa'o zhes sdug pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'o bu cag gis gdags par bya ba'o //🔽mi sdug ma ltos yod min pas //
analyzed: sdug pa gang 'di ni sdug pa'o zhes sdug pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'o bu cag gis gdags par bya ba'o // mi sdug ma ltos yod min pas //
translated: The pleasant is to be designated as the pleasant by us, as the nature of the pleasant.🔽Because the unpleasant does not exist without relying on the pleasant,

original: mi sdug pa de sdug pa la ma ltos par mi sdug pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa med pas so //
analyzed: mi sdug pa de sdug pa la ma ltos par mi sdug pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa med pas so //
translated: the unpleasant, not existing as the nature of the unpleasant without relying on the pleasant,

original: de phyir mi sdug 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir mi sdug 'thad ma yin //
translated: therefore the unpleasant is not tenable.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar sdug pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mi @222b sdug pa yang sdug pa de la ma ltos par mi sdug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar sdug pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mi @222b sdug pa yang sdug pa de la ma ltos par mi sdug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because in that case, since there is no attractive object, unattractive objects would not exist as unattractive without depending on attractive objects.

original: da ni de ltar sdug pa yod pa ma yin pas 'dod chags 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /🔽mi sdug pa yod pa ma yin pas zhes dang 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: da ni de ltar sdug pa yod pa ma yin pas 'dod chags 'byung bar mi 'gyur la / mi sdug pa yod pa ma yin pas zhes dang 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Now, since in that case attractive objects do not exist, attachment would not arise.🔽Since unattractive objects do not exist, aversion would not arise.🔽Since both do not exist, delusion would not arise.

original: de gnyis ka yod pa ma yin pas gti mug 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis ka yod pa ma yin pas gti mug 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To summarize this, it is said:

original: de'i phyir de ltar /🔽sdug pa yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar / sdug pa yod pa ma yin na //
translated: Therefore, in that case,

original: 'dod chags 'byung bar ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chags 'byung bar ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could attachment arise

original: mi sdug yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: mi sdug yod pa ma yin na //
translated: when attractive objects do not exist?

original: zhe sdang 'byung bar ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: zhe sdang 'byung bar ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could aversion arise🔽when unattractive objects do not exist?

original: de dag med pa'i phyir gti mug kyang med de /
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir gti mug kyang med de /
translated: Since both do not exist, delusion also does not exist.

original: de dag med pa kho nas de yang yod pa ma yin par grub bo zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de dag med pa kho nas de yang yod pa ma yin par grub bo zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Since they do not exist, it is established that they also do not exist.

original: de dag brjod na skyon med pa ma yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi skyon ji skad bstan pa ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de dag brjod na skyon med pa ma yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi skyon ji skad bstan pa ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Since there is no fault in stating this, therefore the fault of the reason is not averted, as was previously stated. This is the result of the valid cognition.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: don dam par sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: “The errors of the beautiful and the ugly definitely exist ultimately,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are stated in the sūtras by the Transcendent Lord.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang mdo sde las gsungs pa de ni yod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang mdo sde las gsungs pa de ni yod de /
translated: That which is stated in the sūtras by the Transcendent Lord exists,

original: dper na bdag med pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bdag med pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: like selflessness.

original: mdo sde las mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi sdug pa la sdug par 'dzin pa ni phyin ci log go zhes gsungs pa de dag yod pas //
analyzed: mdo sde las mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi sdug pa la sdug par 'dzin pa ni phyin ci log go zhes gsungs pa de dag yod pas //
translated: In the sūtras, the Transcendent Lord said, ‘The error of permanence with respect to the impermanent, the error of a self with respect to selflessness, the error of pleasure with respect to suffering, and the error of beauty with respect to the ugly exist.’ Since these are stated, they exist.”

original: de'i phyir don dam par sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde ba dag bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las phyin co log yod par gsungs pa'i gtan tshigs dang bdag med pa
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde ba dag bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las phyin co log yod par gsungs pa'i gtan tshigs dang bdag med pa
translated: Therefore, the errors of attraction and repulsion exist in reality.

original: nyid yod par gsungs pa'i dpes don dam par sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag yod pa kho na yin te zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: nyid yod par gsungs pa'i dpes don dam par sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag yod pa kho na yin te zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the statement of our schools that the errors of attraction and repulsion exist in reality, using the reason that the Bhagavat stated in the sutra that errors exist and the example that he stated that selflessness exists.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: This is the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proving property, the example of the similar class, the application of the example, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: dper na bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las bdag med pa nyid du gsungs pa ni yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las phyin ci log dag gsungs pa de dag kyang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro🔽// de skad @223a * //
analyzed: dper na bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las bdag med pa nyid du gsungs pa ni yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las phyin ci log dag gsungs pa de dag kyang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro // de skad @223a * //
translated: For example, just as the Bhagavān taught selflessness in the sūtras, and it exists, so too the Bhagavān taught errors in the sūtras, and they exist.

original: ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa gal te 'ga' zhig log par bsgrub pa yod na tha snyad pa'i sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag sgrub pa la ni sgrub pa 'di rung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa gal te 'ga' zhig log par bsgrub pa yod na tha snyad pa'i sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag sgrub pa la ni sgrub pa 'di rung ngo //
translated: Here it is explained: if someone were to prove that errors exist, then this proof would be suitable for proving conventional errors of attraction and repulsion.

original: don dam par ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don dam par ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But it is not suitable ultimately.

original: gal te tha snyad du yang phyin ci log dag med do zhes 'ga' zhig log par sgrub pa yod na /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad du yang phyin ci log dag med do zhes 'ga' zhig log par sgrub pa yod na /
translated: If someone were to prove that errors do not exist even conventionally,

original: de dag la tha snyad pa'i sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag sgrub pa la ni khyed kyi gtan tshigs dang dpe'i sgrub pa 'di rung ngo //
analyzed: de dag la tha snyad pa'i sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log dag sgrub pa la ni khyed kyi gtan tshigs dang dpe'i sgrub pa 'di rung ngo //
translated: In establishing the errors of the conventional beautiful and ugly, your proof of reason and example is correct.

original: kho bo cag dbu ma pa don dam par phyin ci log dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa la ni khyed kyi gtan tshigs dang dpe'i sgrub pa 'di mi rung ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag dbu ma pa don dam par phyin ci log dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa la ni khyed kyi gtan tshigs dang dpe'i sgrub pa 'di mi rung ste /
translated: But in our Madhyamaka proof that errors are essentially non-existent ultimately, your proof of reason and example is incorrect.

original: don dam par de dag mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par de dag mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not established ultimately.

original: de la re zhig don dam par pha rol po dag gi dpe bcom ldan 'das kyis gang mdo sde las gsungs pa ni yod de /
analyzed: de la re zhig don dam par pha rol po dag gi dpe bcom ldan 'das kyis gang mdo sde las gsungs pa ni yod de /
translated: In this regard, the examples of the opponent are those that the Transcendent Lord taught in the sutras.

original: dper na bdag med pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de ni mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na bdag med pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba de ni mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are incorrect, he says:

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
translated: The buddhas have said that the self

original: bdag med gang yang med par gsungs //
analyzed: bdag med gang yang med par gsungs //
translated: And selflessness are both nonexistent.

original: zhes bya ba der lan btab zin pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba der lan btab zin pas /
translated: This has been answered already.

original: bdag med pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because selflessness is not established, there is no example.

original: sngar bdag dang chos brtag pa'i skabs su de skad bstan pas so //
analyzed: sngar bdag dang chos brtag pa'i skabs su de skad bstan pas so //
translated: Because it was taught in the chapter on the examination of the self and phenomena.

original: don dam par pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that ultimately it is not tenable for the opponent to say, “Because the Bhagavān stated in the sūtras, ‘The aggregates are the self,’”

original: gtan tshigs kyang med de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang med de /
translated: he says, “There is also no reason.”

original: don dam par mdo sde las phyin ci log dag yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: don dam par mdo sde las phyin ci log dag yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because ultimately the opponent accepts that the sūtras are mistaken.

original: kho bo cag dbu ma pas so //
analyzed: kho bo cag dbu ma pas so //
translated: We Followers of the Middle Way say this.

original: 'dir phyin ci log ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir phyin ci log ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here there are two kinds of mistakes.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pas so //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pas so //
translated: They are in accord with saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: de la 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa ni 'di lta ste mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa ni 'di lta ste mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, the mistakes in accord with saṃsāra are impermanence and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni 'di lta ste mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa ni 'di lta ste mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which is in accord with nirvana is, for example, impermanence as impermanence, etc.

original: de gnyi ga yang phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang phyin ci log ste /
translated: Both of these are erroneous,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob par spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob par spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: because they are to be abandoned by the attainment of nonconceptual intuition,🔽because they are the counteragents to that.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni de gnyi ga yang kun rdzob tu phyin ci log yin par kho bo cag @223b dbu ma pa yang 'dod do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni de gnyi ga yang kun rdzob tu phyin ci log yin par kho bo cag @223b dbu ma pa yang 'dod do zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, we Madhyamikas also accept that both of these are erroneous conventionally.🔽If one says that the view of impermanence, etc. as impermanence, etc. is not erroneous because it is nonerroneous,

original: gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa la mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir phyin ci log nyid yin par mi rigs so zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa la mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir phyin ci log nyid yin par mi rigs so zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun
translated: then the opponent says that the view of impermanence, etc. as impermanent, etc. is not erroneous because it is in accord with samsara.

original: pa'i phyin ci log bzhi ni kun rdzob tu yang phyin ci log nyid yin par rigs na mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa dag ji ltar kun rdzob tu phyin ci log nyid yin par rigs zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyin ci log bzhi ni kun rdzob tu yang phyin ci log nyid yin par rigs na mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa dag ji ltar kun rdzob tu phyin ci log nyid yin par rigs zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The four errors are errors even conventionally, but how can those that accord with nirvana be errors even conventionally?

original: de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the commentator himself says:

original: phyin ci log ces bya ba de'i don ni gang yin zhes brtag pa smras so //
analyzed: phyin ci log ces bya ba de'i don ni gang yin zhes brtag pa smras so //
translated: “What is the meaning of ‘error’?”

original: de'i lan du pha rol po dag na re /🔽gal te mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes log par lta ba'i don to zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log bzhi po dag phyin ci log ces bya ba'i don yin no zhes zer
analyzed: de'i lan du pha rol po dag na re / gal te mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes log par lta ba'i don to zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log bzhi po dag phyin ci log ces bya ba'i don yin no zhes zer
translated: In response to that, the opponent says:

original: ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: “If the meaning of ‘error’ is ‘impermanent but conceiving it to be permanent,’ ” the opponent says, “the meaning of ‘error’ is the four errors that accord with samsara.”

original: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the commentator himself says:

original: gal te mi rtag pa la rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dzin na de lta na dngos po stong pa la rtag pa yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa la rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dzin na de lta na dngos po stong pa la rtag pa yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: If one grasps what is impermanent as permanent, etc., then since a permanent thing does not exist in an empty thing,

original: de dag kyang kun rdzob tu 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang kun rdzob tu 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate that they are errors that accord with cyclic existence conventionally,

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: therefore it is said:

original: gal te mi rtag rtag pa zhes //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag rtag pa zhes //
translated: If one grasps what is impermanent as permanent,

original: mi rtag pa rtag pa nyid kyis stong pa la rtag pa zhes so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa rtag pa nyid kyis stong pa la rtag pa zhes so //
translated: what is impermanent is empty of permanence, but is called “permanent.”

original: de ltar 'dzin pa log yin na //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa log yin na //
translated: If one grasps it in that way, it is an error.

original: de ltar shes pa phyin ci log gi don la dmigs pa'i phyir phyin ci log yin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa phyin ci log gi don la dmigs pa'i phyir phyin ci log yin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one knows it in that way, it is an error because it observes the meaning of error.

original: des ni pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates the scriptural reference that the opponent accepts.

original: da ni dbu ma pa nyid kyis de kun rdzob tu 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir de ltar na /
analyzed: da ni dbu ma pa nyid kyis de kun rdzob tu 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir de ltar na /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that they are errors that accord with cyclic existence conventionally, from the Madhyamaka’s own standpoint, it is said:

original: stong la rtag pa yod min pas //
analyzed: stong la rtag pa yod min pas //
translated: Since a permanent thing does not exist in an empty thing,

original: 'dzin pa ji ltar log min pas //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ji ltar log min pas //
translated: How could the apprehension of the empty as permanent be an error?

original: stong pa la rtag pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir stong pa la rtag par 'dzin pa ji ltar phyin ci log ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa la rtag pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir stong pa la rtag par 'dzin pa ji ltar phyin ci log ma yin te /
translated: Because permanence itself is empty of intrinsic reality, how could the apprehension of the empty as permanent be an error?

original: de ni phyin ci log nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi don te /
analyzed: de ni phyin ci log nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi don te /
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, “That is an error itself.”

original: dper na gal te khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral na ji ltar grol ba ma yin no zhes bya bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: dper na gal te khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral na ji ltar grol ba ma yin no zhes bya bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, “If one is free from attachment to the three realms, how could one not be liberated?”

original: ji ltar don dam par stong ba la rtag pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong bar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar don dam par stong ba la rtag pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong bar 'dod ce na /
translated: How could one assert that the ultimate, which is empty, is permanent and empty of intrinsic reality?

original: sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis ma skyes pa'i phyir @224a * //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis ma skyes pa'i phyir @224a * //
translated: Because it is non-arisen, as previously explained.

original: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni /🔽stong la rtag pa yod min pas //🔽'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //
analyzed: dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no zhes bya bas ni / stong la rtag pa yod min pas // 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //
translated: The statement, “For example, it is like nirvana,”

original: zhes bya ba'i 'thad pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i 'thad pa bstan te /
translated: teaches the rationale for the statement,🔽“How could the apprehension of the empty as permanent not be an error?”

original: re zhig de dag gis ni gal te mi rtag pa la rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dzin na de dag kun rdzob tu 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log nyid yin par bstan te /
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni gal te mi rtag pa la rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dzin na de dag kun rdzob tu 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log nyid yin par bstan te /
translated: If one grasps impermanence as permanent and so on, then that is a misconception that accords with cyclic existence in the relative.

original: da ni gal te mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dzin na de lta na dngos po stong pa la mi rtag pa yod pa ma yin pas de dag kyang kun rdzob tu mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i
analyzed: da ni gal te mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dzin na de lta na dngos po stong pa la mi rtag pa yod pa ma yin pas de dag kyang kun rdzob tu mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i
translated: Now, if one grasps impermanence as impermanence and so on, then since impermanence does not exist in an empty thing, that is a misconception that accords with nirvana in the relative.

original: phyin ci log nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyin ci log nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: yang na ; gal te mi rtag mi rtag ces //
analyzed: yang na ; gal te mi rtag mi rtag ces //
translated: If one grasps impermanence as impermanence,

original: mi rtag pa mi rtag pa nyid kyis stong pa la mi rtag pa zhes so //🔽de ltar 'dzin pa log min na //
analyzed: mi rtag pa mi rtag pa nyid kyis stong pa la mi rtag pa zhes so // de ltar 'dzin pa log min na //
translated: impermanence is empty of impermanence.🔽If one does not grasp it in that way,

original: de ltar shes pa phyin ci log gi don la dmigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log ma yin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa phyin ci log gi don la dmigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log ma yin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one knows it in that way, one does not observe the object of a misconception, and thus it is not a misconception.

original: des kyang pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan to //
analyzed: des kyang pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan to //
translated: This also shows that the scriptures accepted by the other party are supplementary.

original: da ni dbu ma pa nyid kyis de kun rdzob tu mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dbu ma pa nyid kyis de kun rdzob tu mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that, by means of the Madhyamaka, the grasping of impermanence is an error that accords with nirvana on the conventional level,

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: he says:

original: stong la mi rtag yod min pas //
analyzed: stong la mi rtag yod min pas //
translated: If emptiness does not exist for the impermanent,

original: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //
translated: how could grasping be an error?

original: stong pa la mi rtag pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid skyis stong ba'i phyir stong ba la mi rtag par 'dzin pa yang ji ltar phyin ci log ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa la mi rtag pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid skyis stong ba'i phyir stong ba la mi rtag par 'dzin pa yang ji ltar phyin ci log ma yin te /
translated: If emptiness does not exist for the impermanent, then grasping the impermanent as empty would not be an error, because impermanence is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: de yang phyin ci log nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the words is that this also is an error.

original: de'i chos ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rtag par 'dzin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i chos ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rtag par 'dzin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The meaning is that, like grasping permanence, it is a conceptualization because it is a phenomenon of that.

original: de ltar na 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir pha rol po'i dam bcas pa'i don las bzlog pa'i tshig gi don mngon te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir pha rol po'i dam bcas pa'i don las bzlog pa'i tshig gi don mngon te /
translated: Thus, since this is a statement that can be refuted, the meaning of the statement that is the opposite of the meaning of the opponent’s thesis is evident.

original: dper na gal te bum pa byas pa mi rtag na sgra byas pa yang ci'i phyir mi rtag par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: dper na gal te bum pa byas pa mi rtag na sgra byas pa yang ci'i phyir mi rtag par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya bas ni /
translated: For example, it is like the statement, “If a produced pot is impermanent, why would a produced sound not be impermanent?”

original: stong la mi rtag yod min pas //
analyzed: stong la mi rtag yod min pas //
translated: This teaches the rationale of the statement, “Since impermanence does not exist in emptiness,

original: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba'i 'thad pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin // zhes bya ba'i 'thad pa bstan to //
translated: why is the apprehension of it not an error?”

original: da ni mi rtag pa la mi rtag go zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dzin pa de dag rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log nyid yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mi rtag pa la mi rtag go zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dzin pa de dag rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log nyid yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the inference that the apprehension of things such as “Impermanent things are impermanent” is an error because it is a conception, he says:

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa de ni @224b phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa de ni @224b phyin ci log yin te /
translated: The statement of the syllogism here is: “The consciousness that thinks, ‘Ultimately, form is impermanent,’ is an error.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs rtags go zhes bya bar shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs rtags go zhes bya bar shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is a conception, like the conception that form is permanent.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.🔽For example, the conception that impermanent form is permanent is a misconception that accords with cyclic existence because it is a conception.

original: dper na gzugs mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa de rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log yin pa de bzhin du gzugs mi rtag pa la mi rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa
analyzed: dper na gzugs mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa de rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log yin pa de bzhin du gzugs mi rtag pa la mi rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa
translated: The conception that impermanent form is impermanent

original: de yang rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log nyid yin no //
translated: is also a misconception that accords with nirvana because it is a conception.

original: gal te 'du byed rnams stong ngo zhes bya bar shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya
analyzed: gal te 'du byed rnams stong ngo zhes bya bar shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya
translated: If you say that the cognition that compounded phenomena are empty is not definite because it is conceptual, then that is not so.

original: ba de ma nges pa nyid do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: ba de ma nges pa nyid do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is a statement that the opponent says that the reason of the Followers of the Middle Way is not definite because it is conceptual.🔽In this context, the cognition that compounded phenomena are empty is conceptual. However, it is not a mistaken consciousness.

original: 'di na 'du byed rnams stong ngo zhes bya bar shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag rnam par rtog pa nyid yin yang phyin ci log ma yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di na 'du byed rnams stong ngo zhes bya bar shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag rnam par rtog pa nyid yin yang phyin ci log ma yin par mthong bas des na ci re zhig rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, is it the case that because it is conceptual,

original: dper na gzugs rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa bzhin gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa de phyin ci log yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: dper na gzugs rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa bzhin gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa de phyin ci log yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: like the cognition that form is permanent, the cognition that form is impermanent is mistaken?

original: 'on te rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'du byed rnams stong ngo zhes bya bar shes pa rnams par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag bzhin du gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa de phyin ci log ma yin par 'gyur ba ma
analyzed: 'on te rnam par rtog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na 'du byed rnams stong ngo zhes bya bar shes pa rnams par rtog pa dang bcas pa dag bzhin du gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar shes pa de phyin ci log ma yin par 'gyur ba ma
translated: But if it is conceptual, then just as the cognition that “compounded phenomena are empty” is conceptual, the cognition that “form is impermanent” would not be erroneous.

original: nges pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nges pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: It is definitely not erroneous.

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the Subcommentary says:

original: de yang phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “That is not a fault because it is erroneous.”🔽“The cognition that ‘compounded phenomena are empty’ is conceptual and it is erroneous because it is compatible with nirvana in a conventional sense.

original: 'du byed rnams stong ngo zhes bya bar shes pa rnams par rtog pa dang bcas pa de yang kun rdzob tu mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas kho bo'i gtan tshig ma nges pa
analyzed: 'du byed rnams stong ngo zhes bya bar shes pa rnams par rtog pa dang bcas pa de yang kun rdzob tu mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas kho bo'i gtan tshig ma nges pa
translated: Therefore, since there is no discordant factor, my reason is not indeterminate.

original: nyid kyi skyon med do ;
analyzed: nyid kyi skyon med do ;
translated: It is not a fault.”

original: / gal te de lta na stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / gal te de lta na stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then the wisdom of emptiness also does not bring about the attainment of liberation, because it is erroneous.

original: dper na nang gi skye mched rnams kyi yul la bde ba la sogs par shes pa bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na nang gi skye mched rnams kyi yul la bde ba la sogs par shes pa bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, it is like the consciousness that perceives the internal sense bases as pleasant, etc.

original: pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re /
translated: The opponent says:

original: gal te de ltar gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar @225a * //
analyzed: gal te de ltar gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar @225a * //
translated: If the knowledge that form is impermanent
