original: shes pa dang / 'du byed rnams stong ngo zhes bya bar shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa de dag phyin ci log yin na de ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyi dpe shes kyang phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma
analyzed: shes pa dang / 'du byed rnams stong ngo zhes bya bar shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa de dag phyin ci log yin na de ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyi dpe shes kyang phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma
translated: and the knowledge that compounded phenomena are empty are conceptual and erroneous, then the knowledge of the examples of emptiness of yogins is also erroneous. Therefore, the error arises that it does not bring about the attainment of liberation.

original: yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the opponent’s statement.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /🔽dper na nang gi skye mched rnams kyi yul gzugs la sogs pa la bde ba la sogs par shes pa ni phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyi ye shes
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te / dper na nang gi skye mched rnams kyi yul gzugs la sogs pa la bde ba la sogs par shes pa ni phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyi ye shes
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: kyang phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kyang phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, the consciousness of pleasure, etc. with regard to the object, form, etc. of the internal sense bases is erroneous, and therefore does not cause the attainment of liberation. In the same way, the error of the yogis' wisdom of emptiness would not cause the attainment of liberation.

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes bya bas thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes brtag pa smras so //
analyzed: 'dir dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes bya bas thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes brtag pa smras so //
translated: Here, what is the meaning of that thesis? He says that the meaning of the thesis, It does not cause the attainment of liberation, should be examined.

original: gal te mig stong par shes pa thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /🔽thar pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i yi shes kyis 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gal te pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa de'i don rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa rnam par rtog
analyzed: gal te mig stong par shes pa thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te / thar pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i yi shes kyis 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gal te pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa de'i don rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa rnam par rtog
translated: If you say that the knowledge that the eye is empty does not cause the attainment of liberation, then you are proving what is already established for us.🔽Because liberation is attained through nonconceptual gnosis.

original: pa dang bcas pas mig la sogs pa stong par shes pa de thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: pa dang bcas pas mig la sogs pa stong par shes pa de thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhe na ni /
translated: This is saying that if the opponents say that the knowledge that the eye is empty, which is a conceptual cognition arisen from hearing and contemplation of yogis, does not cause the attainment of liberation,

original: grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: then they are proving what is already established for us.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang thar pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang thar pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because in our system liberation is attained through nonconceptual gnosis,

original: mig stong par shes pa de ni phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin par grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mig stong par shes pa de ni phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin par grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: it is established that the knowledge that the eye is empty does not cause the attainment of liberation because it is mistaken.

original: ci ste rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhe na ni de'i phyin ci log gi shes pa nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: ci ste rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhe na ni de'i phyin ci log gi shes pa nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya bas ni /
translated: But if you say that it is non-conceptual, then the meaning of your reason is not established, because it is not established that it is a mistaken consciousness.

original: gal te pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa de'i don rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa rnam par mi rtog pa de thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa de'i don rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa rnam par mi rtog pa de thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that the non-conceptual consciousness that arises from the meditation of yogis does not bring about the attainment of liberation,

original: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa @225b nyid de /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa @225b nyid de /
translated: then the meaning of your reason is not established, because the reason is mistaken.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa rnam par mi rtog pa de phyin ci log gi shes pa nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa rnam par mi rtog pa de phyin ci log gi shes pa nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught by the statement “because it is not established that it is a mistaken consciousness.”

original: gal te stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the non-conceptual wisdom of emptiness does not bring about the attainment of liberation,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa rnam par mi rtog pa de yang rnam par mi rtog
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa rnam par mi rtog pa de yang rnam par mi rtog
translated: If you say that it is like the eye consciousness of a child because it is nonconceptual,

original: pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin pas thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhes skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te ;
analyzed: pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin pas thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhes skyon 'dogs pa'i tshig yin te ;
translated: this is a statement that faults the opponent, because they say that the nonconceptual consciousness arisen from the meditation of yogins is not a cause of attaining liberation because it is like the eye consciousness of ordinary beings.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are, respectively, the subject, the predicate of the proposition, the reason and the example.

original: dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa yang
analyzed: dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa yang
translated: For example, the eye consciousness of a child is not a cause of attaining liberation because it is nonconceptual. In the same way, the nonconceptual wisdom of emptiness arisen from the meditation of yogins

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it is nonconceptual, it does not cause the attainment of liberation.

original: de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel ba byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the Subcommentary states:

original: rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: “The meaning of the reason is not established for you.

original: 'gog pa shes pa bsgoms pa las byung bdag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa bsgoms pa las byung bdag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Because the knowledge of cessation that arises from meditation is nonconceptual, it is not definite.”

original: 'di na khyed kyi 'gog pa shes pa bsgoms pa bsgoms pa las byung ba dag rnam par mi rtog pa yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di na khyed kyi 'gog pa shes pa bsgoms pa bsgoms pa las byung ba dag rnam par mi rtog pa yang yin la /
translated: Here, you see that the knowledge of cessation that arises from meditation is nonconceptual and

original: thar pa thob par byed pa yang yin par mthong bas des ni ci re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thar pa thob par byed pa yang yin par mthong bas des ni ci re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
translated: it causes the attainment of liberation. Therefore, how could it be that because it is nonconceptual,

original: dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bsgoms pa las byung ba stong ba nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa de thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bsgoms pa las byung ba stong ba nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa de thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: like the eye consciousness of a child, the nonconceptual wisdom of emptiness that arises from the meditation of yogins does not cause the attainment of liberation?

original: 'on te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na khyed kyi 'gog pa shes pa bsgoms pa las byung ba dag bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba stong ba nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa de thar pa thob par byed
analyzed: 'on te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na khyed kyi 'gog pa shes pa bsgoms pa las byung ba dag bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba stong ba nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa de thar pa thob par byed
translated: Or, because it is nonconceptual, like your knowledge of cessation that arises from meditation, the nonconceptual transcendent wisdom of emptiness that arises from the yogi’s meditation is not ascertained to be the cause of attaining liberation.

original: pa yin pa ma nges pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don rang la ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: pa yin pa ma nges pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don rang la ma nges pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore your reason, “because it is nonconceptual,” is not established for you, and so it is not correct.

original: rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /🔽stong pa nyid @226a * //
analyzed: rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te / stong pa nyid @226a * //
translated: Also, the meaning of your reason is not established for you.

original: kyi ye shes kyang ngo bo nyid rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don rang la ma grub pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: kyi ye shes kyang ngo bo nyid rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don rang la ma grub pa nyid du ston te /
translated: The statement “because the wisdom of emptiness is conceptual by nature” shows that the meaning of your reason, “because it is nonconceptual,” is not established for you.

original: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir sems pa med pa dag ltar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du khyed rang la ma grub pa'i
analyzed: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgoms pa las byung ba stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir sems pa med pa dag ltar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du khyed rang la ma grub pa'i
translated: Thus, the wisdom of emptiness that arises from the meditation of yogis is not nonconceptual, because it is the entity of consciousness, just like those without minds.

original: phyir ro // rjes su dpag pas kyang mi gnod de /
analyzed: phyir ro // rjes su dpag pas kyang mi gnod de /
translated: This is not undermined by inference,🔽because you have no example.🔽This also does not undermine the Followers of the Middle Way,🔽because the example you cite is not established for you.

original: rang la dpe med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi rjes su dpag pa stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang la dpe med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi rjes su dpag pa stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: You may say, “The wisdom of emptiness that arises from the meditation of yogis is not nonconceptual, because it is the entity of consciousness, just like those without minds.”

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /🔽dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba des kyang dbu ma pa la mi gnod de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /🔽dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba des kyang dbu ma pa la mi gnod de /
translated: This is not a correct consequence.

original: 'di ltar pha rol po dag gi dpe byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol po dag gi dpe byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the example of the opponent, “like the eye consciousness of a child,” is a conceptual thought that has the nature of consciousness.

original: pha rol po dag rang la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du ma grub pas dpe med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol po dag rang la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du ma grub pas dpe med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Since the opponent is not established as non-conceptual for himself, it is shown that there is no example.🔽Moreover, the statement “it does not cause the attainment of liberation” is the meaning of what?

original: gzhan yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag gi stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te zhes dam
analyzed: gzhan yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag gi stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin te zhes dam
translated: This shows that the opponent previously asserted, “The nonconceptual wisdom of emptiness of the opponent also does not cause the attainment of liberation.”

original: bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes gal te gnyis su brtag pa ston to //
analyzed: bcas pa de'i don gang yin zhes gal te gnyis su brtag pa ston to //
translated: The meaning of that is what? If it is taught that it is a dualistic investigation,

original: gal te thar pa mi byed pa'o zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te thar pa mi byed pa'o zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: if it is said, “It does not cause liberation,” that is an establishment of what is already established.

original: thar pa ni ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gal te pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa de'i don stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa des thar pa mi byed pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no
analyzed: thar pa ni ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gal te pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa de'i don stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa des thar pa mi byed pa'i phyir thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no
translated: The line “because liberation is not created” means that if the meaning of the opponent’s thesis is that nonconceptual wisdom of emptiness does not create liberation, then it does not bring about the attainment of liberation.

original: zhes bya ba yin na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: “Because liberation is not created” means that if the meaning of the opponent’s thesis is that nonconceptual wisdom of emptiness does not create liberation, then it is a proof of what is already established for us.

original: 'di ltar thar pa ni byas pa ma yin par kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ma yin no zhe na ni rang la ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar thar pa ni byas pa ma yin par kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang grub pa'i phyir ro // gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ma yin no zhe na ni rang la ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: Because liberation is not created, it is established in our system.🔽If you say, “It does not know the meaning as it is,” then it is not established for you.

original: mngon sum gyi blo dag gis ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gal te pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa de'i don stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa des don mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa ji lta ba bzhin
analyzed: mngon sum gyi blo dag gis ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gal te pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa de'i don stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa des don mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa ji lta ba bzhin
translated: Because it is not established by the awarenesses of direct perception” means that if the meaning of the opponent’s thesis is that nonconceptual wisdom of emptiness does not know impermanence as it is,

original: du shes pa ma yin pas de thar pa thob par byed pa ma @226b yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: du shes pa ma yin pas de thar pa thob par byed pa ma @226b yin no zhe na ni /
translated: But if you say that it is not a cognition of emptiness, then it does not bring about the attainment of liberation.

original: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don rang la ma nges pa nyid de /🔽'di na mngon sum gyi blo dag rnam par mi rtog pa yin yang gzugs la sogs pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yin par mthong bas des na ji re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don rang la ma nges pa nyid de / 'di na mngon sum gyi blo dag rnam par mi rtog pa yin yang gzugs la sogs pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yin par mthong bas des na ji re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa
translated: If you say that the reason of the opponent is not established, then the meaning of that reason is not established for you.

original: bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa de yang mi rtag pa la mi rtag par don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa de yang mi rtag pa la mi rtag par don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: Here, although the cognitions of direct perception are nonconceptual, they are seen to be cognitions of objects such as form just as they are. Therefore, how could the nonconceptual wisdom of emptiness be a cognition of impermanence just as it is, like the eye consciousness of a child?

original: 'on te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum gyi blo dag gi gzugs la sogs pa don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa des kyang mi rtag pa la mi rtag par don
analyzed: 'on te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na mngon sum gyi blo dag gi gzugs la sogs pa don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa des kyang mi rtag pa la mi rtag par don
translated: Or, because it is nonconceptual, like the consciousnesses of form and so on in direct perception, which cognize their objects as they are, the nonconceptual gnosis of emptiness also cognizes impermanence as impermanence, and so on.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don rang la ma grub pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yin par 'gyur ba ma nges pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don rang la ma grub pa nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it is not ascertained, the reason of the opponent, “because it is nonconceptual,” is not correct, since its meaning is not established for them.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i lan gdab pa bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ba'i lan gdab pa bstan to //
translated: This explains the response to the statement that the gnosis of emptiness does not bring about the attainment of liberation.

original: da ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang phyin ci log gi shes pa yin no zhes zer ba'i lan gdab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang phyin ci log gi shes pa yin no zhes zer ba'i lan gdab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the response to the statement that nonconceptual gnosis is a mistaken consciousness,🔽the root text says:

original: 'dis ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang phyin ci log gi shes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang phyin ci log gi shes pa yin te /
translated: This also answers those who say that nonconceptual wisdom is a mistaken consciousness,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes zer ba dag la yang lan gdab par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes zer ba dag la yang lan gdab par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is nonconceptual, like the eye consciousness.

original: gzhan yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang thar pa thob par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
translated: Moreover, what is the meaning of the statement “It does not cause the attainment of liberation”?

original: gal te thar pa mi byed pa'o zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te thar pa mi byed pa'o zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If it means “it does not bring about liberation,” that is a premise that is to be proven.

original: thar pa ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because liberation is not something that is created.

original: gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ma yin no zhe na ni rang la ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ma yin no zhe na ni rang la ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: If it means “it does not know things as they are,” then it is not established for you.🔽Because it is not established for you through the awareness of direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyi blo dag gis ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gal 'dis ni pha rol po gang dag rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang phyin ci log gi shes pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi blo dag gis ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gal 'dis ni pha rol po gang dag rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang phyin ci log gi shes pa yin te /
translated: This argument also answers those who say that nonconceptual wisdom is a mistaken consciousness,🔽because it is nonconceptual, like the eye consciousness.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de dag la yang lan gdab par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de dag la yang lan gdab par rig par bya'o //
translated: because it is non-conceptual, like the visual consciousness.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The response to that is as follows.

original: phyin ci log gi shes pa yin te zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi shes pa yin te zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, “It is a mistaken consciousness”?

original: gal te thar pa mi byed pa'o zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te thar pa mi byed pa'o zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If it means that it does not bring about liberation, then that is unproven.

original: thar pa ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because liberation is not something that is produced.

original: @227a * // gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ma yin no zhe na ni rang la ma nges pa nyid /
analyzed: @227a * // gal te don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ma yin no zhe na ni rang la ma nges pa nyid /
translated: If it means that it does not know things as they are, then that is not established for you.

original: mngon sum gyi blo dag gis ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi blo dag gis ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because it is not established for you that it is not known by the cognitions of direct perception.

original: ci ste mngon sum gyi shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas smra ba dag 'di skad ces mngon sum gyi shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste mngon sum gyi shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas smra ba dag 'di skad ces mngon sum gyi shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: If you say that direct perception is conceptual, then you should not say that direct perception is non-conceptual.

original: shes pa yin pa'i phyir dang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir dper na rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhe na zhes bya bas ni mngon sum gyi shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par smra ba dag mngon sum gyi shes pa yang shes pa yin
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i phyir dang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir dper na rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhe na zhes bya bas ni mngon sum gyi shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par smra ba dag mngon sum gyi shes pa yang shes pa yin
translated: If you say that it is because it is a consciousness and because it is a valid knowledge, like, for example, an inferential consciousness,🔽then you are saying that even a conceptual direct perception is a valid knowledge.🔽

original: pa dang / tshad ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: pa dang / tshad ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyis rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: If you say that it is because it is consciousness and because it is valid knowledge, like the consciousness that is inference, then this is a statement that proves that even a conceptual direct perceptual consciousness is conceptual, because of the reason that it is consciousness and because it is valid knowledge, like the consciousness that is inference.

original: de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute that,

original: de dag la yang 'di skad ces lhas byin gyi mngon sum gyi blo ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag la yang 'di skad ces lhas byin gyi mngon sum gyi blo ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin te /
translated: it should be said to them, “The direct perceptual consciousness of Devadatta is nonconceptual,

original: mngon sum gyi gzugs kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir dang mig la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi gzugs kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir dang mig la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the subject that perceives form by means of direct perception and because it is based on the eye,

original: dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: like the eye consciousness of a child.”

original: dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum gyi gzugs kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / mig la brten pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa bzhin du lhas byin gyi mngon sum gyi blo yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mngon sum gyi gzugs kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / mig la brten pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa bzhin du lhas byin gyi mngon sum gyi blo yang de bzhin no //
translated: For example, just as the eye consciousness of a child is a direct perceptual consciousness of a visible form because it is the object of the eye consciousness and it is based on the eye, so too the direct perceptual consciousness of Devadatta is like that.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad du ni shes pa de dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin la /🔽don dam par ni dpe med de rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa shes pa dag kyang rab tu dben pa dang ro gcig pas mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs shes pa yin pa'i phyir dang tshad ma
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad du ni shes pa de dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin la / don dam par ni dpe med de rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa shes pa dag kyang rab tu dben pa dang ro gcig pas mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs shes pa yin pa'i phyir dang tshad ma
translated: Therefore, conventionally, those consciousnesses are not ascertained.🔽But ultimately, there is no example because inferential consciousnesses and so on are of the same nature as the nature of being isolated and of the same taste.

original: yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de dag tha snyad du byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de dag tha snyad du byis pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin la /
translated: This is the response to the opponent’s argument that the reason “because it is a consciousness” and the reason “because it is a valid cognition” are not established as common being because, conventionally, they are like the eye consciousness of a child.

original: don dam par ni pha rol po dag gi dpe rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma grub po zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: don dam par ni pha rol po dag gi dpe rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de ma grub po zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: This concludes the explanation of the ancillary topic.🔽Now, the main point will be explained.🔽The four errors that accord with samsara are errors, and in the same way, the four errors that accord with nirvana are also errors.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid kyi dbang du bya'o zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob tu ji ltar 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log bzhi po dag phyin ci log nyid yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa @227b dang rjes
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid kyi dbang du bya'o zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob tu ji ltar 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log bzhi po dag phyin ci log nyid yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa @227b dang rjes
translated: This is sufficient as an ancillary explanation.🔽Now, the main point will be explained.

original: su mthun pa'i phyin ci log bzhi po dag kyang phyin ci log nyid yin par sgrub pa zhar la bshad pas chog gi / de ni ji ltar mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la 'dzin pa 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang
analyzed: su mthun pa'i phyin ci log bzhi po dag kyang phyin ci log nyid yin par sgrub pa zhar la bshad pas chog gi / de ni ji ltar mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la 'dzin pa 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang
translated: As for impermanence and permanence, the apprehension of impermanence and permanence is an error that accords with samsara and nirvana.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log yin pa de bzhin du bdag dang / bde ba dang sdug pa dag la yang de dang 'dra bar bstan pa'i skabs nyid kyi dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log yin pa de bzhin du bdag dang / bde ba dang sdug pa dag la yang de dang 'dra bar bstan pa'i skabs nyid kyi dbang du bya'o //
translated: Just as it is said that the error of permanence is a concordant error, so too should the errors of self, pleasure, and beauty be explained in the same context.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this,

original: ji ltar mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'dzin pa phyin ci log yin pa de bzhin du bdag dang bde ba dang sdug pa dag la /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'dzin pa phyin ci log yin pa de bzhin du bdag dang bde ba dang sdug pa dag la /
translated: just as the apprehension of the impermanent as permanent and the apprehension of the impermanent as impermanent are errors, so too the apprehension of self, pleasure, and beauty

original: bdag dang bde ba dang sdug pa dang bdag med pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / mi sdug par 'dzin pa dag kyang phyin ci log yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽sngar / gal te mi rtag rtag pa zhes //
analyzed: bdag dang bde ba dang sdug pa dang bdag med pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / mi sdug par 'dzin pa dag kyang phyin ci log yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te / sngar / gal te mi rtag rtag pa zhes //
translated: in the context of selflessness, suffering, and ugliness should be described as errors.🔽Previously it was said:

original: de ltar 'dzin pa log yin na //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa log yin na //
translated: If the apprehension of the impermanent as permanent🔽Is an error,

original: stong la mi rtag yod min pas //
analyzed: stong la mi rtag yod min pas //
translated: Since the impermanent does not exist in the empty,

original: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //🔽gal te mi rtag mi rtag ces //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin // gal te mi rtag mi rtag ces //
translated: How is that apprehension not an error?🔽If the apprehension of the impermanent as impermanent

original: de ltar 'dzin pa log min na //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa log min na //
translated: Is not an error,

original: stong la mi rtag yod min pas //
analyzed: stong la mi rtag yod min pas //
translated: Since the impermanent does not exist in the empty,🔽How is that apprehension not an error?

original: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //🔽zhes bya bas mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa ni 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa phyin ci log yin la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin // zhes bya bas mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa ni 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa phyin ci log yin la /
translated: How can the apprehension of the impermanent as permanent be a distortion that accords with cyclic existence?

original: mi rtag pa la mi rtag par 'dzin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log yin par bstan pa bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //🔽gzhan dag gis dam bcas pa'i don sgro btags nas smras pa 'dzin pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la mi rtag par 'dzin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log yin par bstan pa bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o // gzhan dag gis dam bcas pa'i don sgro btags nas smras pa 'dzin pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The apprehension of the impermanent as permanent is a distortion that accords with cyclic existence, and the apprehension of the impermanent as impermanent is a distortion that accords with nirvana.🔽The remaining three should be applied in the same way, as appropriate.

original: de 'dzin par byed pa dang / 'dzin pa po dang / gzung ba dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pa dang / 'dzin pa po dang / gzung ba dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Others say that the apprehension of the object of another’s thesis is only existent because the apprehender, the apprehender, and the apprehended exist.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la de gsum po de dag med de dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la de gsum po de dag med de dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: Here, if something does not exist, these three do not exist, like the horn of an ass.

original: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa la ni shes pa gang gis 'dzin par byed pa dang / 'dzin pa po phung po'i bdag nyid dang / gzung ba gzugs la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i nyon mongs pa dag yod🔽par sngar dam bcas pa de'i don 'dir brda sprod pa pa'i byed pa po'i tshig gi tha ma lag gis sgro btags nas de dag yod par sgrub @228a * //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa la ni shes pa gang gis 'dzin par byed pa dang / 'dzin pa po phung po'i bdag nyid dang / gzung ba gzugs la sogs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i nyon mongs pa dag yod par sngar dam bcas pa de'i don 'dir brda sprod pa pa'i byed pa po'i tshig gi tha ma lag gis sgro btags nas de dag yod par sgrub @228a * //
translated: This is because they assert that the afflictions that are the apprehension of the self of phenomena exist.

original: pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: Here, the meaning of that former assertion is indicated by the word “indeed,” which is a word of the agent of the one who indicates the meaning.🔽The word “indeed” is a word that proves that those afflictions exist.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The word “indeed” is applied to the subject, the predicate, the reason, the example of the predicate of the similar class, the application, and the conclusion, respectively.

original: 'di ni ri bong gi rva lta bu gang yod pa ma yin pa la byed pa po dang / byed pa dang / las byed pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni ri bong gi rva lta bu gang yod pa ma yin pa la byed pa po dang / byed pa dang / las byed pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is like the horn of a rabbit, which does not exist. The agent, action, and object of action do not exist.

original: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i bya ba la ni gsum yod pas de yang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i bya ba la ni gsum yod pas de yang yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But the activity of grasping what is unreal does exist, because the three exist.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary explains here:🔽The grasper, the grasped,

original: gang gis 'dzin dang 'dzin gang dang // 'dzin pa po dang gang gzung ba //
analyzed: gang gis 'dzin dang 'dzin gang dang // 'dzin pa po dang gang gzung ba //
translated: and the grasper—

original: thams cad nye bar zhi ba de //
analyzed: thams cad nye bar zhi ba de //
translated: all of these are completely pacified.

original: de phyir 'dzin pa yod ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de phyir 'dzin pa yod ma yin // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, grasping does not exist.

original: 'dis ni phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i byed pa dang / bya ba dang / byed pa po dang / las shes pa bzhi po thams cad nye bar zhi bas 'dzin pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i byed pa dang / bya ba dang / byed pa po dang / las shes pa bzhi po thams cad nye bar zhi bas 'dzin pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that the activity of grasping does not exist because the four—the activity of grasping what is unreal, the action, the agent, and the object—are completely pacified.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that point in more detail, he says:

original: gang gi 'dzin par byed pa ni dngos po'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid pa dmigs pa'i shes pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang gi 'dzin par byed pa ni dngos po'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid pa dmigs pa'i shes pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The apprehender is the consciousness that observes the specific and general characteristics of things.

original: de ni bye pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bye pa'o //
translated: This is the analysis.

original: 'dzin pa gang yin pa ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i bdag nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni bya ba'o //🔽'dzin pa po ni ming dang gzugs kyi bdag nyid dam de las gzhan pa bdag go zhes bya ba de ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gang yin pa ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i bdag nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni bya ba'o // 'dzin pa po ni ming dang gzugs kyi bdag nyid dam de las gzhan pa bdag go zhes bya ba de ni byed pa po'o //
translated: The apprehender is the self that is the nature of superimposition and denial.🔽The agent is the self that is the nature of name-and-form or something other than that.

original: gang gzung ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni las so //
analyzed: gang gzung ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni las so //
translated: The object to be apprehended is form and so on. This is the action.

original: de dag thams cad nye bar zhi bar bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de dag thams cad nye bar zhi bar bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: In order to teach that all of those are completely pacified,

original: de dag ni skabs ji lta ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid stong par bstan zin pas des na 'dzin par byed pa la sogs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba ste zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de dag ni skabs ji lta ba bzhin du ngo bo nyid stong par bstan zin pas des na 'dzin par byed pa la sogs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba ste zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: since their natures are taught to be empty just as they are, therefore all of the apprehender and so on are completely pacified.

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the action of apprehending does not exist,

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, there is no grasping.

original: 'dzin pa'i bya ba bzhin du byed pa po dang byed pa dang las de dag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i bya ba bzhin du byed pa po dang byed pa dang las de dag yod pa nyid du ston pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The reason and example that demonstrate the existence of the agent, action, and object are not established, just like the action of grasping.

original: da ni de ltar 'dzin pa med pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log gnyis yod pa ma yin par @228b bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de ltar 'dzin pa med pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log gnyis yod pa ma yin par @228b bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that, since there is no grasping in that way, the two errors that accord with saṃsāra and nirvāṇa do not exist,

original: de'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar /
translated: therefore, in that way,

original: log pa'am yang dag nyid du ni //
analyzed: log pa'am yang dag nyid du ni //
translated: grasping as real or unreal

original: 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin na //
translated: does not exist.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Permanence and impermanence, and so on.

original: de ltar phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis med pas rnal 'byor pa de dang ldan pa'i phyin ci log can rnam pa gnyis kyang yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis med pas rnal 'byor pa de dang ldan pa'i phyin ci log can rnam pa gnyis kyang yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since the two kinds of erroneous grasping do not exist, in order to demonstrate that the two kinds of errors that possess that yoga also do not exist,

original: 'o na don dam par /
analyzed: 'o na don dam par /
translated: then, in that case,

original: gang la phyin ci log yod cing //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci log yod cing //
translated: And where is there no error?

original: gang la phyin ci ma log yod //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci ma log yod //
translated: And where is there no non-error?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyis spyod pa la gnas pa la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par shes pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyis spyod pa la gnas pa la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par shes pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The intended meaning is that for one who abides in the practice of non-conceptual wisdom, the cognition of permanence, impermanence, etc. does not occur.

original: yang na gang dag 'di skad ces phyin ci log rnams ni yod pa kho na yin te de dang ldan pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na gang dag 'di skad ces phyin ci log rnams ni yod pa kho na yin te de dang ldan pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, those who say, “Errors certainly exist because one who possesses them exists,”

original: dper na gdugs dang ldan pa yod na gdugs yod pa de bzhin du phyin ci log dang ldan pa byis pa 'di dag yod pas de'i phyir phyin ci log rnams ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer na zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag phyin
analyzed: dper na gdugs dang ldan pa yod na gdugs yod pa de bzhin du phyin ci log dang ldan pa byis pa 'di dag yod pas de'i phyir phyin ci log rnams ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer na zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag phyin
translated: for example, when one who possesses an umbrella exists, an umbrella exists. In the same way, since these childish beings who possess errors exist, therefore errors certainly exist.🔽This is the statement of an opponent who,

original: ci log dang ldan pa so so'i skye bo rnams yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis phyin ci log rnams kyang yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ci log dang ldan pa so so'i skye bo rnams yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis phyin ci log rnams kyang yod par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: by the reason of the existence of ordinary beings who possess errors, establishes that errors also exist.

original: de'i lan du 'dir phyin ci log yod pa ma yin pas de dang ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir phyin ci log yod pa ma yin pas de dang ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: In response to that, in order to demonstrate that since error does not exist, one who possesses it also does not exist, this is said:🔽There is no grasping

original: log pa'am yang dag nyid du ni //🔽'dzin pa yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: log pa'am yang dag nyid du ni // 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin na //
translated: in terms of error or non-error.

original: rnam pa gnyi ga yang sngar bstan pa'i sgrub pas skye ba la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi ga yang sngar bstan pa'i sgrub pas skye ba la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both aspects are not established, as was previously demonstrated through the proofs of “Origination is not tenable in any way,” and so on.

original: de bzhin du /🔽gang la phyin ci log yod cing //
analyzed: de bzhin du / gang la phyin ci log yod cing //
translated: Similarly,🔽Where is there error?

original: gang la phyin ci ma log yod //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci ma log yod //
translated: Where is there non-error?

original: phyin ci log gang la ltos na 'di na phyin ci log dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gang la ltos na 'di na phyin ci log dang ldan pa'o //
translated: In dependence on what error is there one who possesses error here?🔽In dependence on what non-error is there one who possesses non-error here?

original: 'di na phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba de dag kyang phyin ci log bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na phyin ci ma log pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba de dag kyang phyin ci log bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Those also do not exist, like error.

original: gang la phyin ci log yod pa dang / gang la phyin ci ma log pa yod pa de dag yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci log yod pa dang / gang la phyin ci ma log pa yod pa de dag yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The meaning of the words is this: Where there is error and where there is non-error, those do not exist.

original: de'i phyir don dam par gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang dpe yang med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang dpe yang med la /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, the meaning of the reason is not established, and there is no example.🔽And conventionally, there is contradiction in the meaning.

original: kun rdzob tu ni don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya bas ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //🔽yang gzhan yang 'di la phyin ci log dang ldan pa 'di ni phyin ci log dang bcas par 'dod na de yang phyin ci log tu sbyar @229a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya bas ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no // yang gzhan yang 'di la phyin ci log dang ldan pa 'di ni phyin ci log dang bcas par 'dod na de yang phyin ci log tu sbyar @229a * //
translated: This is the summary and the result of the valid cognition.

original: pa'am ; phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa'am /
analyzed: pa'am ; phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa'am /
translated: Moreover, if you assert that one who possesses error possesses error, then that error would be applied to one who possesses error, or it would not be applied to one who possesses error,🔽or it would be applied to one who possesses error while it is in the process of arising.🔽If you assert that one who possesses error possesses error, then that error would be one of these three.

original: phyin ci log tu 'gyur bzhin pa zhig yin grang na zhes bya bas ni phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i gang zag ni phyin ci log dang bcas par 'dod na de yang gang zag 'di gsum las gcig yin grang na gsum char yang de yin par mi 'thad
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'gyur bzhin pa zhig yin grang na zhes bya bas ni phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i gang zag ni phyin ci log dang bcas par 'dod na de yang gang zag 'di gsum las gcig yin grang na gsum char yang de yin par mi 'thad
translated: However, it is untenable that it is any of these three.

original: do zhes brtag pa rnam pa gsum ston to //
analyzed: do zhes brtag pa rnam pa gsum ston to //
translated: Thus, three types of analysis are presented.

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the first type of analysis is untenable, it is said:

original: de la phyin ci log tu gyur pa la /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log tu gyur pa la /
translated: In response to that, it was said:

original: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible for one who is not mistaken🔽To possess the four errors.

original: de dag dang ldan pa la de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //🔽brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa la de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so // brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it would be meaningless for one who possesses them to possess them.

original: phyin ci log tu ma gyur la //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu ma gyur la //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the second conception is also untenable, it was said:

original: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible for one who is mistaken🔽To possess the four errors.

original: de dag dang bral ba'i phyir dper na 'phags pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba'i phyir dper na 'phags pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because he is free from them, like an aryan.

original: brtag pa gsum pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa gsum pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the third conception is also untenable, it was said:

original: phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba bzhin la phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba bzhin la phyin ci log dag mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible for one who is mistaken🔽To possess the four errors.

original: skyon gnyi gar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: skyon gnyi gar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because both errors would ensue.

original: de ltar brtag pa gsum pa mi 'thad pas phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i gang zag yod pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar brtag pa gsum pa mi 'thad pas phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i gang zag yod pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since the third conception is untenable, in order to demonstrate that the person who possesses the four errors does not exist, it was said:

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa dang / phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa dang phyin ci log tu 'gyur bzhin pa ma gtogs pa'i phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i gang zag mi 'thad pas de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa dang / phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa dang phyin ci log tu 'gyur bzhin pa ma gtogs pa'i phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i gang zag mi 'thad pas de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Since it is untenable that a person who possesses error exists apart from error that is erroneous, not erroneous, or in the process of becoming erroneous, therefore it is said:

original: khyod nyid phyogs su lhung ba'i blo med par gyis la /
analyzed: khyod nyid phyogs su lhung ba'i blo med par gyis la /
translated: You should have a mind that does not fall into any position.

original: gang la phyin ci log srid pa //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci log srid pa //
translated: If error were possible for someone,

original: bdag nyid kyis na rnam par dpyod //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis na rnam par dpyod //
translated: then that person would be analyzed by himself.

original: phyin ci log dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The meaning of the words “it does not exist” is that a person who possesses error does not exist.🔽Therefore, the faults of the reason and example are the same as before.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs dang dpe'i skyon snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs dang dpe'i skyon snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe don dam par ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyi dbang gis dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam par phyin ci log rnams skye ba med pas yod pa ma yin pa'i
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe don dam par ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyi dbang gis dngos po thams cad skye ba med par bstan pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam par phyin ci log rnams skye ba med pas yod pa ma yin pa'i
translated: Moreover, when all things are shown to be non-arisen by the power of the method of teaching in the ultimate, then at that time, etc.

original: phyir phyin ci log dang ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa rnam pa gzhan ston to //
analyzed: phyir phyin ci log dang ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa rnam pa gzhan ston to //
translated: This demonstrates another way of establishing that one who possesses error does not exist because error does not exist in the ultimate, since error is non-arisen in the ultimate.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: phyin ci log rnams ma skyes na //
analyzed: phyin ci log rnams ma skyes na //
translated: If error is non-arisen,

original: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
translated: how could it exist?

original: yod par mi 'gyur ba nyid de ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: yod par mi 'gyur ba nyid de ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that it could not exist because it is non-arisen.

original: phyin ci log @229b rnams skye med na //
analyzed: phyin ci log @229b rnams skye med na //
translated: If error is non-arisen,

original: phyin ci log can ga la yod //
analyzed: phyin ci log can ga la yod //
translated: how could one who possesses error exist?

original: phyin ci log can zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smra so //
analyzed: phyin ci log can zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smra so //
translated: One who possesses error is synonymous with one who possesses error.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa'i skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the fault of the reason, etc. is just as stated. This is the conclusion and the result of the valid cognition.

original: yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam par bdag la sogs pa yod na ni bdag la sogs par shes pa yang phyin ci log ma yin pa zhig na /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam par bdag la sogs pa yod na ni bdag la sogs par shes pa yang phyin ci log ma yin pa zhig na /
translated: Moreover, if the self, etc. existed ultimately, then the cognition of the self, etc. would not be erroneous.

original: don dam par bdag la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin pas bdag la sogs par shes pa ni 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log yin par ston to//
analyzed: don dam par bdag la sogs pa dag yod pa ma yin pas bdag la sogs par shes pa ni 'khor ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyin ci log yin par ston to//
translated: But since the self, etc. do not exist ultimately, the cognition of the self, etc. is an error that conforms with cyclic existence.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: don dam par /
analyzed: don dam par /
translated: ultimately,

original: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dang // rtag dang bde ba yod na ni //
analyzed: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dang // rtag dang bde ba yod na ni //
translated: if the self, the agreeable, the permanent, and the blissful existed,

original: bdag shes sdug shes rtag shes dang // bde zhes phyin ci log ma yin //
analyzed: bdag shes sdug shes rtag shes dang // bde zhes phyin ci log ma yin //
translated: then the cognition of the self, the agreeable, the permanent, and the blissful would not be erroneous.

original: shes bya phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: shes bya phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The intended meaning is: because the object of cognition would not be erroneous.

original: 'dir bdag shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni bdag la sogs pa de dag la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir bdag la sogs par shes pa yin par bstan to zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'dir bdag shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni bdag la sogs pa de dag la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir bdag la sogs par shes pa yin par bstan to zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Here, the words “self-knowing” and so on teach that the cognition of self and so on is so called because it abides in those selves and so on.

original: bdag shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni bdag la sogs pa'i yul la gnas pa'i blo bdag la sogs par 'dzin pa phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i don yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bdag shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni bdag la sogs pa'i yul la gnas pa'i blo bdag la sogs par 'dzin pa phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i don yin par bstan to //
translated: The words “self-knowing” and so on teach that the cognition that abides in the objects of self and so on is the meaning of the error that apprehends self and so on.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam par bdag la sogs pa med pas bdag la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam par bdag la sogs pa med pas bdag la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The words “just so” and so on teach that since ultimately self and so on do not exist, self and so on do not exist.

original: bdag med pa la bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i phyin ci log dag kyang yod pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i phyin ci log dag kyang yod pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: Therefore, the errors of the view of self and so on with respect to selflessness and so on do not exist.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, it says:

original: don dam par /
analyzed: don dam par /
translated: Ultimately,

original: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dang // rtag dang bde ba med na ni //
analyzed: gal te bdag dang sdug pa dang // rtag dang bde ba med na ni //
translated: If self, beauty, permanence, and happiness do not exist,

original: bdag med mi sdug mi rtag dang // sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag med mi sdug mi rtag dang // sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Selflessness, ugliness, impermanence, and suffering do not exist.

original: bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bdag la sogs pa bsal bas sam /🔽de dag la ltos pa bdag med pa nyid la sogs par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bdag la sogs pa bsal bas sam / de dag la ltos pa bdag med pa nyid la sogs par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The nature of selflessness and so on is established by the exclusion of self and so on,🔽or by the dependence on those, because selflessness and so on are established.

original: bdag med pa la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir gang dag la bdag la sogs par lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag med pa la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir gang dag la bdag la sogs par lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur te /
translated: Since selflessness and so on are not established, what are the views of self and so on that would be erroneous?

original: 'di ltar mi byed na sdong du ma la mir mthong ba'i phyin ci log kyang med do @230a * //🔽zhes bya bas ni don dam par bdag la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin pas bdag med pa la sogs pa grub pa'i phyir gang dag la bdag la sogs par lta ba'i gzhi med pas bdag la sogs par lta
analyzed: 'di ltar mi byed na sdong du ma la mir mthong ba'i phyin ci log kyang med do @230a * // zhes bya bas ni don dam par bdag la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin pas bdag med pa la sogs pa grub pa'i phyir gang dag la bdag la sogs par lta ba'i gzhi med pas bdag la sogs par lta
translated: If you do not do this, then the error of seeing a person in a stump would not exist.

original: ba'i phyin ci log rnams kyang yod pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: ba'i phyin ci log rnams kyang yod pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: This shows that since ultimately self and so on do not exist, selflessness and so on also do not exist, and since selflessness and so on are not established, the bases of the views of self and so on do not exist. Therefore the errors of the views of self and so on also do not exist.

original: phyin ci log nyid ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa med pa'i skyon de nyid bzlog dga'o zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log nyid ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la sogs pa med pa'i skyon de nyid bzlog dga'o zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The summary and result of the valid cognition is the statement “The error of the absence of reasons and so on is thereby averted,” since the error of the absence of reasons and so on is thereby averted because error itself is not established.

original: da ni de ltar phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de ltar phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the benefit of the pacification of all afflictions of the yogi who thus realizes error to be essenceless,

original: 'o na rnal 'byor ba de la de ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log dang phyin ci log ma yin pa dag ma grub pa'i phyir de dag tu rnam par rtog pa log par gyur pa na yon tan ci zhig 'byung bar🔽'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnal 'byor ba de la de ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log dang phyin ci log ma yin pa dag ma grub pa'i phyir de dag tu rnam par rtog pa log par gyur pa na yon tan ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: one might ask, “Well, since for that yogi error and non-error, such as permanence and impermanence, are not established, what benefit is there in the cessation of the conception of them?”

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu bstan par bzhed pas bshad pa //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu bstan par bzhed pas bshad pa //
translated: In response to this, intending to teach the result in the manner that has been explained, it is said:

original: de ltar phyin ci log 'gags pas //
analyzed: de ltar phyin ci log 'gags pas //
translated: Thus, through the cessation of error,

original: ma rig pa ni 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: Ignorance ceases.

original: phyin ci log dag gi rgyu yang ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log 'gags pas bdag la sogs par lta ba'i rgyu ma rig pa 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log dag gi rgyu yang ma rig pa yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log 'gags pas bdag la sogs par lta ba'i rgyu ma rig pa 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the cause of the errors is ignorance, so when the errors cease, the cause of the views of self, etc., ignorance, ceases.

original: ma rig 'gag par gyur na ni //🔽'du byed la sogs 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: ma rig 'gag par gyur na ni // 'du byed la sogs 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: When ignorance ceases,🔽the formations, etc., cease.

original: 'du byed la sogs pa zhes bya bar tshig sbyar te /
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa zhes bya bar tshig sbyar te /
translated: The formations, etc., should be connected with the verb cease.

original: 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, etc.

original: de'i phyir de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rtogs pa las nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba 'grub po zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rtogs pa las nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba 'grub po zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the affliction is accomplished by the realization of realitylessness.

original: ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs 'di la nyon mongs pa de dag yod par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs 'di la nyon mongs pa de dag yod par gyur pa'am /
translated: In this position of the advocates of reality, the afflictions are either existent or nonexistent.

original: med par gyur pa yin grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs la nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yod par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: med par gyur pa yin grang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs la nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yod par gyur pa'am /
translated: “If they existed, what would be the point? ” and so forth, shows that in the system of those who advocate that things exist inherently, it is not tenable that the afflictions are abandoned.🔽If the afflictions existed, what would be the point of abandoning them?

original: med par gyur pa zhig yin grang ste /
analyzed: med par gyur pa zhig yin grang ste /
translated: If the afflictions did not exist, what would be the point of abandoning them?

original: de ltar rtog pa dag la nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba mi 'thad pa'i glags yod pa ston to //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa dag la nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba mi 'thad pa'i glags yod pa ston to //
translated: Thus, he shows that it is not tenable that the afflictions are abandoned in the context of such thoughts.

original: de la re zhig yod bar gyur pa la spong ba mi 'thad par bstan @230b pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig yod bar gyur pa la spong ba mi 'thad par bstan @230b pa'i phyir /
translated: First, to show that it is not tenable that the afflictions are abandoned if they exist, he says:

original: des ci 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des ci 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “What would be the point?”

original: gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //
translated: If the afflictions of someone

original: gang dag ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: gang dag ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: existed inherently,

original: gang zag yod par gyur pa la la'i zhes ma smos kyang skabs las shes par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang zag yod par gyur pa la la'i zhes ma smos kyang skabs las shes par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: even though “of someone” is not explicitly stated, it should be supplied from the context.

original: des ni pha rol po dag gi gzhung bsnan pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni pha rol po dag gi gzhung bsnan pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, he shows that the opponent’s position is redundant.

original: da ni de dag la nyon mongs pa spong ba mi 'thad pa'i glags yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de dag la nyon mongs pa spong ba mi 'thad pa'i glags yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that it is not tenable that the afflictions are abandoned in that context, he says:

original: ji lta bur na spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na spong bar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be abandoned?

original: ji ltar spong bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar spong bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it not be abandoned?

original: yod pa su zhig spong bar byed //
analyzed: yod pa su zhig spong bar byed //
translated: Who could abandon what exists?

original: yod par gyur pa ni ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: yod par gyur pa ni ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The thought is that what exists has the nature of not changing.

original: da ni med par gyur pa la spong ba mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽ci ste med par gyur pa ri bong gi rva lta bu'am /
analyzed: da ni med par gyur pa la spong ba mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir / ci ste med par gyur pa ri bong gi rva lta bu'am /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that abandonment is untenable for what is nonexistent, he says:🔽If it is nonexistent, like the horn of an ass,

original: gcig la gcig med pa'i mtshan nyid lta bu yin na /
analyzed: gcig la gcig med pa'i mtshan nyid lta bu yin na /
translated: or like the characteristic of mutual exclusion,

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: then in that case as well,

original: gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: gal te la la'i nyon mongs pa //
translated: If the afflictions of someone

original: gang dag ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: gang dag ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: have no intrinsic reality,

original: 'dir yang / gang zag med par gyur pa la la'i zhes ma smros kyang skabs las shes par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir yang / gang zag med par gyur pa la la'i zhes ma smros kyang skabs las shes par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, although “of someone who is nonexistent” is not stated, it should be understood from the context.

original: des kyang pha rol po dag gi gzhung bsnan pa bstan to //
analyzed: des kyang pha rol po dag gi gzhung bsnan pa bstan to //
translated: This is what he says.

original: da ni de dag la nyon mongs pa spong ba mi 'thad pa'i glags yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de dag la nyon mongs pa spong ba mi 'thad pa'i glags yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the opportunity for the untenability of the abandonment of the afflictions exists for them, he says:

original: ji lta bur na spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na spong bar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be abandoned?

original: ji ltar spong bar mi 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar spong bar mi 'gyur zhe na //
translated: How could it not be abandoned?

original: med pa su zhig spong bar byed //
analyzed: med pa su zhig spong bar byed //
translated: Who would abandon a nonexistent?

original: med par gyur pa'i med pa nyid ni spang du med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: med par gyur pa'i med pa nyid ni spang du med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The nonexistence of a nonexistent cannot be abandoned,

original: 'di ltar nam mkha'i me tog med pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid spong bar mi khyed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha'i me tog med pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid spong bar mi khyed la /
translated: because a sky flower does not exist, and the nature of nonexistence is not abandoned.

original: rta ngo bo nyid med pas kyang rta med pa'i ngo bo nyid spong bar mi byed do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rta ngo bo nyid med pas kyang rta med pa'i ngo bo nyid spong bar mi byed do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: And the nonexistence of a horse does not abandon the nature of nonexistence.🔽But if you think that there is no error because the arising of an antidote establishes the abandonment of the existent afflictions,

original: ci ste yang 'di snyam du nyon mongs pa yod par gyur pa rnams nyid gnyen po skyes pas spong bar 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med do snyam na zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag dngos po dag yod par gyur pa la spong ba 'grub par sems pa'i🔽bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di snyam du nyon mongs pa yod par gyur pa rnams nyid gnyen po skyes pas spong bar 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med do snyam na zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag dngos po dag yod par gyur pa la spong ba 'grub par sems pa'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: the opponent thinks that the abandonment of existent things is established.

original: de ni mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is untenable,🔽he says,

original: yod par gyur pa gang gi gnyen po skyes pas ji ltar spong ba'i don de bstan dka'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yod par gyur pa gang gi gnyen po skyes pas ji ltar spong ba'i don de bstan dka'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is difficult to show how the meaning of abandonment is when the antidote to that which exists arises.

original: yod par gyur pa ni ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod par gyur pa ni ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which exists is not subject to change in its nature.

original: de la 'dir nyon mongs pa rnams yod par gyur pa dang / med par gyur par rtog pa la de dag spong ba mi 'thad pa'i glags yod pas nyon mongs pa rnams kyi chos ni spong ba yin par bstan to zhes @231a * //
analyzed: de la 'dir nyon mongs pa rnams yod par gyur pa dang / med par gyur par rtog pa la de dag spong ba mi 'thad pa'i glags yod pas nyon mongs pa rnams kyi chos ni spong ba yin par bstan to zhes @231a * //
translated: Here, since it is possible to refute the conception that afflictions exist or do not exist, it is taught that the dharma of the afflictions is abandonment.
