original: bya bas ni pha rol po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs la nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yod par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: bya bas ni pha rol po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs la nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yod par gyur pa'am /
translated: This shows that in the position of the opponent, who asserts that things exist inherently, the afflictions would either exist or not exist.

original: med par gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur bas de ltar rtog pa la nyon mongs pa spong ba mi 'thad pa'i grags yod par bstan nas /
analyzed: med par gyur pa zhig tu 'gyur bas de ltar rtog pa la nyon mongs pa spong ba mi 'thad pa'i grags yod par bstan nas /
translated: Thus it shows that it is well known that the abandonment of the afflictions is untenable in such a conception.

original: 'dir dbu ma pa don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni spang ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir dbu ma pa don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni spang ba yin par bstan to //
translated: Here, the Madhyamikas teach that the reason, the property that proves that the afflictions are ultimately devoid of intrinsic reality, is the fact that they are abandoned.

original: de'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the inference, he says:

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams ngo bo nyid med de spangs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams ngo bo nyid med de spangs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the afflictions are ultimately devoid of intrinsic reality because they are abandoned.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med dang / skyes ba dang / gzugs su byas pa'i na chung bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med dang / skyes ba dang / gzugs su byas pa'i na chung bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like the woman, man, and young girl conjured up by a magician,🔽and the faults that are realized in them.

original: skyon rtogs pa la de dag spong ba yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skyon rtogs pa la de dag spong ba yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The faults that are realized in them are abandoned.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the property to be established, the establishing property, the example, and the application of the example, respectively.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med la sogs pa ni skyon rtogs pa la de dag spong ba yod pas spang ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med la sogs pa ni skyon rtogs pa la de dag spong ba yod pas spang ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, a magician’s illusions such as an illusory woman are abandoned because when one realizes their faults, one abandons them.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyang skyon 'dogs pa la de dag spong ba yod pas spang ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyang skyon 'dogs pa la de dag spong ba yod pas spang ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: In the same way, afflictions are also abandoned because when one realizes their faults, one abandons them.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos smras pa'i sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pa dang / rang gi sgrub pa'i kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pas phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos smras pa'i sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pa dang / rang gi sgrub pa'i kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pas phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Here the meaning of the chapter is this: The refutation of the faults of the opponent’s proof and the demonstration of the absence of faults in our own proof demonstrate the falsity of the essential existence of the afflictions. This is the summary of the chapter and the result of the valid knowledge.

original: phyin ci log brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum pa'i skabs 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don tshad ma'i 'bras bur lta ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this twenty-third chapter, “An Examination of Errors,” the meaning of the treatise is that the result of valid cognition is the view, and the refutation of the specific counter-positions to emptiness demonstrates the essencelessness of errors.

original: phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa la yon tan ci yod pa dang / de bstan pa 'di la gzhan dag na re /
translated: What is the good of demonstrating the essencelessness of errors?

original: rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog ge skam po'i bstan bcos tsam nyi tshes bsgrubs so zhes zer ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In response to this question, some may say that this is just a dry treatise of sophistry.

original: 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yid ches pa'i lung gi khungs kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: In order to dispel such talk, we must establish the scriptural sources that inspire confidence.

original: 'di'i phyir 'phags pa sgo mtha' yas pa sgrub pa'i gzungs las /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir 'phags pa sgo mtha' yas pa sgrub pa'i gzungs las /
translated: To this end, the noble Infinite Gates Dhāraṇī Sūtra says:

original: ji ltar ngag 'di gzugs can min //
analyzed: ji ltar ngag 'di gzugs can min //
translated: Just as this speech is not physical,

original: kun nas dmigs su med pa ltar //
analyzed: kun nas dmigs su med pa ltar //
translated: and is not apprehended as a whole,

original: de ltar nyon mongs @231b gzugs can min //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs @231b gzugs can min //
translated: so the afflictions are not physical,

original: gtan du dmigs su yod ma yin //
analyzed: gtan du dmigs su yod ma yin //
translated: and are not apprehended as permanent.

original: ji ltar ngag 'di yod ma yin //
analyzed: ji ltar ngag 'di yod ma yin //
translated: How can this speech exist?

original: nang dang phyin mi gnas ltar //
analyzed: nang dang phyin mi gnas ltar //
translated: Just as this speech does not exist,

original: de ltar nyon mongs yod min pa //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs yod min pa //
translated: So the afflictions do not exist.

original: nang dang phyi na gnas pa min //
analyzed: nang dang phyi na gnas pa min //
translated: They do not exist internally or externally.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin te /
translated: This and more is proven.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gong mas ni nyon mongs pa rnams gzugs can nyid ma yin par bstan la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gong mas ni nyon mongs pa rnams gzugs can nyid ma yin par bstan la /
translated: The previous verse shows that the afflictions are not physical.

original: 'og mas ni nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa nyid ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'og mas ni nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa nyid ma yin par bstan to //
translated: The following verse shows that the afflictions do not exist.

original: de bzhin du yang de nyid las //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang de nyid las //
translated: Similarly, the same text says,

original: sha rva dva ti'i bu kun nas nyon mongs pa'i yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: sha rva dva ti'i bu kun nas nyon mongs pa'i yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba de bzhin nyid do //
translated: “Śāradvatīputra, the thorough knowledge of the afflictions is suchness, just as it is.

original: de la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: de la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There are no afflictions in that at all.

original: sems can phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Sentient beings who are mistaken become afflicted.

original: phyin ci log gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that mistake does not exist.

original: gang yod pa ma yin pa de la yod pa'i yongs su 'grub pa'am mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: gang yod pa ma yin pa de la yod pa'i yongs su 'grub pa'am mtshan nyid med do //
translated: That which does not exist has no establishment or characteristic of existence.🔽Śāriputra, that which is thoroughly known in that way is called purification.

original: sha rva dva ti'i bu de ltar yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa de dag kyang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sha rva dva ti'i bu de ltar yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs pa de dag kyang grub pa yin no //
translated: Those statements are established.

original: de bzhin du mdo sde gzhan dag las /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo sde gzhan dag las /
translated: Similarly, in other sūtras,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing bstan to /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing bstan to /
translated: the Tathāgata fully awakened to and taught that the afflictions do not exist.

original: gzugs su mi snang yang kun du mkhyen la ;
analyzed: gzugs su mi snang yang kun du mkhyen la ;
translated: He knows them without seeing them as forms.🔽He does not make them dual but makes them manifest, and there is no attainment.

original: gnyis su ma mdzad kyang mngon sum du mdzad cing thob pa yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gnyis su ma mdzad kyang mngon sum du mdzad cing thob pa yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Those statements are established.

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa 'di'i yon tan dang khungs yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung de dag grub pa ni phyin ci log ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa 'di'i yon tan dang khungs yin no //
translated: Those established scriptural quotations that inspire confidence are the good qualities and sources of this teaching on the lack of entityness of error.

original: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang /
analyzed: de dag bstan bcos 'dis rnam par bshad par bya ba'i yul nyid du bstan pa yang /
translated: This treatise teaches that they are the very objects to be explained.🔽

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no //🔽slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /🔽dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las phyin ci log brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyi mkhyen rlabs dang 'grel pa byed pa'i mkhas pa nyid yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las phyin ci log brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu gsum pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The fact that they are the very objects to be explained by this treatise is due to the great knowledge of the master and the skill of the commentator.🔽The twenty-third chapter of the Pramanavarttika

original: slob dpon sbyin pas gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon sbyin pas gzigs brtul zhugs kyis nye bar sbyar ba rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the twenty-third chapter of the Pramanavarttika, called “The Examination of Error,” from the Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on the Pramanavarttika, composed by the master Dharmottara, is now complete.

original: // / bam po bdun cu bzhi pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bdun cu bzhi pa /
translated: The twenty-fourth chapter

original: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
translated: Now, by refuting the specific counter-positions to emptiness,

original: 'phags pa'i @232a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i @232a * //
translated: the noble truths

original: bden pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bden pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: are taught to be devoid of intrinsic existence. This is the meaning of the twenty-fourth chapter.

original: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du ba ltas te /
analyzed: dbang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra skabs 'dir yang dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don dang / gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don du ba ltas te /
translated: The word “power” in this context means the power of the reason that engages the thesis, and it also means the power of the reason that engages the meaning of the text that will be presented below.

original: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is the same as before.

original: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la dam bcas pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With respect to that, in terms of the power of the reason that engages the thesis,

original: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: now, in the same way, the refutation of the specific counter-thesis of emptiness is stated.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsams pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas rkyen brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po brtsams pa'i skabs su dngos po thams cad skye ba med par dam bca' ba mdzad pas /
translated: When the author of the treatise composed the first chapter, the examination of conditions, he made the thesis that all things are unarisen.

original: 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan bcos mdzad pas /
translated: Therefore, here also, the author of the treatise

original: sngar ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
analyzed: sngar ji ltar dam bcas pa de la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i don gyi dbang du byas nas de skad smras te /
translated: stated that in terms of the power of the reason that engages the thesis as it was previously made.

original: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rang gi phyogs yin no //
translated: Emptiness is his own position.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol ba'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni phyir rgol ba'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is the position of the opponent.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du smra ba yin no //
translated: They propound that things exist by their own intrinsic reality.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa /
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyogs snga ma nye bar gzhag pa /
translated: The “distinction” is the opponent’s position that things are established as existing by their own intrinsic reality.🔽Later, in the root text, it says:

original: 'og nas / gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
analyzed: 'og nas / gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
translated: If all this is empty,

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
translated: There would be no arising and no disintegration.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams //
translated: The four noble truths

original: khyod la med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod la med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: Would not exist for you.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa drug gis dbu ma pa don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba la glags yod pa'i tshig dag bstan nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig le'ur byas pa drug gis dbu ma pa don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba la glags yod pa'i tshig dag bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the opponent’s position is presented in six root verses, which are statements that undermine the Mādhyamika’s position that ultimately things are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: rang gis don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rang gis don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The opponent then says, “Things do exist by their own intrinsic reality ultimately.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag ston pa yin no //
translated: “Because they have the nature of arising and ceasing” and so on, he presents the inferences that prove that things exist essentially.

original: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa nyi shu bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dgag pas zhes bya ba ni de dgag pa'i dbang du byas nas rab tu byed pa nyi shu bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Refuting those” means that the twenty-fourth chapter is composed in order to refute those.

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas /🔽'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras @232b te ;
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu bzhi pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras @232b te ;
translated: In terms of the meaning of the passages that will be cited below,🔽it is said that the twenty-fourth chapter is composed in order to demonstrate that the noble truths are essenceless.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu bzhi pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu bzhi pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas /
translated: The meaning of the passages from the twenty-fourth chapter, the chapter on the noble truths, which will be cited below, is the demonstration that the noble truths are essenceless.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
translated: It is in this sense that the above statement is made.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
translated: What is the result of this chapter?

original: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
translated: By what process is that result attained?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The teaching of the realitylessness of the truths of the noble ones is the result of this chapter.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas /
translated: And that result is attained by the process of refuting the specific resistances to emptiness.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i mtshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir /
translated: Therefore, the commentator, in this context of the introduction to the chapter,

original: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
translated: first teaches the result of the means and the means.🔽In order to demonstrate just that, he says,🔽“The specific resistances to emptiness,”

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and so on.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: khyod kyis bstan pa'i tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: khyod kyis bstan pa'i tshul gyis ni //
translated: By your system of teaching,

original: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //

original: stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa'i phyir /

translated: By this, they show an argument that refutes you Mādhyamikas,

original: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pas /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pas /

analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /

analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni stong pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gal te 'di ltar kun stong pa yang stong pa'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, if all this is empty, because of being empty, arising and disintegration would not exist. It would follow that the four noble truths and so on would not exist.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: de'i phyir skyon 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon 'di ltar 'gyur te /

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no origination and destruction,🔽that which is not arisen is not suffering, and therefore the truth of suffering does not exist.

analyzed: ma skyes pa ni sdug bsngal ma yin pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa med pa dang / de med pa'i phyir gang las /

analyzed: de kun 'byung ba de kun 'byung yin pa //

analyzed: de yang med pas / kun 'byung gi bden pa med pa dang / kun 'byung med na de 'gog @233a * //

original: pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: And if the origin does not exist, because its cessation does not exist,🔽the truth of cessation does not exist.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa med pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa med na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa med pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa med na /

original: lam gyi bden pa yang med pas /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa yang med pas /
translated: the truth of the path does not exist.🔽Therefore,

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams // khyod la med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: for you, the four noble truths

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: would not exist.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi med pas //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi med pas //
translated: And because the four noble truths do not exist,

original: rnal 'byor pas de dag yongs su shes pa dang / spang ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa'i mngon par brtson pa mi 'thob pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas de dag yongs su shes pa dang / spang ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa'i mngon par brtson pa mi 'thob pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the yogi/nī does not attain the complete understanding, abandonment, actualization, and cultivation of those,

original: des na rnal 'byor ba skye ba dang 'chi bas 'jigs pa rnams kyis /🔽'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po yongs su shes pa dang / spang ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa'i yul la sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba dang /
analyzed: des na rnal 'byor ba skye ba dang 'chi bas 'jigs pa rnams kyis / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po yongs su shes pa dang / spang ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa'i yul la sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba dang /
translated: therefore, those yogi/nis who fear birth and death🔽should strive to completely understand, abandon, actualize, and cultivate the four noble truths.

original: lam bsgom par bya ba'i mngon par brtson pa gang yin pa de mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: lam bsgom par bya ba'i mngon par brtson pa gang yin pa de mi 'thad pas /
translated: Since the complete understanding of suffering, the abandonment of the origin, the actualization of cessation, and the cultivation of the path are not tenable,

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: therefore, it is said:

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi med pas //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi med pas //
translated: Because the four noble truths do not exist,🔽complete understanding, abandonment,

original: yongs su shes dang spang ba dang // bsgom dang mngon du bya ba dag /'thad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su shes dang spang ba dang // bsgom dang mngon du bya ba dag /'thad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: cultivation, and actualization are not tenable.

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: This is what he said.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i sgra bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i sgra bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the etymological explanation of the term “noble truth,”

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa'am /
translated: he said, “Noble truth” is the truth of the noble ones,

original: 'phags par byed pa'i bden pa'am /🔽'phags pa yang yin la /
analyzed: 'phags par byed pa'i bden pa'am / 'phags pa yang yin la /
translated: or it is the truth that makes one noble,

original: bden pa yang yin pas 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa yang yin pas 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: or it is noble and truth, thus it is a noble truth.

original: bden pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa dang / ma nor ba zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa dang / ma nor ba zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: “ Truth” is a synonym for reality and non-error.

original: 'dir bsgom pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba gnyis bsnor ba ni tshigs su bcad pa bsdeb pa'i dbang gis so zhes bya bas ni de ltar bsnor ba ni tshig bde bar byas kyi don gyis ni /
analyzed: 'dir bsgom pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba gnyis bsnor ba ni tshigs su bcad pa bsdeb pa'i dbang gis so zhes bya bas ni de ltar bsnor ba ni tshig bde bar byas kyi don gyis ni /
translated: Here, the two, cultivation and realization, are combined because of the power of the meter. Thus, the combination is for the sake of euphony.

original: 'gog pa sngar bstan pa la lam phyis smos pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'gog pa sngar bstan pa la lam phyis smos pa yin par bstan to //
translated: But in terms of meaning, it is taught that cessation is taught first and the path is mentioned later.

original: gzhan yang de ltar /
analyzed: gzhan yang de ltar /
translated: Moreover, it is like this.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag med pas dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi yang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag med pas dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi yang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the error that the four fruits of the spiritual practitioner would not exist because the four noble truths would not exist,🔽in response to that, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: yang gzhan yang khyod la de dag yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang khyod la de dag yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Moreover, for you, since those do not exist,

original: 'phags @233b pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: 'phags @233b pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: the four noble truths do not exist.

original: 'bras bu bzhi yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi yang yod ma yin //
translated: The four fruits would not exist.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba dag ste zhes bya ba smras so //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi med pas /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba dag ste zhes bya ba smras so // 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi med pas /
translated: The four fruits are called the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more birth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the fruit of arhatship.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi ji ltar med par 'gyur ba'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi ji ltar med par 'gyur ba'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the logic by which the four fruits of the spiritual practitioner would not exist because the four noble truths do not exist,🔽Nāgārjuna explains:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad kyi skyon gyi bud shing dag 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad kyi skyon gyi bud shing dag 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis /
translated: The faults of the ninety-eight latent afflictions, such as the afflicted view of the self, doubt, and holding a discipline and ritual to be paramount, are the firewood of the afflictions.🔽The fire of seeing the noble truths burns them, and the path of cultivation consumes them.

original: mthong ba'i mes bsreg par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i mes bsreg par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi med na /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi med na /
translated: If the four fruits of the sramana do not exist,

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag bzhi yang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag bzhi yang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir de ltar /
translated: then the error would ensue that the four persons who abide in the fruits would not exist.

original: 'bras bu med na 'bras gnas med //
analyzed: 'bras bu med na 'bras gnas med //
translated: Thus he says: If the fruits do not exist, then those who abide in the fruits do not exist.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa de dag go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa de dag go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The four fruits are the fruits of stream enterer, once returner, nonreturner, and arhat.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa med na /
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa med na /
translated: If those who abide in the fruits do not exist,🔽then the eight kinds of noble persons would not exist.

original: lam la yang gnas pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam la yang gnas pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the error that the path would also be non-existent, he says:

original: zhugs pa dag kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: zhugs pa dag kyang yod ma yin //
translated: Nor are there any who have entered.

original: zhugs pa dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i lam la gnas pa dag go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhugs pa dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i lam la gnas pa dag go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Those who have entered are those who abide in the path of the stream-enterer and so on.
